column1: Windows: Aptana Studio Installer: Studio does not install JRE and hence fails installation
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
This is regression issue since earlier studio used to get installed with JRE successfully.

*Steps To Replicate*:
1. Download *Aptana Studio RC build*
2. Try installing same on clean windows 7 machine.

Actual: {color:red} *Some Prerequisite JRE could not be downloaded error appears. Refer screenshot.* {color}
Expected: No error should appear. Installation must be successful.
column164: 05/Jun/14 6:08 AM;cwilliams;I need to point the aptana installer at a go.appcelerator.com redirect to grab the JRE. Right now, I don't have access to post that JRE, so I can't finish this ticket.
column165: 05/Jun/14 6:55 AM;cwilliams;Pushed fix to installer on all three branches. Now uses redirects for the pre-requisite installers. Points at go.appcelerator.com/installer_jre_windows for JRE.

column1: PyDev no longer installed after update
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Updated Aptana Studio 3 to new version.

Note: Trying to install Pydev using the instructions here: http://download.appcelerator.com/aptana/studio3/pydev/update/stable/ gives the message that 'pydev is already installed'.  But Pydev functionality is still not available, and the Preferences menu does not list Pydev.

Reverting to Aptana Studio v3.4.1 restores the Pydev functionality.

h3. Actual Result
 Afterward update of Aptana Studio 3, Pydev isn't installed and can't  be reinstalled.

h3. Expected Result
Should be seamless, with no steps needed to reinstall Pydev or make sure it isn't clobbered by update.
column164: 03/Jan/14 11:44 AM;cwilliams;[~bondgeek] From the logs, it looks like you're trying to install PyDev 3.1.0 over top and Studio already has 3.0.0 installed/bundled. You should already have PyDev functionality. If you want to upgrade, be sure to upgrade Studio itself and it should contain the latest PyDev packaged in.
column165: 05/Jan/14 7:15 PM;mxia;Pushed the fix to RC stream. Please try updating using the corresponding url in http://preview.appcelerator.com/studio/ (under Aptana Studio tab).
column166: 05/Jan/14 8:32 PM;mxia;Hmm, still didn't work after making everything in Pydev 1.6 compatible. Re-opening.
column167: 08/Jan/14 5:26 PM;mxia;Found the cause to be PyDev having plugins that required JRE 1.7. Pushed the fix, and it will be available in the next update.
column168: 09/Jan/14 8:17 PM;mhamann;I'm having this issue as well, and it's in the critical path. Is there a workaround prior to the next release? Or, when is the next update scheduled?
column169: 09/Jan/14 9:15 PM;mxia;You could update to the beta stream using the update site http://preview.appcelerator.com/aptana/studio3/standalone/update/beta/.

column1: Slow text entry with large PHP files
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When typing code into a text window, and using PHP syntax highlighting, text entry is around 1 character every 500 milliseconds. Issue started 2 nights ago (on current nightly builds)

Is there a way to roll back to a few days before ?

column176:
15/Jun/12 7:58 AM;neill;Hi Ingo,

Yes I reverted from 3.1.3 to 3.1.2 and the issue was on 3.1.3.

So, for your Project>Clean, I'm back on 3.1.3. I've done a project>clean and the problem still exists.

In my original test I had over 2500 lines in the file, but I've just tested it on one with 1250 and the problem is there. 

I've noticed that it comes on once I stop typing for a short while so it registers an error.
Before that it was ok, so I think it must be connected with the PHP error checking/parsing code. It only happens if I'm at the end(ish) of the file, not at the beginning (so there are 1000 lines above where I am typing).

CPU goes up to 95% and higher this time. So something is busy doing nothing :-)

Maybe it would be worth doing a check on your CPU usage as you are typing in to a (say) 3000 line file at the end. If it goes up hugely, but you're not noticing a performance difference, then I'd guess you're seeing the problem but have a powerful enough machine for it to not affect your typing.

Cheers

Neill

While testing with function.php I saw spikes at the end of each character as was reported but only for a split second. Only real time that typing paused is when content assist popped up, causing the display to lag for a period while it loaded.
column178: 15/Jun/12 9:12 AM;ingo;slowfile.php demonstrates slow typing for me but it doesn't appear to matter where in the file I am. Looking at https://jira.appcelerator.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=12960, I suspect APSTUD-4778 and APSTUD-4388 as possible culprits.

column181:
16/Jun/12 12:38 AM;neill;Hi Ingo,

I've done the test you've asked Carl to look at (holding down a key) - it does do s'pause's'pause' the same as doing it individually (and with other letters too ... ho ho)

If Clayton is seeing a spike at the end of the letters, then the fact it is not significantly slowing down his typing might be down to differences in power of machine - mine is a 7 year old Dell Dimension 3000 and am running a vanilla install of Mageia 2 with the standalone Aptana version if that helps.

Also turning off Content Assist as requested ... didn't make any difference. Problem still exists.

Just to state the obvious (please don't take this the wrong way), you have two versions 3.1.3 and 3.1.2 that differ with this problem. Can't you do a git/svn/... difference on the code to see what changes were made to help pin down likely causes? 

If you can package up various test versions (e.g. at various different stages of commits between these versions) as a standalone download, I'm happy to test out these versions to see which might contain the error code. Or, you give me details on how to be able to pull out versions from some test branch and set them up locally, I can do that if packaging them up is a lot of work and it isn't too much work for me to do that at this end :-)

Regards

Neill
column182: 16/Jun/12 12:40 AM;neill;p.s. or if you package up the latest nightly build (or tell me how to get it) I'll test that one, as you may have already fixed the problem since 3.1.3

I'm going to try reverting a change or two to see if one of those is the culprit and we'll let you know how to test the results.
column185: 16/Jun/12 6:23 AM;neofuture;sorry only just got the email, but yes i agree with Neill above. one thing i noticed, if you paste a large block in, although it does take a second or 2 its not as long as if you had typed all the code in (if you get my jist)
column186:
16/Jun/12 9:12 PM;neill;Hi Ingo,

Yes sorry I was being sloppy in my terminology - I meant different commits rather than a diff. If it's not too much effort, why don't we do the divide-and-conquer route to finding which commit contains the bug? If you do four at quarter, half and three-quarters up the commit chain between 3.1.2 and 3.1.3, I'll let you know which one it appears in first. Then we'll do a second round on the remaining commits in the appropriate section which should pin you down to around 5 possible commits remaining (basing it on 80 commits - you said it was 70). A third round of the remaining will nail the commit. Of course this assumes it's a single cause of error, but probably quickest way to go.

Cheers

Neill
column187:
17/Jun/12 12:24 AM;ingo;Hi Neill,

Sounds good, and we truly appreciate you giving us this feedback.

So, I've done one shot in the dark on what I believe _might_ be the commit. We'll try that first since it seems a likely culprit. If that doesn't work, we'll do what you suggest, but the process will be basically identical.

To keep things simple, we're going to be downloading from the "release" stream. I've converted that to build specific versions with fixes.

# Download the standalone version of Studio from preview.appcelerator.com, but change the URL from the main download links to say "beta" instead of release. For you, that URL might be http://preview.appcelerator.com/aptana/studio3/standalone/install/beta/studio3.linux.gtk.x86.zip or http://preview.appcelerator.com/aptana/studio3/standalone/install/beta/studio3.linux.gtk.x86_64.zip. Save it to a different location than your current install.
# You can use this against your existing workspace, but just to make things super-clean, I would suggest using a new workspace, creating a new PHP project, and using one of the test PHP files attached to this ticket.
# Double check the version is 3.1.4.201206160958
# Now go to Preferences > Aptana Studio > Troubleshooting. Turn on "All", "Specific Components" and "com.aptana.parsing/debug" and "com.aptana.parsing/debug/parsing". See the screenshot I've attached
# Now restart Aptana Studio. Sometimes this preference needs a reboot to work
# Open a terminal window and navigate to your workspace/.metadata and do a 'tail -f .log'. That will allow you to see anything written out to your log file easily.
# Start typing as you would expect. It should be writing out as it's parsing the file. See if that correlates with either:
## An improvement in the situation
## The slowdown that you see

The messages will look like:

{code}
!ENTRY com.aptana.parsing 1 0 2012-06-17 07:13:07.170
!MESSAGE (Build 3.1.4.201206160958) [INFO] com.aptana.parsing/debug/parsing Parsing file. Caching key 'com.aptana.contenttype.html:1,086,118,550'.

!ENTRY com.aptana.parsing 1 0 2012-06-17 07:13:07.640
!MESSAGE (Build 3.1.4.201206160958) [INFO] com.aptana.parsing/debug/parsing Parsing cache miss for key 'com.aptana.contenttype.html:1,086,118,550'.

!ENTRY com.aptana.parsing 1 0 2012-06-17 07:13:07.642
!MESSAGE (Build 3.1.4.201206160958) [INFO] com.aptana.parsing/debug/parsing Parsing file. Caching key 'com.aptana.contenttype.html:1,086,118,550'.

!ENTRY com.aptana.parsing 1 0 2012-06-17 07:13:08.407
!MESSAGE (Build 3.1.4.201206160958) [INFO] com.aptana.parsing/debug/parsing Parsing cache hit for key 'com.aptana.contenttype.php:1,086,118,550'.
{code}

Please attach your log file to the ticket with any results. Thanks!
column188:
17/Jun/12 2:36 AM;neill;Hi Ingo,

Ok, I've downloaded and started up with a new project and used the slowfile.php typing at the end of it or at the beginning. I turned off the Content Assist too.

The news is mixed - the behaviour is different but not correct. The typing is faster (a just noticeable lag behind) but there are long pauses between when I start typing and when it starts appearing. Sometimes it's immediate. I stop, then start again and there's a long pause. Other times the long pause is straight away.
Also it happens at the beginning of the file and at the end which is different to before.

For comparison, I checked this with 3.1.2 and typing was the same speed at beginning and end with the same file and no noticeable lag.

I can't see how to attach a file here - possibly because I'm only a watcher? If you can give me instructions how to I'll add the log file. Otherwise I'll have to post it here as a comment.

So, I think this commit has an effect on the typing but maybe because it is affecting something else that's causing the problem (i.e. it's ameliorating it not causing it)?

Cheers

Neill

column192:
17/Jun/12 4:19 AM;neill;Ok, I've done the tests more thoroughly and here are the results ...

If I create a new project and have a 10000 odd line file (made from one of my files that I know causes problems), 3.1.4 works fine. Great I thought - problem solved ... except I hadn't proven that 3.1.3 didn't work with this new project. So I tested 3.1.3 on this new project and ... bugger that one also worked.

So now I needed to test 3.1.4 on the project where I know 3.1.3 also failed and ... it also failed in the same way that 3.1.3 does (i.e. fine at the top of the file and slow at the bottom). I cleaned and rebuilt the project.

So the conclusion must be that the size of the workspace is also relevant. My project is about 7500 files.

I would say the easiest way forward is the divide-and-conquer route and I would suggest you do 4 versions at a go evenly spaced as that reduces the number of backwards-and-forwards we need to do and I can be thorough about the tests. So long as the naming works :-) 

Also to verify, perhaps we should have one built according to this method that is exactly the same as 3.1.2, and 3.1.3 so we can check that that they are fine and broken respectively just to eliminate any weird changes there.

Cheers

Neill
column193: 17/Jun/12 4:19 AM;neill;p.s. I've tested all of these with workspace polling off as (as per my other bug report) I know that causes issues on my system.

Either way, please set up a workspace with just a single project (best with a single file, but if that doesn't help, then multiple finales from your big project), and make sure that the issue happens in a new download of 3.1.3 but not 3.1.2

17/Jun/12 8:19 PM;neill;Hi Ingo

In which case I've already tested 3.1.2 and 3.1.3 in the way you require as that's how I reverted back to 3.1.2 and how I got 3.1.3. I'll do a fresh download of 3.1.3 as requestesd.

I do have a log for you, but can't see how to attach it here as I'm only a watcher. How do I do that?

Neill
column197:
17/Jun/12 10:47 PM;neill;Hi Ingo

Some good news. I think this was what you were getting at with the new project bit.

These are the tests I've just done and results - conclusion is pretty obvious
a) downloaded 3.1.3 from Aptana (not used upgraded version)
b) created a new workspace
c) imported my project to the new workspace copying files. No problems with edits 
d) Switched workspace to the old one. Problem there 
e) Imported project to new workspace without copying files. No problem.

Conclusion - it's the workspace that is causing the problem.

Why?

f) Copied all plugins from the old workspace to the new one. Problem there.
g) Created a new project with single large file in new workspace with old plugins. Problem there.

Conclusion - one or more plugins that I have are incompatible with this build of 3.1.3.

I haven't worked out which one yet, but will do some more tests to see if I can find out.

So the bug looks like the upgrades aren't taking care of pre-existing plugins properly. Will get back to you later with results of plugin swapovers.

Cheers

Neill
column198:
18/Jun/12 1:17 AM;neill;Hi Ingo and Carl

Ok, think I found it. But as it took me ages, I'll build up the suspension of what it is ...

From above I'd guessed plugins were important, so starting with a 3.1.2 plugins directory in a clean workspace, I swapped in 3.1.3 plugins in until the problem disappeared. 

It went away with the org.eclipse.core.runtime folder which it turns out (yes I know you know this Ingo :-) ) contains the settings preferences.

So I started with a 3.1.3 set of plugins, and slowly changed the settings until I found one that buggered up the editing and it was ... no really ... yes ... Enable word wrap under Aptana>Editors!!

So see if you can reproduce it by 

a) starting with a new workspace for 3.1.3 which will have word-wrap off
b) creating a file of about 3000 lines
c) check it types ok
d) set word-wrap on and reboot Aptana
e) check it doesn't type ok.

Carl, simply turn word-wrap off (if you are using it), reboot and see if that fixes it.

On the point of settings I've got a feature request about the default tabs settings on all of the editors which I'll post up separately but moan about here - each editor by default doesn't use the global settings for tabs so you need to go through each one and change it. Why? Global settings would be the obvious default unless otherwise stated and to have to change each one is a pain-in-the-butt type of thing.

Anyway hope you can reproduce it, and find a commit that played around with word-wrap!

BTW - love the fact you can turn wordwrap on and off in a file - very useful!

Cheers

Neill
column199:
18/Jun/12 1:40 AM;neill;p.s. (I know - you're getting sick of my messages ... !!!)

I've upgraded my 3.1.2 version to 3.1.3 and with word wrap on there was a problem. With word-wrap off everything hunky-dory, so it's fixed my problem.

p.p.s. while rooting around in the plugins, I came across the .history in the org.eclipse.core.resources - seems to be an unlimited history with, in mine, over 10,000 odd files in it. Is it worth restricting that down to use less files? (i.e. limit the history)

column214: 19/Jun/12 1:25 AM;cwilliams;The issue boiled down to a single line in CommonPresentationReconciler that I added as a performance improvement to limit the number of style ranges produced. Ultimately it ended up going through a codepath that would redraw very large sections of the TextViewer needlessly. TextViewer#addPresentation appears to ignore the coverage range when updating styles with a default style range. I'm guessing this is a bug in Eclipse itself, since that seems to impact performance severely if you incrementally set style ranges - it likely would only work Ok if you're setting style ranges once for the whole document.

column1: PyDev needs to support new syntax from Python 3.3

column59: The Python 3 grammar must be updated to support the new 'yield from' expression. See: http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0380/ The full support for this change includes: 1. AST change 2. Grammar change 3. Pretty-print Note: it'll be done in the existing Python 3 grammar (as Python 3.2 is still not used a lot, we'll not create a separate 3.3 grammar just for that change -- so, there should be no changes in the UI).

column1: Trying to write a string that is too long and will overflow the recorded length maximum
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
If you start aptana and you have some file open, aptana will freeze and write with the following error message: "Trying to write a string that is too long and will overflow the recorded length maximum".

To fix this you have to kill anptana and restart it. If you restart aptana you mast close all tabs as fast as you can, because if you need longer than 2 secounds, aptana will freeze again.

I added the log file for you.

[10:17:49 AM] Ingo Muschenetz:  Add logging to write out the project name
[10:19:33 AM] Ingo Muschenetz:  May need to split into two tickets. Perhaps put a cap on the number of types inferred.
column172: 12/Sep/12 6:35 AM;leo.unglaub;@Clayton: Well, i am not making this stuff up. Thats a real error log.
column173:
13/Sep/12 2:04 AM;cwilliams;@Leo: We believe you :) We're just having a very difficult time reproducing this to get down to the root cause. As a result, all I can do is add some error handling at the current level and have it point to the issue as best it can. In this case, the logs are showing the actual underlying string that's being written. Obviously it's showing JS indexing going haywire, in particular the writing of inferred types for a property (in this case Window.DECIMAL_SEPARATOR).

So, I'm going to add some more error handling in that layer to try and alleviate the symptoms of the issue and also try and point the blame closer to the root cause. The changes I'm making are these:
- When we can't write this monster string to the index, catch the exception, log it and then skip that string but continue on. Currently we'd catch at a higher-level that basically blew up the index file and retried, which probably just caused the system to thrash in an infinite loop for this case.
- Add some validation to the type names being set on properties/functions. If the name contains unexpected characters (like a comma) then try and "fix" the type name but also log the bad name that was trying to be set and spit out a stacktrace of the call so we can see who was trying to set this bad type name. There's a number of entry points so it's hard to pinpoint which one may be buggy. My best guess is that there's some bad wrapping/unwrapping of type information going on for JS functions and their return types.
column174:
13/Sep/12 7:15 AM;cwilliams;Resolving as needs more info for now.

@leo.unglaub: Please grab a nightly build tomorrow and see if the changes I made help any (and if the logs have any further details on the root cause). Thanks!
column175: 13/Sep/12 7:28 AM;leo.unglaub;Okay, thanks for the explaining above. I an always using the nightly and i am posting the log if this will happens again. thanks for your work on this issue.!
column176: 13/Sep/12 7:29 AM;leo.unglaub;PS: I am getting all mails from JIRA twice. sience last night. just so you know.
column177: 13/Sep/12 11:56 PM;cwilliams;I've marked APSTUD-4959 as a duplicate of this issue. Hopefully we can get down to the root cause in the JS function signature wrapping/unwrapping between Leo and Thomas :) In any case, I think the latest changes in nightly should at least alleviate some of the worst symptoms like eating up the CPU.
column178: 14/Sep/12 12:40 AM;leo.unglaub;So, i have installed the nightly and restarted aptana a view times. I was unable of getting the error, but the log files is full of errors. The problem is that i can't force a reindexing on all projects, because the "clean" windows is sonly showing a few, but no all open projects. Please see the screenshot.
column179: 20/Sep/12 3:52 AM;cwilliams;Not sure why the clean dialog is not showing all the projects. But in any case, now that I'm bailing if we see what looks to be a bad type, that's what's getting logged. I'm actually able to reproduce this locally now, so hopefully I can dive deeper to find out the root cause (unfortunately it looks to be pretty complicated). But one simple case is described in APSTUD-7438, which I will address today.
column180: 20/Sep/12 10:48 PM;cwilliams;Resolving as Fixed since this particular blocking behavior is now fixed and confirmed by Leo. I've opened APSTUD-7442 and APSTUD-7438 to handle the two cases of bad type information I'm seeing from the new logging added in this ticket.

column1: PyDev Mylyn integration cannot be installed on Eclipse 4.2
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
It seems that in Eclipse 4.2, the PyDev Mylyn integration cannot be installed even if Mylyn is present on the system.

It seems to be a p2 bug... the integration is a single feature.xml file with the contents below, and it seems like p2 does not consider the new mylyn version (3.8) to be greater than the specified version (2.0). It should be possible just removing the version from things and it should work properly (the support needed for the PyDev integration has been available for so long that we shouldn't need to specify a version anymore).

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<feature
      id="org.python.pydev.mylyn.feature"
      label="Pydev Mylyn Integration"
      version="0.3.0"
      provider-name="Fabio Zadrozny">

   <description>
      Integration of Mylyn with Pydev.
   </description>

   <copyright>
      (c) Fabio Zadrozny
   </copyright>

   <license url="http://www.opensource.org/licenses/eclipse-1.0.php">
      Eclipse Public License
   </license>

   <requires>
      <import plugin="org.python.pydev" version="1.3.7" match="greaterOrEqual"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ui.ide"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.runtime"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ui"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.resources"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ui.navigator"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ui.views"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.mylyn" version="2.0.0.v20070627-1400" match="greaterOrEqual"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.mylyn.context.core"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.mylyn.context.ui"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.mylyn.ide.ui"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.mylyn.resources.ui"/>
   </requires>

   <plugin
         id="org.python.pydev.mylyn"
         download-size="0"
         install-size="0"
         version="0.3.0"
         unpack="false"/>

</feature>
column164: 11/Jul/12 10:53 PM;fzadrozny;Created a 0.4.0 version and published it.
column165:
13/Jul/12 4:26 AM;cheadley;Fabio,
What is my replication case, just try to install this plugin into Eclipse 4.2? Where can I find the needed files to do so?
column166: 13/Jul/12 11:47 AM;fzadrozny;Yes, just try to install the pydev mylyn integration from http://pydev.org/updates (you must have mylyn already installed).
column167: 16/Jul/12 4:28 AM;cheadley;I was able to install PyDev Mylyn Integration 0.4.0 into Eclipse Version: Juno Release Build id: 20120614-1722 with mylyn installed (attempted to install, installer said it was installed and to run update. Update said it was up to date). No errors were reported, nothing output in the log. Closing ticket.

column1: Hitting tab in the editor does not insert a tab.
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
In some cases (was revealed when having an older workspace), hitting tab in an editor does not insert a tab.
Looking at the preferences, the editor's setting for the tab-space (width) was zero.
column164:
19/Mar/12 6:36 AM;sgibly;This may be a result of a formatter preferences issue that pushes zeros into the editor's tab-width.

We now do some extra checks for the values we get from the preferences, and make sure that they are never zeros.
column165: 19/Mar/12 7:47 AM;cheadley;Shalom, whats a good way for me to verify this ticket?
column166:
19/Mar/12 8:04 AM;sgibly;(it will be available in the next release build)
The verification is tricky, since the fix suppose to prevent that kind of issues.

I say, if you see that issue again, re-open this ticket.
column167: 20/Mar/12 1:59 AM;cwilliams;Verified in Titanium Studio 2.0.0.201203191919

column1: No deployment option exists in Deploy My Application dialog for Web project
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
1. Create a web project via File > New > Web Project;
2. Right-click on the project and select Publish > Run Web Deployment Wizard.

Expected result: the dialog should contain options for FTP, Capistrano, Heroku, etc.

Actual result: the list is empty.

I suspect this has to do with the refactoring of deploy.ui plugin, and the compilation errors we saw and somehow fixed could be related as well.
column164: 13/Jun/12 9:09 AM;mxia;Pushed the fix to development.
column165: 14/Jun/12 9:06 AM;mxia;Verified on Titanium Studio build 2.1.0.201206131907.

column1: Font size changes the when you open up a new file
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When I open a file, the font size looks 1pt or 2pt smaller than the selected font size.
If I then force a refresh, like selecting "block selection mode", everything resets to normal.

Both "General -> Appereance -> Colors and Fotns" and "Aptana Studio -> Themes" seems ok, showing the correct font size.
Is there another config to look at and try find a font-size mismatch?

column1: Support rbenv usage
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
I'm using aptana studio 3 in my mac, osx lion, and I'm using rbenv to install rubies, but when I try to run the debugger in aptana I always got this error:

    /Users/nebiros/.rbenv/shims/ruby: line 4: exec: rbenv: not found

I already set some environment variables in the aptana ruby debug configuration window:

    RBENV_ROOT: /Users/nebiros/.rbenv 
    RUBYLIB: /Users/nebiros/.rbenv/versions/1.9.2-p290/lib/ruby/1.9.1

I'm trying to run this command:

 - Program: /Users/nebiros/.rbenv/shims/bundle
 - Interpreter Arguments: -d
 - Program Arguments: exec rake dreadful_dog:process_content --trace -- -f ./assets/test_ssss_content.zip -d /tmp
 - Working Directory: /Users/nebiros/Projects/dreadful_dog
column164:
20/Jan/12 4:32 AM;cwilliams;I haven't done any sort of work to make sure we're compatible with rbenv, so in general, I'm not 100% certain we're working properly there. Beyond that, the error it's showing would seem to point to ~/.rbenv/bin not being on $PATH (for that process).

One thing you may want to try is to open a file inside Studio, then go to Commands > Bundle Development > Show ENV and make note of what value is there for PATH. That is the PATH that Studio has, and which should get passed down to any launches like the debugger.

Also something useful to know would be if you can run the the script in a non-debug launch config (Run > Run configurations... > Ruby application).
column165:
20/Jan/12 4:43 AM;nebiros;Hey Chris,

So this is what I got when I run "Show ENV" command, the shims folder (/Users/nebiros/.rbenv/shims) is there

PATH: /Users/nebiros/.rbenv/shims:/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/share/python:/Developer/usr/bin:/usr/local/zend/bin:/usr/local/zend/mysql/bin:/usr/local/Cellar/android-sdk/r16/tools:/Users/nebiros/.rbenv/shims:/usr/local/Cellar/go/r60.3/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/X11/bin

I run the Rakefile as a non-debug app, doesn't work, no errors, nothing :S.
column166:
24/Jan/12 3:54 AM;cwilliams;So, regardless of rbenv, I think our behavior for choosing to run a Rakefile is busted, because we actually need to launch rake on the parent directory, rather than trying to "run" the Rakefile itself as a ruby script. As a result, I've opened APSTUD-4269.

For this ticket, I'll need to handle rbenv in general, since after playing a bit with it, it appears that you can't run the ruby shim on another binary shim (i.e. "ruby rake" or "ruby rdebug-ide -- <file>"). So, I'll need to run the binary shims directly instead of under "ruby" binary in this case.
column167: 26/Jan/12 11:11 PM;cwilliams;Pushed fix to 'development' branch.
column168: 18/Mar/12 10:25 PM;cwilliams;It properly finds and uses ruby installations through rbenv. verified in Titanium Studio 2.0.1.201203192423

column1: Research heap exception and excessive I/O during indexing JS
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Some profiling has been done already which has identified that:

# A large number of strings/char[] are being held onto during indexing. I think it's safe to assume that's related to JS inferencing, but that will need to be confirmed. Once that is verified, we need to look into why that is happening.
# There are a huge number of disk writes occurring during JS inferencing. I confirmed this by re-indexing the referenced project with JS indexing on and off. We know the issue is coming from JS inferencing due to the fact that Index is not designed to support reads when doing lots of writes. We will need to determine how we can avoid or how we can minimize reading from the Index during inferencing.
column164: 02/Feb/12 3:04 AM;klindsey;Opened related tickets under APSTUD-4275
column165: 18/Mar/12 12:32 PM;mxia;Closing the ticket as it's a technical task, and the main issue should be verified in the parent ticket.

column1: As a developer I want to be able to turn on and off specific validators for build vs reconcile
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
We need some way to turn off validators individually, and in particular between build vs reconcile. This stems from the poor performance of the JS validators during large builds. They should default to be on for reconcile (only the ones currently on by default) and off for build (likely the same for the CSS/HTML validators). We'll need a preference page similar to the validator pref page we had before (maybe just re-use/fix it to work).

One suggestion is to reuse the existing pref page and instead have a table at the top with two checkbox columns, one for build and one for reconcile. A less-optimal solution is to have two separate lists, one for each type of interaction.

Perhaps we should say "On Typing" as opposed to "Reconcile"? Perhaps that is more user-friendly?

Tasks:
* Change the pref page
* Add some methods/fields to the participants to mark them as validators
* Use a more sane preference key scheme to store the enable/disable
* Create a migration function to migrate the old pref keys to the new scheme
* Some build participants need to be unchangeable or hidden from the end user (like indexing)

column168:
21/Feb/12 5:09 AM;mstepanov;Fixed partitioner part.
https://github.com/aptana/studio3/commit/98c1a85497984668fa9e8c43f13213d74cf13177
column169:
24/Feb/12 8:16 AM;sgibly;Fixed.
The problem (after Max's fix) was that the lexemes we collected backward where blocked by the offset of the string argument. This could happen with strings and with comments inside the call.

The fix now scans back through the partitions and collect all partitions in a distance of 100 characters back. This should cover most contex-info cases.

column1: Convert "New From Template" menu to create "Untitled" files by default
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Currently, the "File > New From Template" menu creates a new project-based file or a new file on the filesystem, depending on the active selection in project explorer (defaulting to the project-based behavior)

Many users want the ability to create a new untitled file. This is possible, but a user would then have to preselect the type of file (i.e. HTML, CSS, etc.). In order to achieve this in Studio 2, we had a selection of wizards that activated and deactivated based on the current selection. This worked, but was a clumsy solution.

A different proposal is that we, by default, make the "New From Template" menu adopt the following behavior:

# File > New From Template. Creates a new untitled file of the specified type (new behavior)
# Right-click on project in Project Explorer view. Creates a new project-based file (current behavior)
# Right-click on file system node in Project Explorer. Creates a new file on the file system (current behavior)

This links with another ticket to make it easier to save this file into a project or file depending on the user's preference.
column164: 29/Jun/11 2:20 AM;ingo;Related ticket is APSTUD-2817
column165: 13/Jul/11 8:36 AM;mxia;Made File > New From Template from the main menu create a new untitled file with initial content from the corresponding template.
column166: 05/Apr/12 5:58 AM;cheadley;Verified working in Windows 7, Ubuntu 11.10, and Mac OS 11.7.3 in Titanium Studio build: 2.0.2.201204041630. Closing ticket.

column1: "Mark Occurrences" freezes IDE on large files
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Steps to reproduce:

# Copy ext-all-debug.js into a new Web project
# Open up the file
# Turn on "Mark Occurrences"
# Click on the first instance of "function"
# note that the annotations in the side bar come up quite quickly, but profiling, it shows a significant performance hit in ThemeingDamagerRepairer.
# At this point the IDE is unusable for quite some time (10-30 seconds)

See screenshots for details.

I noticed that if I only allowed 100 annotations to be created, performance seemed acceptable (though still kinda slow)

|weird_relation	| Weird relation. | Checks if left and right of comparators are 'similar'\*, or both are either numbers or strings. Checks '==', '===', '===','!=', '!==', '!==', '<', '>', '<=', '>='. Warning.  |
|weird_ternary	| Weird ternary. | If the two values we're choosing between are 'similar'\*. Warning. |
|{color:green}wrap_immediate{color}	| Wrap an immediate function invocation in parentheses to assist the reader in understanding that the expression is the result of a function, and not the function itself. | Checks if function  is declared and then immediately invoked for it's return value. See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/939386/immediate-function-invocation-syntax. Warning. | | immed |
|wrap_regexp	| Wrap the /regexp/ literal in parens to disambiguate the slash operator. | Checks for regexp following a 'return' keyword. Warning |
|write_is_wrong	| document.write can be a form of eval. | If 'evil' option is false and there's a call to 'document.write' or 'document.writeln'. Warning. |

column1: Studio Recursively Adds Folders and Folder Contents As Subfolders Upon FileSystem Rename Copy/Paste
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
If you select a file from the Local FileSystem node, select Rename, copy and paste the folder name in place, then proceed or close the dialog window, Studio recursively adds folders and folder contents as subfolders, perhaps to the maximum operating system depth.


Steps to Replicate :

1) Select a folder from Local FileSystem node.
2) Select Context Menu > Rename.
3) CTRL+C folder name string.
4) CTRL+V in place.

Actual Results : Please see capture at http://www.screencast.com/t/xxorH2jOc. Even if you close the dialog window, Studio recursively adds the folder and its contents as subfolders, perhaps to maximum folder depth.

Expected Results : this action should not have any effect on the file system.
column60:
Aptana Studio 3, build: 3.0.7.201112120238
Ubuntu 11.10
Windows XP
Windows Vista
column164: 13/Dec/11 7:24 AM;mxia;This is actually not due to rename, but rather just copy-and-pasting a folder into the same location will cause the issue.
column165:
28/Dec/11 11:28 AM;jwitt;Aptana Studio 3, build: 3.0.7.201112281312
Ubuntu 11.10


This is still happening on Ubuntu, however Studio only increments tree depth by one instead of recursively.
column166: 28/Dec/11 12:28 PM;mxia;This is actually the expected behavior; since the folder is still selected, pasting will paste the folder into itself and thus creates another level underneath.
column167:
28/Dec/11 1:06 PM;jwitt;Dear Michael, 

At present on Ubuntu and Windows (OSX never had experienced this because of its filesystem GUI design) Studio will add the folder even if the end user closes the Confirm Overwrite dialog. Is this according to design. Thank you very much, 

Joel
column168:
28/Dec/11 2:26 PM;jwitt;Dear Michael, 

Please disregard this if the Project Explorer merely sends a paste request to the OS. However if Studio handles this and the folder from which the request is initiated has a child folder of the same name, the paste does not occur in the first child of the root, rather the paste request chains from parent to child like a waterfall. If there are further children of the same name, the request will cascade until there is a child folder that does not contain a folder with the root name. At this point the paste operation occurs and the final child folder is pasted into itself. So if the original structure were :

{noformat}
root
   |
   root
      |
      root
         |
         bedrock
               |
               magma
{noformat}

the operation would result in :

{noformat}
root
   |
   root
      |
      root
         |
         bedrock
         |     |
         |     magma
         |
         root
            |
            bedrock
                  |
                  magma
{noformat}

instead of :

{noformat}
root
   |
   root
   |  |
   |  root
   |     |
   |     bedrock
   |           |
   |           magma
   |
   root
      |
      root
         |
         root
            |
            bedrock
                  |
                  magma
{noformat}

Also, if there are other folders present in the cascade, the request will pick these up and they will snowball down the chain. So if the original structure were :

{noformat}
root
   |
   branch1
   root
      |
      branch2
      root
         |
         branch3
         bedrock
               |
               magma
{noformat}

the result of the rolling paste would be :

{noformat}
root
   |
   branch1
   root
      |
      branch1
      branch2
      root
         |
         branch1
         branch2
         branch3
         bedrock
         |     |
         |     magma
         |
         root
            |
            branch1
            branch2
            branch3
            bedrock
                  |
                  magma
{noformat}

So you can see the entire scope of the behavior clearly. Thank you very much, 

Joel
column169:
09/Jan/12 10:19 AM;mxia;Hi Joel,

The result is actually correct because you're copying the folder and pasting it into itself as a subfolder.  For example, 

{noformat}
root
   |
   root
      |
      root
         |
         bedrock
         |     |
         |     magma
         |
         root
            |
            bedrock
                  |
                  magma
{noformat}

and 

{noformat}
root
   |
   root
   |  |
   |  root
   |     |
   |     bedrock
   |           |
   |           magma
   |
   root
      |
      root
         |
         root
            |
            bedrock
                  |
                  magma
{noformat}

are in fact the same structure as the duplicate root folders on each equivalent level will be merged and shown as one.

Similarly, when we have the structure 

{noformat}
root
   |
   branch1
   root
      |
      branch2
      root
         |
         branch3
         bedrock
               |
               magma
{noformat}

pasting the top level root into itself will indeed result in 

{noformat}
root
   |
   branch1
   root
      |
      branch1
      branch2
      root
         |
         branch1
         branch2
         branch3
         bedrock
         |     |
         |     magma
         |
         root
            |
            branch1
            branch2
            branch3
            bedrock
                  |
                  magma
{noformat}

because all the subfolders are copied as well.

Let me know if this explanation isn't clear.

Thanks.
column170: 13/Mar/12 2:35 AM;cheadley;Verified fixed in Windows 7 and Ubuntu 11.10 with build: 2.0.0.201203121914. Following the steps garners the expected results. Closing Ticket.

column1: Create the UI for user to submit a JIRA ticket
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
There will be a Help > Studio > Submit a Ticket menu, and clicking on it will display a dialog where user could enter the following information:

* Type: Bug, feature, or improvement
* Summary
* Steps to reproduce
* Screenshots (if desired)

We could automatically obtain the following from the IDE:

* Project (Aptana Studio or Titanium Studio)
* Affects version (Studio version, either from the about box for Standalone or the branding plugin for Eclipse plugin case)

We should attach Studio log file and output from Help > Studio > Run Diagnostic Test. We could auto-attach or have checkboxes so user could choose not to (checked by default).

Once the ticket is successfully submitted, we should pop up a corresponding message with a link to the created ticket.
column164:
25/Apr/12 6:35 AM;mxia;Implemented the functionality of submitting a ticket to JIRA from Studio. It adds a Help > Studio > Submit a Ticket menu, and when it's clicked, the workflow is as followed:

1. If this is first use, the initial dialog will include a group for entering user credentials. It re-uses the same class as what the preferences page uses but changes the group text to "User". The subsequent launch of the dialog will not show the group.

2. Type (default to Bug), summary, and description are required; the logs will be checked by default. Each time a file location for the screenshot is browsed and selected, a checkbox will be added so user could unselect it, and the dialog will re-adjust its height if needed.

3. After hitting OK, any failure will be reported in an error dialog, and success will show an information dialog with link to the actual ticket.

Here is a test ticket submitted from Studio: TISTUD-1570.

column1: Add Search scope action to find toolbar
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Search action has a drop-down menu that specifies the scope of the search. If the scope is anything other than 'current file', then it will trigger a search. This provides a quick way of executing a search across multiple files.

The items in the drop-down are as follows:

Search current file - current file
Search Open Files - search opened editors
Search Enclosing Project - search across the project that contains the targeted file
Search Workspace - search the entire workspace

New icons is also needed for the scopes:
Current file (file icon)
Open files (multiple file icon)
Enclosing project (project icon)
Workspace (Globe icon)

Suggest instead scanning the bundles, and if a file type does not have a template attached, suggest creating a entry "File Type > Blank File" for each. column164: 15/Dec/11 6:39 AM;mxia;There was an exception thrown in the malformed case.  Fixed that, and now the outline is updating.  As a note, for the "<tag></tag></tag2>" case, the outline will show "tag" since the first part is valid, and I think that's fine because we should allow user to see the valid part in outline instead of destroying all when there is one closed tag that doesn't have a corresponding open.

column59: When performing the search, convert new lines and spaces into an appropriate regular expression and perform the search
column164: 30/Apr/12 3:52 AM;cwilliams;Probably just want to "normalize" newlines so we can match any of the OS styles
column165:
17/May/12 1:27 AM;cwilliams;This doesn't seem to normalize newlines.

I tried a multiline search that matched, then I changed the file's line endings from between the settings and also pasted mismatched versions (between editor and find bar) in the find box and was able to get a case where they did not match (I think I searched with the version containing \r line endings and the file/editor had \n endings).

Tested on Titanium Studio, build: 2.0.2.201205170725
Build: jenkins-titanium-rcp-release-385 (origin/release)
Date: 17 May 2012, 07:28:27
column166: 17/May/12 1:30 AM;cwilliams;Attaching screenshot where the find text is not matching, but looks like it should. (due to mismatched line endings)
column167:
18/May/12 2:22 AM;nle;@Chris Williams I don't think we should be normalizing newlines, the search is finding a specific string. If you're searching for specifically \n characters, you wouldn't want \r to be returned. If you did, you would just perform a regular expression search. I think this is most evident in copy/paste situations. 

But for instances where the user is entering new line characters via the text box, we first try to use the newline character specified in the preferences, if they haven't set that value, we use the current editor's newline character setting.

This method is not full-proof, so I think eventually we would allow users to specify what newline character they want to use in the Find Bar. I think that's a worthwhile enhancement. I'll open up a task for that
column168: 18/May/12 8:13 AM;nle;The behavior will remain this way for the time being. https://jira.appcelerator.org/browse/APSTUD-4834 has been opened to implement normalizing of newline characters

column1: Add dialog to allow user to choose between saving a new "Untitled" file into a project or the file system
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Then saving a new untitled file, the default mechanism is to bring up the "Save to File System" dialog, allowing them to save a file somewhere on their drive.

This becomes confusing if instead they want to save it into a project.

Unfortunately, we can not universally add this option to all possible untitled files, but for those derived from our editor classes, we propose to do the following:

# override the default behavior in AbstractDecoratedTextEditor.performSaveAs()
# For untitled files, pop up our own dialog asking is the user wishes to save on the file system or in a project (radio button selection). Depending on the choice, we can then pop up the correct subsequent Save As... dialog.

Extra points if we can somehow embed the other Save as dialogs in the "choice" dialog, preventing the user from having to answer two subsequent dialogs.

Also suggest that we could have the user "remember this choice" if they almost always want to do one or the other.
column164: 14/Jul/11 6:44 AM;mxia;Added the dialog with ability to remember the choice user selected.

column1: Remote View FTP Node And Project Connections FTP Node Exhibit Slightly Different Behavior
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
The FTP utility nodes at Remote View and Project Connections possess slightly different behavior.


Steps to Replicate :

1) Open Aptana Studio
2) Open the Remote View and select a valid FTP connection
3) Open the Connection Node Context Menu
4) Note the availability of both the New From Template option and the New > File option
5) Select a project with an associated FTP , expand the project node, expand the Connections node and open the FTP Node Context Menu
6) Note only the New > File option is available, not the New From Template option. To open the New From Template option, the end user must descend one level below the FTP Node into the FTP folder structure.


Actual Results :

The New From Template option is only available via the Remote View FTP node; from a Project Connections FTP Node the end user must select a folder or the workspace within the FTP node to access the New From Template option (please see capture at http://screencast.com/t/Lagaq2pQPa).


Expected Results :

The Remote View and the Project Connections Node should exhibit the same behavior.
column164: 07/Dec/11 9:48 AM;mxia;Added New From Template menu to the FTP connection under the Connections node in Project Explorer.

column1: PyDev: when creating a launch the PYTHONPATH used is incorrect
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
I must say I couldn't reliably reproduce this, but the effect is that when changing the dependencies of a project, the PYTHONPATH used will sometimes not use the proper configuration.

I was able to do a debug session in a production environment and saw that the completion cache related to calculating the dependencies of a project was not being properly flushed properly and inspecting the code I found that there was a case where it was possible that after calling nature.startRequests() the nature.endRequests() method was not properly called as it should.

Also, after doing this fix, it should also take into account that if this happens again for some reason, this should be logged.
column164:
09/Jul/12 10:32 PM;fzadrozny;Fixed:

Git: 036cc41 2012-07-10 fabioz APSTUD-5024: Fix issue where nature.startRequests() would not have a nature.endRequests() called properly.
column165:
12/Jul/12 12:12 AM;cheadley;Fabio,
What is a good replication test for this?
column166:
12/Jul/12 12:19 AM;fzadrozny;It'd be something as:

1. Create 2 PyDev projects: A and B (each with a source folder and external source folders with Python files -- create those interactively because the code-analysis must be triggered to reproduce the issue).
2. Make B reference A
3. Launch a module from project B
4. Create a new project C
5. Make project B reference project A and C
6. Change the module from B to import something from project C
7. Launch that module: the import won't be found because the PYTHONPATH is not correct

column1: PHP 5.4 support
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Hi,
a few days ago the stable version of PHP 5.4 was released. If would be great if Aptana would support the new features like the new short array syntax or traits. Currently Aptana says the code is invalid at this point.

Thanks and greetings
Leo
column164: 26/Mar/12 11:44 AM;leo.unglaub;Do you need some example PHP 5.4 scripts for testing the new functions? If it would help you i would like to write them for you.
column165: 05/Apr/12 4:36 AM;maratd;Same here, this would be a great update. I have been forced to turn off syntax checking so that I can use the new features. Thanks!
column166:
05/Apr/12 4:39 AM;sgibly;@Leo, Yes. Please post any test scripts you have into this ticket.
Thanks!
column167:
05/Apr/12 5:01 AM;maratd;I'm not Leo, but I can help =)

First and foremost, is the addition of the short array syntax:

<?php

$test = ['key' => 'value'];
// is the same as
$test = array('key' => 'value');

?>

Second, is the addition of traits. This addition is too extensive to post, here are the details:

http://us3.php.net/manual/en/language.oop5.traits.php

Finally, there are a ton of minor changes. Here is a list from the Changelog (http://php.net/ChangeLog-5.php):

Added binary numbers format (0b001010).
Added support for Class::{expr}() syntax.
Added closure $this support back.
Added array dereferencing support.
Added callable typehint.
Added indirect method call through array.
Added class member access on instantiation (e.g. (new foo)->bar()) support.
Implemented closure rebinding as parameter to bindTo.

There might be more, but that's all I could see at first glance.

Thank you!
column168:
05/Apr/12 5:15 AM;sgibly;Thanks Marat!
I've created a bunch of sub-tasks for this ticket, so we can estimate it better and push it as soon as we can.

Greetings
Leo

Hope to have an update on that asap.

column178:
13/Sep/13 2:07 AM;kirk olson;I have Aptana Studio 3 Plugin	3.5.0.201309112453 installed.

When I switch "PHP Version" in my project properties to "PHP 5.4.x" I have the correct PHP 5.4 code-assist for a little while. However this setting automagically switches back to "PHP 5.3.x" for some reason, giving me error messages for [...] and traits once again.

column1: Aptana Studio 3.0 initially opens files significantly slower than Studio 1.5
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
In a series of tests, it appears that Aptana Studio 3.x is signifigantly slower than 1.5 when opening files.

Test:
* Empty workspace, except for one web project
* project contains 11 web files, each the homepage of google.com (attached)
* Restart studio. Let all processes finish. Right click on a file and open it in the HTML editor:
** Aptana Studio 1.5: avg. 1.75 sec
** Aptana Studio 3.0.7 avg. 2.35 sec
* Note that the addition of browser previews in 1.5 seems not to make a difference. Removing them did not materially impact the times.

Time to open all files:

Select all files, right-click to open all.

Aptana Studio 1.5: 1.4 seconds
Aptana Studio 3: 1.5-1.7 seconds

Studio 3 is reliably slower, though just a hair. It _feels_ slower too.

Opening to edit state test:

Aptana Studio 1.5: 4 seconds to opening and typing
Aptana Studio 3: 8 seconds to open, but 18 seconds until able to type (waiting on colorization)

FWIW, the typing speed is atrocious in Studio 1.5 in that file (a few chars a sec at best) but opening is way faster, and the browser tabs
seem to have nothing to do with it.
column164:
29/Mar/12 8:23 AM;mxia;1. Do another baseline test with 3.1/2.0 since there are some editor/scanner/parser related changes.
2. In 3.1, open a test file with Eclipse text editor and then our text editor (the one with just our theme applied, not the JS/HTML/CSS specific ones) to see if there is significant difference between the two; if so, it means we need to improve the basic editor infrastructure.
3. Open the test file with our text editor and then the content type specific one to compare the difference there; this indicates improvement needed on the individual scanner and parser.
4. We also made some tradeoff for large files where we perform certain things upfront to make opening them slower, but once they're opened, the typing experience is faster.
column165:
05/Jun/12 1:33 AM;fzadrozny;Profiling:

Initially the main issue found is that the caching does not really work well with our multi-parsing strategy.

When a parse for a large document is done, say, an html with 30 css and 10 js partitions, each of those will end up requesting a new parse and as our parse cache is an LRU of size = 3, the cache is never used in this situation.

On the good side, once we get caches in place properly, when parsing a large document, we may have lots of sub-partitions already cached, which should make the parsing faster when reparsing the full html.

Ideas on approaches:

1. A simple approach is simply making the cache larger (say 256), but maybe we should have 2 different caches, one for 'outer' calls and another for 'internal' calls inside the parsing structure, but memory may be a problem here.

2. Or maybe a single cache where we have an LRU with a 'desired' max size but items are only prunned if not accessed for some time (say 10 seconds).

3. Having a SoftHashMap may be a reasonable replacement too.

4. Making proper use of the LRUCache implementation we have which implements a virtual memory paging scheme (each value may have an associated size and the LRU has a size related to that -- the parsed document length may be a good tradeof in speed/size of the final generated AST).

Selected approach:

LRUCache with virtual memory paging scheme + SoftHashMap for prunned entries (which may be restored if still alive).
column166: 15/Jun/12 8:55 AM;ingo;It sounds like this ticket is being treated as an investigation ticket. I'd like to open what specific related ticket (independent of APSTUD-4651, APSTUD-4653, APSTUD-4654 and APSTUD-4655) before we close this one.
column167: 09/Aug/12 2:19 AM;ingo;Converted Story to epic, and issues found as a result moved to tickets.
column168: 09/Oct/13 5:43 PM;mxia;I'm marking this one as fixed since tickets were created and worked on based on the investigation.

column1: Need ability to specify JSLint settings on a global level
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
We just upgraded to Studio 3.1.3, and now we get a ton of JSLint errors in our code. (Seems to be because of changes to default settings?)

We could put the settings into jslint comments to make it work how we want it to, but that would require adding the settings to the 300+ JavaScript files that we have on our site. That is unacceptable.

We need a place to be able to specify JSLint's settings on a global level. We use JSLint on "reconcile" mode, and seeing all of the errors (for things like supposedly "messy" whitespace, using multiple 'var' statements, etc) makes the tool downright useless for the actual errors that we need it to catch.

h3. Actual Result
(See above)

h3. Suggested solution

Remove the filter box from the validator main page and have the pencil icon open up a new window (similar to how formatting works). See screenshots. For JSLint (and all validators), we would keep a filter text box, as well as have another text box where a user can specify whatever JSLint commands they'd like to issue

I'm assuming this would be in the form of a string of options that would then be injected into the comments of a file before parsing.
column164:
20/Jun/12 3:49 AM;ingo;When we upgraded JSLint it started spitting out a lot more errors for things like whitespace. We now filter those out by default (as you can see in TISTUD-1735). Can you see if that addresses most of your concerns, or can you create filters for additional items?

We are also replacing JSLint with our own validation solution that is far more performant. This we will allow for configuring individual rules.
column165:
20/Jun/12 10:00 AM;gjslick;This may or may not be adequate. As I mentioned in the other thread, JSLint *must* be set to a very high 'maxerr' option value by Aptana, because normally it defaults to 50, and even though we are filtering out the errors we don't want from view, JSLint will stop when it reaches 50 errors. This means that all code past those 50 errors won't be checked for errors, and 50 errors will come up very quickly with the default options. Chris Williams mentioned in the other thread setting 'maxerr' to 1000, but even that might not be enough. I would say that it would need to be set to 10,000 minimum, to make sure to handle large files.

But also, this filtering solution doesn't seem to be a good one. Either people have to manually enter these rules themselves, or, if you guys program the rules directly into Aptana, then you may be hiding errors that some developers do in fact want to see.


How far along is a custom validation solution? It sounds good in theory, but it may be quite a serious undertaking to implement everything that sole-purpose validation projects like JSLint and JSHint cover. And, if you don't end up implementing everything, then you're going to alienate the developers who want these features. Developers may want to switch over to something like Sublime Editor, which both allows the use of JSHint (which I find better and more configurable than JSLint), and the ability to configure its options using JSON.

So it would seem that Aptana may need the ability to be able to continue to use JSLint (or better yet, JSHint) in the future, even with an additional custom Aptana validation solution as another option. Some developers just might want them, or their features. But, I think we definitely need the ability to allow users to at least configure JSLint in the meantime. Again, even something as simple as a textarea where we could enter in the options using the JSLint/JSHint comments would be fine.
column166:
20/Jun/12 10:11 AM;ingo;Hi Gregory--those are good points. How do you configure JSHint in Sublime? As for progress on our custom validation solution, we will have a version of very shortly. It's a first pass, but the aim is to cover a lot of common use cases.

I think a text area is probably good. JSLint is really too slow to adequate use as part of the build process. Do you find JSHint more performant?
column167:
21/Jun/12 2:53 AM;gjslick;Sublime allows JSLint and JSHint to be brought in through use of their "packages" system (pretty much plugins). Then they have a JSON-based settings file where you can specify the settings for the package. Here is an example of setting up JSLint in Sublime (which actually praises Aptana for its better implementation in general near the end ;)) They have set JSLint here to tolerate supposedly "messy" whitespace, from what looks to be the command line option for it using the node-jslint project. http://opensourcehacker.com/2012/04/12/jslint-integration-for-sublime-text-2/

And here's just a quick example from someone's SublimeLinter configuration, where they are using JSHint. Take a look at the "jshint_options" section on line 75, which allow the options to be specified directly in the JSON on a per-option basis. https://gist.github.com/2944106

In general though, I think a textarea where the /*jslint bar:foo, ... */ options can be specified would be fine. Although a JSON block where the options could be specified key/value could be fed directly into the second argument that the jslint() function takes.


Unfortunately, I can't speak to the performance of JSHint over JSLint. From what I understand, JSHint was originally a fork of JSLint, so I don't know how much they have changed how the internals of how the parsing and validations work. 

We only use JSLint on reconcile mode in Aptana (as this is what helps our productivity the most), so it runs on a per-file basis and shows us the errors as we type. This seems to be how many people use it in general too, and each of the Sublime packages that do validation work in this manner as well. So with this use case, JSLint runs just fine performance-wise. The performance only becomes a little noticeable (there's a slight delay after typing) when working with very large files (1000+ lines).
column168: 12/Jul/12 3:43 AM;cwilliams;Closed code review, merged to 'development', pushed to github.
column169: 16/Jul/12 6:35 AM;cheadley;Verified users can now set global JSLint settings in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.7.4, and Ubuntu 12.04 using Titanium Studio, build: 2.2.0.201207131651. Closing Ticket.

column174:
28/May/12 6:32 PM;sgibly;Ok, I'm a little confused as for what is the issue here.
The title says external files, however, the description indicate a project. So I assume it's some sort of a mix of files that are in your workspace, and files that are not.

The code-assist support should handle well assistance for external files that were mapped via the project "Buildpath". You set this buildpath by right-clicking the project and selecting 'Properties -> PHP Buildpath', then you can add external directories.
You can also add 'Libraries' to be shared between projects. For example, if you would like to have ZendFramework code assist across your PHP project, you can go to 'Preferences -> Aptana -> Editors -> PHP -> libraries' and add the path to it as a new library. Then you can attach it via the same buildpath page I mentioned before.

Having an external file, and trying to assist on a file that is in the workspace, will not work. The code-assist only works one way. 

Would be great if you could elaborate more on the issue.
thanks.
column175:
29/May/12 8:52 AM;copleykj;By external file he just means a file that is included or required in another php file. Say you have require("user.class.php") in your index.php and you have a method fullName() if you type $user->ful you get the list of methods but none of the methods display the doc block info.

column197:
04/Jun/12 10:10 PM;otrejni;Hello :)

I took the time to do a vast review of the modifications and here is my humble experience.


First issue: auto-completion dialog is cutting text and it shouldn't.

!http://cl.ly/H9Kg/xort.png!



Second issue: short description is showing "together" with long description (there should be a blank line between them)

!http://cl.ly/H9WO/hover.png!

Original code:
!http://cl.ly/H95H/code.png!

Third issue: when you have the same function declared in two different files (not included at the same time on the project, so it doesn't affects run time), auto-completion and mouse hover use different documentation sources. Hovering keeps using the same file as the above screenshots (plugin.php) while hover uses the other file (load-scripts.php), I'm guessing it uses alphabetical order.

!http://cl.ly/H93M/rare.png!

There should be a way to choose a file not to get used as a documentation source.

The fourth and less important issue is, I think you might guess, long documentations get cut by a scroll bar. It shouldn't be a problem except that it makes parameter list go far below the field of view, forcing you to scroll down each time. So, I thought: how about hiding the "long documentation" after XX characters and showing a "View more" link, the way facebook does with long messages?

The "long documentation" being everything between the blank line after the "short desc" and the parameter list (first thing with an @ symbol at the begining).


So that's my review (:

Hope you can get at it. And, again, thank you very much for such an awesome job.
column199:
05/Jun/12 4:51 AM;sgibly;@Sebastian Thanks for taking the time to review that! 
You got some great points there, and some that we already aware of. 

First, I think that this ticket should be closed, as the main issues were addressed. So I will resolve it again in a minute.
The other issues you raised here will be better addressed in separate tickets, some as improvements and some as bugs, and it would be great if you can split those (asking you to do it so you will be notified on any change).

* The issue with the wrapped text is common to other editors, and should be opened as a generic issue with our 'additional-info-popup'
* The short+long description is actually by design. The short description is defined as the text until the first dot. The documentation parser detects the short and the long descriptions and trim them by default. Not all the documentation adds an empty line between that and the lines after, so we had to make a choice between adding an extra line all the time, or not adding it at all. Trying it out with different types of docs, it looked nicer not to have the extra line. 
* The issue with the two functions with similar names on different files sounds like a bug. 
* The forth issue is also a global improvement that is not strictly related to the PHP editor, so you can add it as such.

Thanks again for your effort!!

--
column200: 05/Jun/12 4:52 AM;sgibly;Resolving again. The issues mentioned above are "extra" :)

column1: PHP Namespaces - Allow non-local functions to be called statically
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
I've noticed that many of the newer PHP 5.3 based frameworks contain an autoloader of some sort that allows for developers to use classes in files that have no reference to said class. When trying to call a class where there is no namespace though, I am told there is no proposal. It would greatly help me as a developer to have the functions of a class proposed for me when I don't have a namespace defined.

I've attached a couple of images to help explain what I'm asking for. In the first image, where there are no proposals, because of how the way the framework is written, it would be great if the function list was there even though a namespace wasn't called.

Here are just two frameworks that allow for this:
https://github.com/laravel/laravel/blob/master/application/controllers/home.php
https://github.com/fuel/fuel/blob/1.1/master/fuel/app/classes/controller/welcome.php
column164: 01/Jun/12 5:54 PM;sp0tteh;Any chance of getting this looked at?
column165: 17/Jan/13 6:04 AM;sgibly;Attaching a screenshot of the new preference for this feature.
column166:
17/Jan/13 6:07 AM;sgibly;Implemented.

We now allow a non-strict content assist that will suggest items that are outside of the current namespace (basically, ignoring the namespace filtering for the results you see in the assist box).
You can activate that behavior via a new preference checkbox at the PHP settings. The default is still the previous behavior of a strict CA, so you will have to change it to work with your framework.

Let us know if it's working well for you!

column1: JS Indexing complaining about metadata types declared like Anchor[]
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Our JS metadata uses Link[], Anchor[], etc. to declare some properties as arrays of Links/whatever. We use Array<Type> inside the code to denote arrays of a given type. We should convert the old style to new to unify them in our code.

Additionally, we don't fully support Array<type> properly, as it breaks our type hierarchy lookups where we really need to strip the generic/type info off the end to lookup Array as a parent type.
column164: 24/Sep/12 12:57 PM;cheadley;Verified working on Windows 7, Mac OS 10.8.2 and Ubuntu 12.04 using Titanium Studio, build: 3.0.0.201209240100. I do not see the errors reported by Shalom. Closing ticket.
column165: 24/Sep/12 2:01 PM;leo.unglaub;I had the error reported by Shalom once in my log file. But it's hard to reproduce, simply restarting aptana a few times doesn't do the trick.
column166: 25/Sep/12 7:28 AM;cwilliams;Shalom's error is actually what APSTUD-7442 is about. This ticket was about usage of an array literal syntax for type names, i.e. {{Anchor[]}}, {{Link[]}}, {{Frame[]}}.

column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
We're getting som cases where a variable is re-used many times in javascript resulting in multiple types being assigned, including Function. The way we write Function signatures is not able to be wrapped/unwrapped recursively, so we're getting some broken type strings once there's an overloaded variable that has a Function type with return types.

We may need to change from "Function,Type,Type:ReturnType,ReturnType" to "Type,Type,Type,Function<ReturnType,ReturnType>", because a returnType may also have a function with return types, making it impossible to reliably unwrap (i.e. "Function,Number,Object:Function,Array<String>:Boolean").

column171:
17/Sep/12 5:52 AM;cwilliams;@mikey0000 Do you have a large number of files in your git repo? Are there a ton of changed/staged/unstaged files? Is the repo or any other files on a network share or somehow not local?

The attached profiler session is a bit hard to decode, but I'm seeing that there _may_ be a huge timesink in trying to deal with calculating the diff of running a git index refresh. Basically we update our information and then compare the new and old sets to issue a diff for listeners. If that file listing is very large, we could run into issues calculating the difference.

I can make a few minor speculative changes with this in mind to try and alleviate the issue, but given that I'm not able to reproduce it, the changes are purely guesses at the root cause. You can try out the changes by grabbing a nightly update tomorrow from here: http://preview.appcelerator.com/studio/

column167: 16/Sep/12 11:29 PM;cwilliams;I cloned off a ticket to handle trying to fix the root cause - that for some reason the WST plugins are "taking over" when we try to look up the content type for a document. For the immediate issue of being unable to type certain characters (the ones we auto-close), I have pushed a simple fix to catch the NPE and move on. This means that the pair matching behavior will likely be broken, but the user should still be able to at least eneter the characters themselves.

column1: Improve current dashboard project controller to return name of created project
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When a user creates a project from the dashboard, it pops up the New Project wizard. At the end of that wizard, we need to return the name of the created project back top the dashboard.

We need to provide a callback mechanism to the dashboard that returns that project name.

I can set up a Jython instance but I cannot set up an IronPython instance and, more seriouslyu, I cannot set up Python 2.7, Python 3.2 and PyPy. It goes through the sequence of finding all the paths but it fails to persist the materials. After applying and accepting the Python instances, they are not listed for the project and if you go in again and look at the available Python instances the list is empty again :-(((
column169: 31/Jul/12 12:40 AM;russel;This is not fixed for me, I need to reopen this.
column170:
31/Jul/12 12:43 AM;russel;I have the latest nightly:

    PyDev for Eclipse	2.7.0.2012072517

but still cannot put in a Python interpreter, Python 2, Python 3, PyPy. Jython is in fine.

column173:
31/Jul/12 2:36 AM;fzadrozny;Ok, I'm fixing that, but just to note, the "real" problem is:

Warning: unable to get contents of directory: /usr/local/lib/python3.2/dist-packages/python_csp-0.1dev-py3.2.egg (permission not available, it's not a dir or dir does not exist)

So, PyDev is not able to get the contents of that directory which you're adding to your pythonpath (if you remove it, you should be able to properly configure the interpreter) -- anyways, I'm fixing the errors so that this no longer happens.

If I check which process has the files under {{.git}} locked afterwards it turns out it is Aptana Studio itself.
column164:
20/Aug/12 11:34 PM;cwilliams;I was unable to reproduce the issue Clayton mentioned, and was able to rename a git enabled project (whose git repo root was the root of the project). If the IDE complains that the project is out of sync, it is because for some reason the files changed and the project wasn't refreshed. You should be able to hit F5 to refresh the project and retry. I didn't run into this particular issue after a rename.

Re-marking as resolved.

column1: Function outline not linking line numbers properly
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Just updated to RC for the JavaScript duplicate function fix and now the outline doesn't update properly when I add new code. It will display a new function in the outline, but if I double-click any function below that (to go to that function in the editor), it takes me to the line where that function -used- to be. Generally, the function I want is a few lines below where it highlights (the same number of lines I added above it).

This is miles better than before (with the duplicates), but I figured I should point it out.

I've attached a project file to demonstrate the issue. Add some code where you see the comment block. Then try double-clicking any function below that in the outline.

column166:
15/Aug/12 8:55 PM;leo.unglaub;I tested the folowing build: Aptana Studio 3, build: 3.3.0.201208152028 on my normal linux desktop.

* The interpreter is now available after restarting aptana
* There is a funny red dot in the top right corner of the dialog window. Please see screenshot.
* When you save the interpreter you get an error message, because the normal linux user is not allowed to write-access the files under /etc/
* Improvement: If you add one interpreter and you don't have others in there, the entry should be marked as default. Otherwize if you have no default interpreter the debugging will fail with a strange error message.

Greetings
Leo
column167: 16/Aug/12 3:58 AM;cheadley;Tested on Ubuntu 12.04 using Titanium Studio, build: 2.2.0.201208152117. I'm seeing the same issues that Leo reported. Reopening ticket.
column168:
16/Aug/12 4:32 AM;leo.unglaub;Maybe i should explain a little bit more why this error is happening only on linux. If you install apache + php on a mac or windows, you install it as the user as you are currently logged in. On Windows you have complete access to all xampp files. But on Linux we use the normal repository, witch installs php exactly like on the web server. So the normal user has only write access to his home directory and also tmp. But the server configuration is stored in /etc/ because normaly only the apache2 has to read this config files and he has root privileges at this point. (also for the port binding). So no matter how, on a normal linux system the desktop user NEVER can write to /etc/.  If a linux user wants to override config from /etc/ som,e programms offer to create an override config in the home directory, but php doesn't support that as far as i know.

Greetings
Leo
column169:
16/Aug/12 4:54 AM;sgibly;These should probably be in separate tickets, but it's done now ;)

Fixed the missing wizard image.
Fixed the default selection of the executable.
column170: 16/Aug/12 5:00 AM;sgibly;@Leo About the file-access error you get on Linux - Please open a separate ticket and I'll see if anything can be done there. We do try to write to the php.ini if you edit the ini via the visual editor, so I'm not sure if that part will be solved.
