column1: toggling multi-line comments in ruby corrupts syntax highlighting for entire document
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
If I use the toggle comment shortcut (CTRL+slash) with 2 or more lines, the syntax highlighting of the comments and surrounding ruby code is corrupted (see attached pic).

With 'show whitespace' turned on, I can see that the comments have a strange line-feed character at the end (this renders as a small square). This seems to be the cause of the problem. If I copy the comments into a text editor and back again, the weird line-feeds are gone and the syntax highlighting is back to normal.

This may be related to: https://jira.appcelerator.org/browse/APSTUD-4985

I've marked this as High priority because it really interferes with my (and I suspect many people's) normal workflow.
column164:
23/Jul/12 2:57 AM;mbasset;I can second this and it is very annoying. They end up actually corrupting files which have block comments so that ruby interpreter cannot evaluate other surrounding lines properly in some cases. Quick fix for people with this issue is:

* select all text in file
* cut text
* past text to get back newlines.
column165:
09/Aug/12 5:13 AM;cwilliams;OK, found this one out. This would only happen for users of the 'development' or 'release' branch of the source.ruble. The square character is a carriage return (CR or \r). Unix uses linefeed (LF or \n), which I what I had hard-coded long ago. Then we had bugs reported about changing the line endings (APSTUD-4985), and I moved to trying to determined the line ending from the document. Unfortunately I misunderstood the APi and used the first "legal" line delimiter returned, which actually was the equivalent of always using CR or \r. Changed the call to use getDefaultLineDelimiter, which attempts to use the first line's line ending, and failing that uses the first legal line delimiter that matches the line.separator system property.

Pushed the fix to 'stable', 'release', 'master', and 'development' branches of the ruble.

QA, to verify:
# In a Ubuntu VM, open the Terminal, cd ~/Documents/Aptana Rubles
# git clone git://github.com/aptana/source.ruble.git
# cd source.ruble
# git checkout development
# Run studio on Ubuntu
# Open a new file, add some random text on multiple (3+) lines
# Show newline characters (there's an icon ont he global toolbar to turn this on, looks like the paragraph icon)
# Verify that the lines use the paragraph/linefeed character (like a P)
# Select all, Ctrl+/ to toggle comments
# Verify those linefeed markers don't turn to the "square" looking icons seen in the screenshot.
column166:
09/Aug/12 5:41 AM;jmchambers;Hi Chris,

Can confirm that the above fix works on my system. Thanks to you and the team for the fast turnaround.

Right, I'm off to do some serious comment toggling...

Jon C

(We may wish to use the files from the OpenJSEditor/OpenCSSEditor/OpenHTMLEditor performance tests. We should also keep in mind various timings: time to open the editor, time before we can actively edit, performance/lag of keypresses/edits in the file.)

* Specific editor (HTML, JS, CSS as appropriate)
* Our generic text editor

column165:
12/Apr/12 5:24 AM;ingo;Files to use. In general, the files have a roughly equivalent amount of parse nodes. That said, the github one (due to how CSS is structured) is _huge_ and we may need to find a smaller one.

In general, the metric to use is not how long it takes to open the file, but how long it takes before you can edit it. We open files for editing a lot more than just viewing.

* HTML alone: https://raw.github.com/aptana/studio3/release/tests/com.aptana.editor.html.tests/performance/reddit-no-css-no-js.html
* HTML + JS, CSS: https://raw.github.com/aptana/studio3/release/tests/com.aptana.editor.html.tests/performance/reddit.html
* JS alone: https://raw.github.com/aptana/studio3/release/tests/com.aptana.editor.js.tests/performance/dojo.js.uncompressed.js
* CSS alone: https://raw.github.com/aptana/studio3/release/tests/com.aptana.editor.css.tests/performance/github-formatted.css
* JS minified: https://raw.github.com/aptana/studio3/release/tests/com.aptana.editor.js.tests/performance/dojo.js.minified.js
* CSS minified: https://raw.github.com/aptana/studio3/release/tests/com.aptana.editor.css.tests/performance/github-minimized.css

16/Apr/12 6:34 AM;cwilliams;Here are the results of the perf test that just times opening the HTML editor on specific files. The first and last two tests are opening the amazon.html frontpage. I'm not sure why the timings are so different there, the only true difference should be whether or not the editors get closed after we open and time each or not (the first leaves all editors open until it's timed opening 20 copies, the last two close the editor before opening the next one. It's possible we're eating enough RAM with all the copies that we slow down considerably due to GC/thrashing).

column170:
17/Apr/12 2:03 AM;cwilliams;So to sum up the stopwatch timings:
||File						||	3.1.1	||	1.5 	||
|reddit.html				|	1.2		|	1.6		|
|reddit-no-css-no-js.html	|	1.15	|	1.2		|
|amazon.html				|	0.55	|	0.5		|
|BigHTML.html				|	21.6*	|	N/A		|
|yui.css					|	0.6		|	0.45	|
|from-metadata.css			|	4.6*	|	4.1		|
|github-formatted.css		|	34*		|	N/A		|
|github-minimized.css		|	2:33*	|	N/A		|
|wp-admin.css				|	1.25	|	0.7		|
|wp-admin.dev.css			|	0.6		|	0.5		|
|dojo.js.minified.js		|	7.8		|	0.8		|
|dojo.js.uncompressed.js	|	0.7		|	0.75	|

* = delayed colorization/reconciling locked up UI for an indeterminate amount of time. Force quit before it finished.

Summary:
- Minified JS is significantly slower than non-minified JS in 3.1 (10x+)
- Minified CSS is slower than non-minified CSS in 3.2 (2x+)
- We are able to open extremely large files in 3.1 that 1.5 was unable to open, though delayed colorization effectively hangs the IDE after opening. (and some of this may be due to our larger default max RAM of 512 vs 384)
- Our 3.1 HTML editor appears to be roughly on par with 1.5.
- CSS and JS editors are 10-45% slower than 1.5 equivalents for non-minified files.
- Notable differences between the editors are the browser tabs on the 1.5 HTML editor, the delayed colorizing in 3.1. Considering we are delaying colorization of regions that aren't visible in the editor viewport, one would assume we'd be even faster in 3.1.

Given the difference in minified vs non-minified JS, and knowing we use JFlex and beaver, my assumption is that the bottleneck there stems from colorization/partitioning rules that perform poorly on long lines (like say a RegexpRule).
column171:
17/Apr/12 2:52 AM;cwilliams;Some more timings:
Opening pretty much any of the files above in the Studio text editor typically takes ~0.4s. The longest was 0.7/0.6 for BigHTML. Opening BigHTML in the Eclipse generic text editor took ~0.6s.

I think doing any sort of stopwatch timings for these is nearly impossible given such small times. We may want to look at comparing via automated tests to get some idea of the lower bound and what the common infrastructure adds, though it appears to be negligible overall.
column172:
19/Apr/12 12:26 AM;cwilliams;Odd. Doing perf testing on the colorization and parser scanners - it looks like we're actually _faster_ when minified (presumably there's less whitespace to eat up, making it faster?) So it doesn't look like scanning is causing the perf difference in opening the JS editor.

column175: 19/Apr/12 3:00 AM;cwilliams;So: parsing, scanning, colorization and partitioning are all _faster_ on Dojo minified versus non-minified, but opening the editor is 5x slower in these perf test results. With some more profiling, it looks to me like there's core Eclipse code responsible for most of the slowdowns here, so maybe we can hack it to just quit trying to colorize past a certain length of chars on a line?
column176: 19/Apr/12 4:28 AM;cwilliams;Looks like the majority of the slowdown with minified files is purely Eclipse's poor performance on long lines, particularly with a lot of styles/colors applied to them. I hacked the ThemingDamagerRepairer locally to not return colors past the 200th column of any line, and that helped speed up the editor to around 1s (after opening at least once before timing).
column177: 19/Apr/12 5:51 AM;cwilliams;Resolving, since I've got plenty of numbers and data here to start with and we've opened other tickets to handle scanner changes.

column1: Limit number of columns colored to improve performance
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: I found that limiting the number of StyleRanges used makes a huge difference in performance for minified JS files. A simple fix is to limit to not add any more ranges past the 200th column of any line in ThemingDamagerRepairer. there may be additional gains if we can reduce the number of ranges we generated (say skip ones that match the default fg/bg colors).
column164: 19/Apr/12 5:54 AM;cwilliams;See also: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=251224
column165: 20/Apr/12 4:20 AM;ingo;Add command-line option to modify this setting (unless we really feel a preference is warranted, but I don't think so)
column166: 23/Apr/12 4:36 AM;cwilliams;Addressed review feedback, closed review, merged to 'release'
column167:
23/Apr/12 6:23 AM;klindsey;I'm seeing two issues in JS that may be related to this change:

# Type a symbol name that starts with "in", like "inferReturnValue". "in" will be colorized as a keyword and remains that way as you type the rest of the symbol
# Create a function, then create an invocation to call that function. Cmd-hover over the invocation to make the symbol a link. Once it becomes a link, I cannot make it go back to being regular text
column168: 23/Apr/12 7:01 AM;cwilliams;I hadn't considered the case where we're trying to apply the 'default' styles to a range that already has non-default styles, so we're basically just 'skipping" over re-coloring those. I need to check if there's a StyleRange already there and wipe it too.
column169: 24/Apr/12 12:08 AM;cwilliams;Pushed another fix for this. Now I normalize the style range returned when it matches the default fg/bg (exactly or implicitly) rather than just skipping it. We also set a default style range for the TextPresentation, which causes the Eclipse internals to skip these ranges that match default - ultimately for Dojo uncompressed this chops the initial set of ranges from 26400 down to 13489.
column171: 24/Apr/12 4:15 AM;cwilliams;Still a small artifact - if there are error/warnings squigglies in the file, "fixing" them leaves behind a single char of squiggly.
column172: 24/Apr/12 7:02 AM;cwilliams;Hmm, I can _sometimes_ reproduce this. It appears to be some sort of timing issue. I can't figure out what specifically is going on that is causing this, since it has to do with the annotation painter not properly wiping the full "squiggly/underline".
column173: 30/Apr/12 11:10 PM;cwilliams;I marked this as resolved with the caveat that Kevin and I mentioned in comments. I've opened a separate ticket for that as APSTUD-4752. Since it is only intermittent for me, I assumed that it was "good enough" to resolve this ticket.
column174: 02/May/12 12:00 AM;cwilliams;Closing since this is more of a technical task, and it appears to be working fine in latest builds now. I also verified under the debugger that we're trimming down the number of style ranges we're generating.

column1: Handle common meta-programming idioms that define methods for Ruby indexing
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: Rails uses a number of class-level methods to attach other methods, such as "delegate", "cattr_accessor", "cattr_writer", "cattr_reader", and "class_attribute". We don't currently handle these. We'll need to look for calls to these and manually expand the type's method list to include the generated methods that result from calling those.

column1: Copy/Cut/Paste intermittently fails in editor
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
There is a very strange issue that has been happening to me since I started using Aptana Studio at version 3.0.2...Sometimes when I copy (or cut) some text from the editor and paste it somewhere else in the same or different file, Aptana will paste the last thing (or second to last, depending on how you look at it) instead of the most recent thing I just copied.

I thought maybe just my keyboard wasn't working, since I had never experienced something like that before. But then my co-worker (who is also using Aptana 3.0.3) asked me if I was experiencing copy/paste issues too. That's when I knew I wasn't the only one. We noticed that the times when he can't copy/paste is when Aptana is using up 100% of the CPU. So, not sure if there is another bug and this is just a side-afect, or if this is a bug that can be isolated.

I don't know how to replicate this. All I know is that it is happening at seemingly random times.

Update:

Some people have reported relief after unbinding the shortcut 'command + c' from 'copy' under Preferences/General/keys. Unbinding this shortcut resolved the issue of copy/paste randomly not working.

It also appears that this is a long-standing Eclipse issue:

* https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=368354
* https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=200743

Which suggests that there is some more investigation to do here.

The above descriptions sound very similar.

I just tried it out for testing purposes:

- string 1
- string 2

Selected string 1, pressed COMMAND+C, pressed COMMAND+V: string 1 got pasted.
Selected string 2, pressed COMMAND+C, pressed COMMAND+V: string 1 got pasted again.
Selected string 2 again, pressed COMMAND+C, pressed COMMAND+V: string 1 got yet again. Rinse & repeat this, until on the 5th COMMAND+V, string 2 finally got pasted.

This instance it took 5 "copy attempts" to correctly copy the string, other times it takes 2 attempts, other times 3. It's sporadic.

column203:
06/Sep/11 12:35 AM;bernhard.mayer;I finally could reproduce the problem always by copying some sql code and paste it into a new test php file with start and end tags. Made this new file, wrote one test line, 
{code:php}
<?php

$test = '';

?>
{code}

At this point i could copy this line and paste it. Now i paste my sql code into the php block. I normally do this to get the sql code into my php files and format them to assign it to a variable.

{code:sql}
select id, name, width, group
from (
select rg.reportgroupid as id, rg.name, 0 as width, 1 as group, rg.sortorder
from reportgroup rg
where rg.parent = 1
union all
select r.reportid as id, r.name, rp.width+95 as width, 0 as group, r.sortorder
from report r, (
select reportid, max(width) as width
FROM (
    select reportid, Rootsqlid, sum(width) as width
    from (
            select reportid, sqlid, width, floated, Sqlnumber, Sqlcount, Follower,
                  LEVEL as Lfdnr,
                  CONNECT_BY_ROOT sqlid AS Rootsqlid
            from
                (select reportid, sqlid, width, floated, Sqlnumber, Sqlcount,
                       case
                        when floated=1 and Sqlnumber<Sqlcount then Sqlnumber+1
                        else null
                       end as Follower                                                                        
                from (
                    select b.reportid, b.sqlid, nvl(wi.value,700) as width, nvl(fl.value,0) as floated,
                           ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY b.reportid ORDER BY b.reportid, b.sortorder, b.sqlid) as Sqlnumber,
                           Count(*) OVER (PARTITION BY b.reportid) as Sqlcount
                     from (select distinct aw.reportid, aw.sqlid, a.sortorder
                           from sqlvalues aw, sqls a
                           where aw.reportid=a.reportid
                           and aw.sqlid=a.sqlid) b,
                          (select aww.reportid, aww.sqlid, aww.value
                           from sqlvalues aww, tdsisdb.sqlparameter apw
                           where aww.parameterid = apw.parameterid
                           and apw.name = 'width') wi,
                          (select aww.reportid, aww.abfrageid, wert
                           from sqlvalues aww, sqlparameter apw
                           where aww.parameterid = apw.parameterid
                           and apw.name = 'float') fl
                     where b.reportid=wi.reportid(+)
                     and b.sqlid=wi.sqlid(+)   
                     and b.reportid=fl.reportid(+)
                     and b.sqlid=fl.sqlid(+)))
            START WITH Sqlnumber>=1
            connect by prior reportid=reportid
            and prior Follower = Sqlnumber)
    group by reportid, Rootsqlid
)
group by reportid
) rp
where R.REPORTID = rp.reportid
and R.REPORTGROUPID=1
)
order by group desc, sortorder, name
{code}

But now, i try to copy my simple php test line of code and want to paste it. The newly copyied code isn't inserted, but instead the sql code will be inserted.

The shortcut ctrl+c to copy isn't working, but the context menu still can copy the selected text.
Btw, at this moment aptana uses a high amount of cpu, fills and frees memory for a long time and closing aptana isn't working too.

column222:
31/Jan/12 7:29 PM;mm2ha;I still have the same problem too - running Aptana nightly builds. 

If you copy something from another application, you can always paste it into Aptana. Paste is always enabled.

However, copying and cutting inside Aptana most of the time doesn't work on the first few times. You have to wait about 15-30 seconds until it is enabled again (I can see this in the Edit menu where the Copy and Cut commands are grayed out). This happens in any type of editor - JS, PHP, CSS, ... The more lines in the file, the longer it seems to take for the copy/cut to be enabled again and the more often this issue happens.

Please let me know if there is any way how I can help you solve this problem, because I really like this editor, but this bug is driving me crazy and makes development really hard.
column223:
01/Feb/12 12:46 AM;ingo;Marko and Maximilian. Please try the following. It is likely one of two things, reconciling or indexing.

# Turn on Preferences > Studio > Troubleshooting > "Show normally hidden processes", and open up Activity Monitor. Restart Studio. See if anything shows up in the Progress View (you may need to show it under Window > Show View > Progress) or high CPU usage when cut/copy are disabled.
# Disable Project > Build Automatically, and see if that helps.
# Try https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/tis/Crashes+and+Freezes#CrashesandFreezes-UsingJPS. To make it easy, open a command prompt, type JPS, and then figure out the process ID. Once you have that ready, then the next time the issue happens, type jstack <pid>. Take the resulting log and attach it to this ticket.

When commenting, please reference the above numbers so we know what you tried and if it worked (or did not).

column1: Git not using user.name and user.email from .gitconfig
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: I noticed that when I do a commit using the gui (specifically the Commit command in the App Explorer gear menu), git isn't using the user.name and user.email from the .gitconfig in my home directory. I'm running the Studio 3 Beta plugin in Galileo on Windows XP, and I'm using msysgit 1.7.1. When I do the same commit from the git bash prompt, it works fine. Is there a separate global git config for Studio 3? Is there an easy way to sync this with the .gitconfig in my home directory?
column164:
20/Jan/12 7:45 AM;bblack;I don't think this is fixed because all of us in the office are having the same problem. Was the fix in a recent release or was there a setting for something we should adjust?

column1: Code-formatting in PyDev may take place even with syntax error, yielding wrong results
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Having the code below (which has a syntax error), should not be code-formatted, but it ends up being code-formatted, which yields wrong results.

{code}
'''class Bar:
    '''
    class Foo:
        a+b #should not be code-formatted
    '''
'''
{code}


To properly fix this, the PyDev parser should have a 'faster' way of operating, which means doing only syntax parsing without generating an actual tree (as the code-formatter is currently text-based and not AST-based) just to get syntax errors.

This is especially troublesome when code-formatting on save is used.
column164:
05/Jul/12 6:25 AM;fzadrozny;Fixed. Now a full reparse (without generating the AST) will be done before actually doing a code-format operation. 

Unless the user selects some text, in which case it'll apply the code-format in that section of text without doing any validation -- the user is expected to know what he's doing in this case (i.e.: selecting text for code-formatting inside a docstring).

column166: 12/Jul/12 12:19 AM;cheadley;Has this been fixed? I see no commit messages or comments, and last comment reports an error. Initial tests show the code after formatting to be correct now.
column167:
12/Jul/12 1:00 AM;fzadrozny;Yes, this has been fixed in the latest development version.

Git:
0b3e407 2012-07-05 fabioz APSTUD-4995: Code-formatter should not be applied when syntax errors are present: Making it possible to parse for errors without creating the AST.

7d3d3b0 2012-07-05 fabioz APSTUD-4995: Code-formatter should not be applied when syntax errors are present: Integrated syntax checking with editor.

32950d5 2012-07-10 fabioz APSTUD-4995: Fixed introduced issues by previous fix.

To reproduce, set auto-format to happen on save, set the contents with the content of the summary and save the file (it previously would code-format and now it doesn't because there's a syntax error).

column1: GIT functions are not working on linux systems
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Hi friends,
related to this report http://jira.appcelerator.org/browse/APSTUD-3691 the most GIT functions are not working on Linux systems. I realized is the first time after upgrading to the new ubuntu version with is based on Gnome3. (Unity is also based on gnome3, but not using the gnome shell)

For example if i try to commit somethink i got the following error message:
{quote}
Unhandled event loop exception
No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path (MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)]
{quote}

In the other topic Michael Xia sayed that aptana has no need for the XULrunner, but i think there is still a dependency left, because without it's not working. I asked in the developer irc channels an i am not the only one with this problem. (also some kde users)

column166:
24/Oct/11 9:12 AM;leo.unglaub;I found this here, maybe it's helpfull.
{quote}
A: In Eclipse/SWT 3.7 and newer the Browser attempts to use WebKitGTK for SWT.NONE-style Browsers created on GTK. For this to succeed, WebKitGTK 1.2.0 or newer must be in the library load path. Examples of Linux distros that meet this requirement by default include Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and Ubuntu 10.04. Linux installations that do not meet this requirement will fall back to using Mozilla for SWT.NONE-style Browsers.
Eclipse/SWT 3.6.x can also use WebKitGTK for SWT.NONE-style Browsers created on GTK, but the user must explicitly request this by setting java property "org.eclipse.swt.browser.UseWebKitGTK" to "true". In the absence of this property being set, Mozilla is used for all SWT.NONE-style Browsers. (Note that Eclipse/SWT 3.6.x is only able to use WebKitGTK 1.2.x; it will fail if a newer WebKitGTK release is found.)
{quote}

http://www.eclipse.org/swt/faq.php#browserwebkitgtk

Greetings
Leo

column1: Commenting lines with Ctrl+/ removes carriage return in line breaks
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When commenting a series of lines with Ctrl+/ the editor uses Linux line breaks regardless of the style of line breaks chosen for the rest of the file or the default configuration.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Turn Whitespace characters on (Prefences > General > Editors > Text Editors > Whitespace)
2. Create a file that uses carrage returns in it's line breaks.
3. Type some text with a few line breaks
4. Comment them with the keyboard shortcut (ctrl/cmd + /)

Expected results: The lines should comment without changing the line returns
Actual results: The line terminators change to Linux style regardless of setting.

I opted for the latter for now, which may cause us some issues with rubles that contain unicode characters (maybe). Pushed this build change to 'release' and 'development'.

column1: HTML validator should not flag no-value boolean attributes in HTML 4
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Updated Aptana in STS this morning and now have a slew of warnings. They don't show up in the Problems area, however.

This one is perplexing. Until today, the proposed value of the disabled property was "disabled". Now, "disabled" produces an invalid value warning and the proposed values are "true" and "false".

I'm not that up on the standard, but I haven't seen, anywhere, that HTML5 properties can be "turned off" by specifying a value of "false". This appears, to me at least, to be a serious error.
column164:
14/Jun/12 2:17 AM;ingo;This relates to the rewrite of the HTML validator away from using HTMLTidy to our custom solution. To verify, place this text in both a HTML file in Studio and HTMLTidy Online (http://infohound.net/tidy/): {code} New Web Project
First name:
Last name:
{code} Note that Studio marks the disabled attribute as 'attribute "disabled" has invalid value "disabled"' As an immediate workaround, you can add a validation filter of .*attribute.*invalid value.*" to the HTML Tidy Validator, though there is a outstanding bug preventing that from working ATM with APSTUD-4909/APSTUD-4910
column165:
15/Jun/12 4:26 AM;ingo;Until we get a proper fix in, the workaround is the suggested fix ATM.

From http://help.dottoro.com/lhaakiqa.php and http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/intro/sgmltut.html#h-3.3.4.2

* Specifying the DISABLED attribute with an arbitrary value has the same effect as specifying it with no value. 
* For example, all of the following declarations have the same effect: disabled, disabled="true", disabled="false", disabled="on", disabled="disabled". 
* Although Boolean attributes may be used with no value in HTML, for XHTML compatibility, always use the DISABLED attribute in the following format: disabled="disabled".
* Even though the attribute value is optional in HTML 4, of greatest compatibility, it should be left off

Suggested solution:
* Inspect the doctype in the validator
* If the doctype is HTML 4, do not validate for attribute values for boolean attributes
* For boolean attributes, add a completion proposal option equal to the name of the attribute (i.e. disabled="disabled")
* We may need to update the metadata to highlight these items.

column1: JSLint inside Aptana runs far slower than on the command line

As a check, time the approximate time it takes to lint ext-debug-all.js

# Create a new web project
# Add ext-debug-all.js into the project
# Turn JSLint on as a build validator
# Clean the project
# Time how long it takes to finish indexing. It will be about 200 seconds for me.

Now, download http://code.google.com/p/jslint4java/ and run from the command line

Make sure to use java -jar jslint4java-2.0.2.jar --maxerr 1000 ext-all-debug.js to replicate the same number of warnings as we output.

It runs in a fraction of the time.

column1: Implement JSLint-identical rules for most common subset of JS rules

column59:

already_defined*
and*
assign_exception*
avoid_a*
bad_assignment*
bad_new*
bad_number*
bad_wrap*
conditional_assignment*
constructor_name_a*
dangerous_comment*
dangling_a*

column1: Implement a new JavaScript validation framework
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
We have multiple different validators for JS. They are inefficient, out of date, and nearly unmaintainable.

Propose creating an infrastructure to replace this with a single way of defining rules.

Brief requirements:

# Should encapsulate these rules (http://jshint.com/)
# It should allow for style/usage validation for things like Titanium Mobile projects. This kind of validation might only happen in JS files in Titanium Mobile projects
# It should allow for cross-file validation.

Ideally, those rules exist in some form that can be modified and converted into our new format.
column164: 11/Jul/11 7:48 AM;ingo;Also see: http://users.skynet.be/mgueury/mozilla/ (SGML parser), http://www.htmlvalidator.com/ (HTML/CSS validator)
column165: 08/May/12 8:52 AM;ingo;Our first pass will be to strictly replace JSLint with identical rules. We can then enhance the system, making it more extensible and addicting additional validations.

column1: Error markers are not correct in PHP after refactoring to use parse cache (error markers are flushed).
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column164: 06/Jun/12 11:10 PM;fzadrozny;A proper fix would be making the parse result actually immutable.
column165:
08/Jun/12 4:34 AM;fzadrozny;This could be reproduced by creating a php document with an error:

<html>

<?php
var = 'var';
?>

</html>

Then changing it to be fixed (adding the $ on var):

<html>

<?php
$var = 'var';
?>

</html>

and then removing the '$' again: it'd be expected that the error was shown again, but it wasn't with the cache in place.

This is mainly because of the way that problems are reported by PHP: a problem collector is notified about errors during the parse and when the parse finishes, errors are reported, instead of working by adding problems found and later reporting them (after a parse).
column166: 14/Jun/12 12:33 AM;fzadrozny;Reverted back to the old behavior (PHP has no parse cache anymore).
column167: 15/Jun/12 1:26 AM;cheadley;Verified issue is fixed using the above test in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.7.4, and Ubuntu 11.10 using Titanium Studio build: 2.1.0.201206141932. Closing ticket.

column169:
17/May/12 8:53 AM;sgibly;Pushed a fix for the duplicated nodes. There was an issue with the PHP node-builder (HTML and PHP nodes merging) that caused that. 
Since the high CPU problem also occur when opening the content in a HTML editor, this fix is unlikely to affect it, so we still need to figure out what is the cause.
column170:
23/May/12 11:47 PM;fzadrozny;I was going to take a look at this issue, but I've tried reproducing this here on the latest development version without success. Can you still reproduce it there Shalom?

Now, I did have a curios issue where the source was not available for parsing: (Build 3.7.1) [ERROR] com.aptana.parsing/debug/parsing Expecting source to be available for parsing.

And after taking a look at the PHPSourceEditor, it seems it reuses the PHPParseState and sets contents in it (which could have effects on the parser) -- I think the parse state should be immutable so that we're guarded against any possible change (especially since the parsing happens in another thread, things can get corrupted there), so, I'll change our parse state implementations to be all immutable so that we don't have any possible issues there.

Also (probably unrelated), I took a look at the PHPParseState implementation and found that you always ask for a reparse on php... I also plan to make it work more closely to the other editors, reusing the cache if possible (do you see a problem there?)
column171: 24/May/12 3:29 AM;fzadrozny;Created patch to fix issue where the parse state could be corrupted (i.e.: changed from the main thread during a parse). As I couldn't really reproduce this, I'm not sure it was the source of it (but there's a chance it was -- and I couldn't reproduce the error I had previously from the source not being available for parsing).

column1: Prompt user before deleting a file with Undo
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Steps as listed here:

File > New File will create a new file. This will not respond to "Undo" (see Eclipse bug https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=219901 where they fixed that)

To replicate:

Eclipse 3.7.1 (JDT): Navigator, but not Package Explorer or Project Explorer
Titanium Studio (dev): App Explorer and Project Explorer
Titanium Studio 1.0.9: App Explorer and Project Explorer

# Open a file in the Editor.
# Select a file in a view listed above, in a non-Java project.
# Copy and paste the file in the view. The default name is fine.
# Go to the editor. Type a key and leave it unsaved.
# Re-focus the Project Explorer view. Press "Undo". The file copy will go away.

Now...

# Open up the .project file
# add <nature>org.eclipse.jdt.core.javanature</nature> to the project natures
# Close and reopen the project as above
# Retry the above steps. It won't work.

However, you can get the contents back again:
# Go into "Project Explorer"
# Right-click on the root of the project in question and select "Restore From Local History..."
# Select the particular resource, and if you like, select a version. Finish out of the dialog.

I thought this was an Eclipse bug, but since I can't replicate it in Project Explorer with a Java project, but I _can_ replicate it with an Aptana-natured Project (or actually a project with no natures too), I'm a bit confused. As evidenced by this thread (http://developer.appcelerator.com/question/121789/titanium-studio-deleting-my-files#answer-231188), users run into this issue all the time.

We should prompt the user before confirmation if we are in a state where there is a file deletion happening as a result of an undo event. Perhaps it's possible to listen for resource change events of this type, and ask the user in advance of the event happening. Note that they originally fixed the issue by removing file creation events from the undo history.
column164: 21/Feb/12 9:46 PM;ingo;Note the last comment here: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=203315. That suggests the problem should have been fixed, but Susan was not able to replicate the copy issue.
column165: 21/Feb/12 10:24 PM;ingo;Also see here for a related bug: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=344724
column166: 21/Feb/12 10:31 PM;ingo;Here's the commit that fixed the linked Eclipse issue: http://git.eclipse.org/c/platform/eclipse.platform.ui.git/commit/?id=9cf3737cbc4dd0da609117b42676b441fbb2427c. Note that it is not JDT-specific, so some other mechanism is at work here too. Also note you can replicate this inside Eclipse by not using a JDT project (i.e. browser.extensions)

I changed it so that for they will also be used for any of our projects, and now the behavior is similar to what JDT has, i.e. the Undo action is disabled after pasting a file into either App or Project Explorer.
column168: 18/Mar/12 10:24 PM;cwilliams;I'm not 100% sure what the expected behavior is. If I copy and paste an existing file int he Project Explorer, then I can "Undo Copy Resources". If I copy a file off the desktop and then paste it into the project, there is no "undo" command enabled. This is in Titanium Studio 2.0.1.201203192423
column169: 18/Mar/12 10:46 PM;ingo;That sounds as if it has not addressed the root issue--that you can copy and paste a file from the project explorer, into the project explorer, and NOT be able to undo that change.
column170: 19/Mar/12 8:57 AM;mxia;Weird; it's working when running from workspace, but not in the standalone version.
column171: 20/Mar/12 2:36 AM;mxia;Will reopen the issue as the standalone version still uses Eclipse copy-and-paste instead of ours even though it contains the change.
column172:
03/Apr/12 8:52 AM;mxia;Finally fixed the issue. It turned out Pydev also overrides the same Eclipse action provider for copy/paste/delete, and that blocked any new custom provider. Changed to override the Pydev one instead, but eventually we should limit Pydev's enablement for its navigator to only apply to resources under pydev project (currently it applies to all IResources), so there won't be a conflict when activating action providers that apply to different contexts.

Pushed to both release and development branches.

column1: Unable to construct JS instances from built-in types using the "new" operator
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column164: 18/May/12 8:42 AM;klindsey;This is most likely a metadata issue. The "Array" and "Function" properties on "Window" need to be function properties that have a return type corresponding to the property's type: "new Array" creates an instance of "Array". I think that processing of SDocML files should be normalized when reading metadata at startup and when indexing sdocml project files. That will normalize how constructors are defined from metadata while at the same time, that should resolve this case.
column165: 22/May/12 5:32 AM;ingo;In researching, it appears Kevin isn't specifically referring to the actual SDOCML metadata files, but rather during the loading process, which is why he refers to the normalization of the two mechanisms.

column1: Auto-normalize newlines in Find Bar
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Related to APSTUD-4750, I tried a multiline search that matched, then I changed the file's line endings from between the settings and also pasted mismatched versions (between editor and find bar) in the find box and was able to get a case where they did not match (I think I searched with the version containing \r line endings and the file/editor had \n endings).

Looking at Sublime Text, even if I changed the carriage returns in the file, the text still matched. This should be the default behavior. If a user wishes to override that setting, they can do so by using explicit regular expressions (neither TextMate nor Sublime Text offer a setting for that, so it must not be very important)

I've tried setting the -vm path directly, but then it can't find the JVM either, so there must be a middle ground. It would be worth confirming if 3.1.1 saved into a "C:\Users\Миша\" works correctly.
column171: 18/May/12 4:51 PM;ingo;Studio 3.1.1 fails the same way, so we need a different way to repo the problem. We may have a different issue with having Studio run from foreign-named directory.
column172: 20/May/12 5:07 PM;ingo;As a different approach, I downloaded the jQuery ruble, and set Studio to load Rubles from a specific directory. -Dstudio.rubleUserLocation=C:\Users\Ingo Muschenetz\Desktop\Миша\Aptana Rubles\ fails (Cyrillic) -Dstudio.rubleUserLocation=C:\Users\Ingo Muschenetz\Desktop\Aptana Rubles\ works This also fails: -Dstudio.rubleUserLocation=C:\Users\Ingo Muschenetz\Desktop\Cağaloğlu\Aptana Rubles\ (Turkish) This fails both if I edit the config file, and also if I set this as a debugging launch configuration. However, if I explicitly edit the code that sets that variable, and save the enclosing file as UTF-8, the ruble then loads.
column173: 21/May/12 1:23 AM;cwilliams;I'm trying this out too, and this appears to be a JRE issue (or maybe the exe launcher from Eclipse?). See http://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php/mv/tree/173204/ I tried upgrading my JRE and that didn't seem to help any. In nay case, I think not being able to launch the IDE inside a unicode directory path is separate from the ruble issue.
column174: 21/May/12 5:38 AM;ingo;Manually updating the reference in BundleManager to where to load external bundles to a foreign-character-containing path does work. However, it does not appear you can specify a path in the config file due to the following bug: http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4488646

column1: Double quotes in JIRA ticket summary field breaks ticket submission dialog
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Choose Help > Titanium Studio > Submit Ticket...
# Add a summary like 'This is a "ticket"' (no single quotes)

h3. Actual:
The ticket will fail to submit with an error

h3. Expected:
The ticket submits
column60: Windows (unable to reproduce on OS X)
column164: 20/May/12 3:36 PM;ingo;We convert " to ' in the ticket summary. This was the simplest way to avoid the problem on Windows (not an issue on OS X, evidently.)

On my Win7 VM

column1: Investigate replacement for JSLint
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
This ticket involves the investigation of the complexity in replacing JSLint with our own validation framework

http://www.jslint.com/

# What rules do we need to encapsulate

For ease in migration for existing users, it us suggested we accept the current comment-based options that JSLint allows.
column164: 02/May/12 2:44 AM;cwilliams;This looks to be a pretty good list of the messages it can spit out (and thus what it's checking for): http://www.jslint.com/msgs.html
column165: 02/May/12 2:49 AM;cwilliams;Here's the source for JSLint: https://github.com/douglascrockford/JSLint

16/May/12 9:40 PM;ingo;Took a second pass. Tried to figure out everything JSHint is using. I think that added maybe 5-8 rules to do, though I did notice some of those error messages were quite overloaded, so it may be that multiple tules spit out one error message.

Note: The following JSHint rules I can't seem to locate. They would be worth doing if possible:
* nonew
* eqnull
* globalstrict
* lastsemic
* laxbreak
* laxcomma
* multistring
* onecase
* regexdash
* validthis

Otherwise, I say we refine the rules above (revisit unexpected_a, for example, just to confirm it's complete), see if we can find any more of the JSHint rules, and then pick another handful off the list above that seem helpful if we have time.
column169: 16/May/12 11:57 PM;cwilliams;http://www.jameswiseman.com/blog/2011/01/17/jslint-a-guide-to-jslint-messages/
column170: 20/May/12 12:12 PM;ingo;I used JSHint as a marker about what rules might be most important to implement first. I say we keep APSTUD-4691 separate and some of the research in this ticket will just make that one easier. it may be that JSHint has different algorithms for the same rule so we should double-check.
column171: 20/May/12 4:21 PM;ingo;My hope was to finish out the green items (meaning they overlap between JSLint and JSHint) for Phase 1. What would you guesstimate to do just the green highlighted items? I count 13 left.
column172: 21/May/12 5:01 AM;cwilliams;Closing. Opened APSTUD-4742 and a number of sub-tasks for finishing up investigations based on groupings of the warnings.

column1: Unable to reliably disable syntax validation
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
# Ensure Preferences > Studio > Validation > CSS > CSS Syntax Validation is on
# Open a new CSS file
# Paste in "body {"
# It should show as a syntax error
# Go to preferences, and turn off syntax validation

Note that the error above persists. You can do the same thing inside JavaScript.

Note that I was able to turn off validation, restart Studio, edit the CSS file and save it, and the error went away...so somehow validation can be turned off.
column164:
30/Apr/12 6:57 AM;mxia;Think Chris is better suited to implement the proper fix. The basic issue is that when syntax validation is turned off, it no longer participates in the build process, so re-building all doesn't trigger the validator to clean its related problem markers. The markers will get removed for the file when you start editing it, as the reconciler would still run and clean them.

The solution seems to be that we should store the list of enabled build participants when the preference page first opened and compare it with the list when OK is pressed to find the participants that got disabled, and for those, we call clean on them, and the syntax validators could then delete the markers in clean() method.
column165: 17/May/12 7:11 AM;cwilliams;Closed code review, incorporated feedback, merged to 'release', pushed to github.
column166: 18/May/12 5:43 AM;cheadley;Verified fixed in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.7.3 and Ubuntu 11.10 using Titanium Studio build: 2.0.2.201205171647. Closing ticket.

column1: Document additional facets of the scripting architecture
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
We may have documentation on this already, but the most complicated area in the current implementation revolves around visibility events. These events are driven by changes in visibility of commands and such based on bundle precedence rules.

* We may want to consider removing all notions of augmentation, which would simplify this area a bit
* Discuss how "inputs" and "outputs" should be pulled out into extensions to
** Improve code
** Allow other input/output types to be contributed
* Discuss a possible way to fix bundle loading issues we've seen on Windows.
** We need to be able to lock the loading of a bundle until its bundle.rb has been processed. This sounds easy, but I think it will have a big impact on the code, unfortunately
column164: 17/May/12 2:19 AM;ingo;Document is here: https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/tools/Scripting

column1: Document project build path architecture
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
* We may want to discuss how items in project build paths should be handled
* Ideally, each library is indexed only once regardless of how many projects reference it
* Metadata should be handled with the same system
** This may allow metadata files to auto-update on changes instead of relying on the JS index version number we maintain manually right now
** Then again, changes to the structure of the index content will still require a version number change

column1: Document the JSCA processing architecture
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
We had tried to come up with a system for JSCA that was comparable to how our XML metadata works: SAX-like parsing and event driven handlers. However, the result is much too complicated and harder to maintain than it should be.

It's worth documenting how the handler works at a minimum. Additionally, it might be good to discuss an alternate approach, that, although tied directly to the JSCA structure, is easier to maintain and update.

column1: Create JavaDocs as part of the build process
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
During the Aptana Studio and Titanium Studio build process, we need to create a set of JavaDocs to make it easier for end users to navigate and understand.

This ideally is placed into a "javadocs" folder in this area http://hudson-master.hdqt.appcelerator.com/hudson/job/studio3-feature-master/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/build-artifacts/, so that they can be uploaded as part of the nightly sync. There should be some set of ANT tasks we can use to generate the docs.

We also need to replace the default stylesheet with the JBoss one: https://community.jboss.org/wiki/JBossorgStylesheetsForJavadocAndJXRXrefReports?_sscc=t
column164:
08/May/12 2:12 AM;cwilliams;Here's the docs for titanium-core-release: http://hudson-master.hdqt.appcelerator.com/hudson/view/titanium-release/job/titanium-core-release/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/build-artifacts/docs/index.html

So we're generating docs for the two major APIs we provide. I'm going to resolve this for now, and if we need/want to do PyDev/PHP/Ruby - then I can pretty easily port this over (except PyDev). I think the larger issue is if we want to publish these somewhere.

To verify: Please visit the links I posted in this comment and the previous to verify that we have Javadocs still working for the builds.

column1: Add command-line option to load the rubles sequentially
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
We should add a command-line option to allow for sequential loading of bundles. It would make testing much easier.

It could either be to load all bundles sequentially, or it could enforce a maximum number of bundles that can be loaded at a time (which I would set to 1), something like:

studio.loadBundlesSequentially, or studio.bundleLoadConcurrency

Note, I also believe BundleManager.loadBundle() does not properly respect the wait parameter. Unless you are unit testing, it does nothing.
column164:
26/Apr/12 11:58 PM;cwilliams;Pushed to 'release'.

To verify:
# Open the Progress view in Studio (Window > Show View > Other... > Progress)
# Close Studio
# Open the AptanaStudio3.ini file (on Mac, it's inside the AptanaStudio3.app/Contents/MacOS, so you need to right click ont he app and "Show Contents". For Windows, it should live beside the exe)
# Add the following line to the end:
{code}
-Dstudio.bundleLoadConcurrency=1
{code}
# Start up Studio, and verify that in the Progress view only one job is ever running at one time to load all the bundles. You will see listings for the other bundles, but they should all show as "(Waiting)", with only one active at any given time until they're all loaded.
# Once done verifying this, you'll want to revert the changes to the AptanaStudio3.ini file (or for bonus points trying a value of 0, a negative value, above 1 and a non-integer value to test the other cases - negative and zero should still use concurrency of 1, over 1 should be taken fine (and that is the number of active bundle loads at any given time in the progress view), and a non-integer value should fall back to old behavior which is to use a concurrency level equal to the # of processors in your system).

column1: Have IdeLog log using the product version, not the version of the plugin
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: In general, when logging a file, we most care about the product version (i.e. 3.0.8) as opposed to the version of the plugin (i.e. build 3.0.0.1326742432) which may not change as frequently as the product version. Update IdeLog to use the RCP/Plugin product version instead.
column164: 13/Feb/12 7:07 AM;mxia;It turns out Eclipse logger implementation gets the version string from the plugin that is passed into the IdeLog.log() method, and there isn't a way to override this particular behavior, so we would have to log everything as from a single plugin to achieve this.  After discussion with Ingo, we feel the better way would be to enable submitting JIRA ticket from inside Studio and simply the product version number there.
column165: 26/Apr/12 1:22 AM;ingo;Out of curiosity, why couldn't we log with EclipseUtil.getProductVersion() assuming we were in standalone mode?
column166: 26/Apr/12 5:10 AM;mxia;The problem is Eclipse logger doesn't take a version string separate from the plugin; its API just accepts a plugin instance and deducts the version from it.
column167: 26/Apr/12 10:29 AM;mxia;I was mistaken. We do control the outputted version string, and fixed to use the product version in the about box for the standalone case and branding plugin for the Eclipse plugins case.

I added a Main class that shows how to parse, get errors and warnings, and displays various string formats of the AST.

column1: Aptana forces the path of the Document root on server to start with a "/" (slash)
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
There is some problem in Window platform, it cause unable to start php debug.
I use PDT with xDebug few year and no problem at all, but move to aptana, it not work.

Version :
Aptana studio 3 nightly
Windows 7 32bit pro
PHP 5.2.6
Apache 2.2.9
xDebug 2.1.2-5.2-vc6-nts.dll

Problem:
All problem come from the web servers setting

-Preferences -> Aptana Studio -> Web Server -> simple web server or external web server (both of them have this bugs.)

On the Document Root , if i select my web root and press [OK]
Aptana automatic add a slash to the path, if i remove manully and press [OK], aptana will add it again forever.

See screen shot:
!http://i.imgur.com/lz1Xr.png!
!http://i.imgur.com/mrOeT.png!

This cause not able to start the url after i press Debug button,
Aptana will translate the url to
[LocalPath] + [HTTP Url]

see screenshot:
!http://i.imgur.com/IYvCW.png!

This's not happen on ubuntu OS, only on windows OS.bugs
column164:
25/Apr/12 1:09 AM;cwilliams;Pushed fix to 'release'. There were two issues:
1. we were transforming the path to "portable" string in the text field, not the OS string - but we were reading it back in as OS string.
2. When we took the stored value as a URI and tried to reconvert back to a file IPath, we needed to instantiate a File from the URI and then do Path.fromOsString(file.getAbsolutePath()); We were takeing the URI's "scheme-specific path/part" and trying to read that in, which prepended it with a leading slash.

For QA/verification:
This is a Windows only issue!
1. Open the Servers view (Window > Show View > Servers)
2. In the Servers view, click the dropdown toolbar icon to add a server and select "External Web Server"
3. In the dialog that appears, enter in "Testing" for name, "http://localhost:8000" in the Base URL and then click the Browse button to the right of the Document Root text field.
4. Select some location on disk (remember the location)
5. Verify that the path selected is inserted into the Document Root text field (with the correct slashes for Windows - '\' vs '/')
6. Click Ok to close the dialog. An entry should appear in the servers view.
7. Click the new entry and then click the pencil icon in the Servers view toolbar to edit it.
8. verify that the Document Root path is the same as before (and doesn't contain a leading slash)
column165: 26/Apr/12 1:31 AM;cheadley;Verified using Chris' steps in Windows 7 using Aptana Studio build: 3.1.2.201204251831. Closing ticket.

column1: Implement a Jira Manager class
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
The class should handle all requests need to complete the workflow of creating a ticket in JIRA from within Studio, e.g.

1. User login
2. Submit the ticket to JIRA with all the related fields

And possibly more. The class should report errors when encountered, and there should be unit tests to cover each scenario.

column1: Unable to create project in location with pre-existing files

Aptana Studio 3, build: 3.1.0.201202211744
Linux enterprise 3.0.0-16-generic-pae #29-Ubuntu SMP Tue Feb 14 13:56:31 UTC 2012 i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux
column164: 21/Apr/12 7:37 PM;maxcady;Same Problem here. I ended up renaming the existing folder create a new empty folder with the original name of the renamed folder. Copied the project file and settings folder into the original (renamed) folder, deleted the new created folder and gave the renamed folder its original name back. Quite complicated, eh? :-)
column165: 22/Apr/12 8:32 PM;leo.unglaub;A little quickfix is, that you use the Import / General/ "Existing Folder as new project" Wizard to setup your project. There it works.
column166:
23/Apr/12 2:23 AM;ingo;To verify:

# Create a new web project using the default location. Should work as expected.
# Create another new project, but choose a folder on disk that has files in it already. It should warn you, but allow you to continue
# Change that location to a place that has no pre-existing files. The warning should go away
# All three options should allow you to press the "finish" button

column1: Remove default HTML snippets from inside attribute values
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
# Create a new test.html file
# Type <div id="m"
# Notice snippets for "movie," etc. Almost universally, snippets don't make sense in attribute values unless they are specifically crafted for that.

Expected:
Remove all default HTML snippets from inside attribute values.
column164: 23/Mar/12 3:15 AM;cwilliams;Ideally we'd just alter the scope selectors to be "text.html - (source | string)", but it appears that we don't support that syntax properly (at least to match TextMate behavior).
column165: 23/Mar/12 3:17 AM;ingo;How hard would it be to upgrade scope support for that syntax?
column166:
23/Mar/12 4:35 AM;cwilliams;We don't support the parentheses to group, and we don't support the '|' form of the or operator. It'd be pretty easy to add '|' to be the same as ',' for OR, but if we wanted to truly support the full syntax we may want to look into generating a scanner/parser to build these. Here's the only reference I could find: http://lists.macromates.com/textmate/2008-June/025964.html

I did peek at redcar to see how they implement scope matching and they do something similar to we do for breaking them up (i.e. they don't support '&', '|', or parens), but they turn them into regular expressions (which I've filed a ticket for in the past).
column167: 05/Apr/12 12:01 AM;klindsey;Updated the scopes in the HTML commands and snippets so as to exclude their activation within HTML attribute values. Updated the [Ruble Specification| https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/tis/Ruble+Specification]to include descriptions and precedence levels for the newly supported scope selector operators.
column168: 05/Apr/12 6:26 AM;mxia;Verified on Titanium Studio build 2.0.2.201204041630.

column1: Build participants get instantiated even if they're not used in build, resulting in unused plugins loading unnecessarily
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: I noticed that even if I had no PHP projects or files in my workspace, the PHP plugin is loading and generating builtins (which eats RAM). Diving deeper, it's because of the way I implemented the UnifiedBuilder and build participants. We instantiate every single one, then filter them down by enablement and then on a per-file basis we filter based on content types. If possible we should only instantiate the actual classes when they're used, and filter based on prefs/extension attributes.
column164: 20/Mar/12 11:20 PM;ingo;Do you know if that's a regression from 3.0?

column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
My log file contains a number of the following messages:

{code}
!ENTRY com.aptana.git.core 4 0 2012-03-13 21:43:46.911

Unless this is truly an error, we should lower the level to WARNING or INFO. For the relevant git error messages, it would also be nice to indicate which git repo is the culprit, in case that is relevant.
column164: 15/Apr/12 10:38 PM;cwilliams;Lowered log level to INFO.
column165:
15/Apr/12 10:41 PM;cwilliams;For QA: 
  - Have a project attached to our git support, that is cloned from a remote repo (so maybe just clone a project off github).
  - Do a git pull and while it is still running try to right-click on the project and view Team > Remotes > Push current branch to > ... sub-menu.

You can edit your log level filtering in Preferences > Studio > Troubleshooting to verify that it is now INFO level instead of ERROR.

column1: Allow setting CA platform/user-agents per-project
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: We have the ability to globally set up what user-agents/platforms to show in CA by project nature. This seems unlikely to be too useful beyond turning on titanium platforms for titanium natures and browsers for any others. I'm assuming users would want to tailor the set of platforms/agents on a per-project basis, with the ability to set defaults for all projects (or maybe natures as-is).
column164:
06/Apr/12 8:30 AM;sgibly;Implemented and pushed to 'release'.

It's now possible to set a project-specific User-Agents through the workspace preferences, and through the project properties(see screenshots).

Applying a specific project settings will affect the content-assist immediately, and you should start seeing only the agents defined specifically for that project .
column165:
09/Apr/12 4:38 AM;cwilliams;Verified that you can set project specific settings for CA user agents per-project.

However, I find that the disablement of the User agent filtering option on a per-project basis to be confusing. Why wouldn't we allow the user to change that as well? We'd just need to look up the prefs in a chain in the content assist processors (look at project scope for the project and then at workspace/instance scope).

column1: Consider improving performance of AST merging in CompositeParser
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: While looking over an issue related to offsets when parsing nested languages in RHTML/HTML, I noticed that we have code that effectively merges nodes into the top-level AST. I believe the current implementation can be improved considerably, performance-wise. Currently, all nodes are flattened into a list and that list is traversed for each node being inserted into the tree. Instead, we should take advantage of the existing functionality in IParseNode#getNodeAtOffset.
column164:
06/Apr/12 12:15 AM;klindsey;Now using IParseNode#getNodeAtOffset(int) to locate the candidate node in an editor's primary language AST when inserting nested language nodes in the AST.

This was a technical task, so it will be difficult to test specifically. There are unit tests to confirm that the change behaves the same as the code that was replaced. If anything is broken by this change, it would be visible in RHTML/ERB and PHP files.
column165: 06/Apr/12 3:20 AM;ingo;Reviewed tests as passing on http://hudson-master.hdqt.appcelerator.com/hudson/job/studio3-core-release-tests/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/com.aptana.editor.common.parsing/. Closing in Titanium Studio, build: 2.0.2.201204051557.

column1: Determine best approach for walking AST to match patterns

* XPath
* Tree pattern matching
* Tree parsers
* Parallel XPath

This mechanism would likely be used for more than just HTML AST walking.

column1: Default colors in the diff view are not readable
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: The diff view is not readable with the default color theme. The black bars on the black background have zero contrast with each other.
column164: 13/Jan/12 4:53 AM;cwilliams;Pushed fix to 'release' and 'development'. Fix was to override the compare view colors. We use the (typically red/green) colors from git/markup.added and markup.deleted scopes for the conflicting/resolved colors. For incoming/outgoing colors we take the theme bg color and invert it, which typically results in a very visible "gray-ish" color between the bg/fg color. Otherwise with dark themes we'd have a black compare color bg and a dark theme bg so the mid-level between them was not very obvious.
column165: 13/Jan/12 5:29 AM;leo.unglaub;Thanks for the fast response. Does "Pushed fix to 'release' and 'development'." meant that i can test the cahnges tomorrow via the nightly update sources?

column174:
06/Apr/12 2:07 AM;cwilliams;Got caught up in a tangent on some git functionality being broken in Eclipse 4.2 (which I was trying to use to look through history related to these changes to see where I touched compare/diff colors before).

Managed to find where we are setting compare colors, fixed it so that we do it in the theme manager code itself, rather than in a pref listener on a git ui plugin - which meant that the compare colors never got set if the user didn't use some git UI functionality which was the cause of Leo's issue. Pushed the fix to 'release'.

For QA/Verification:

# The exact steps to reproduce are to start with a clean workspace and the "Studio" theme set.
# App Explorer > Create Project > Web project. name it 'web'
# Hit "Next", select "HTML 5 Boilerplate (Cached)" template
# Then select on 404.html and index.html
# right-click and choose "Compare With > Each other".

Previously it used black boxes to outline the changes between the files. With the fix, it should use lighter gray boxes and highlight the changes in a gray background. It would be helpful to verify that a number of the differently colored themes work visually (try a light, dark, and "other" theme like Studio, Mac Classic and Cobalt or choco; make sure that you can easily see changes and read them in the compare editor).

column176: 06/Apr/12 2:38 AM;cwilliams;Leo: It should just work for you after next nightly, no need to change prefs or change workspaces for you.

column1: JavaScript content assist not automatic from between contiguous braces
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
JavaScript content assist is usually automatic from inside a code block, however not when the code block consists of two contiguous braces.


Steps to Replicate :

1) Open Aptana Studio
2) Open a JavaScript file
3) Enter "function fun() {|}" and enter the character 'a' at the pipe


Expected Results :

A content assist pane with alert and Array should pop up automatically.


Actual Results :

CTRL+Space is necessary to bring up the content assist pane.
column164: 02/Feb/12 2:42 AM;ingo;I believe we could address this by inside content assist for JS, we look to see if the previous character is a " " (space). We could amend that to also see if it's some form of delimiter (say a '{', '(', or ';')
column165:
11/Apr/12 1:47 AM;klindsey;I added '{' as an auto-activation character in JSContentAssistProcessor#isValidAutoActivation. This solves this case and improves CA for object literals inside of Titanium API calls.

* Create a new Web Project
* Create a new empty JS file
* Type: function fun() {}
* Place the cursor between the curly braces
* Type: a

At this point you should see JS CA for items starting with 'a'

* Create a new Titanium Mobile Project
* Open app.'s if it is not already open
* On an empty line type: Titanium.UI.createLabel({});
* Place the cursor between the curly braces
* Type: w

At this point you should see JS CA for object literal property names starting with 'w'
column166: 12/Apr/12 4:06 AM;mxia;Verified the correct behavior on Titanium Studio build 2.0.2.201204111756.
column167: 12/Apr/12 4:06 AM;mxia;Re-opening to clear out the remaining time.

column1: Show differences in synchronize window extremely slow.
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Synchronize files to bring up the Synchronize window.  A list of files will show up in the preview window.  Right click on any file that needs updating and "Show differences".

The software will hang for a LONG time before bringing up the text differences window.

These are the exact steps I used to produce the issue:

1.  Click on the Project Explorer tab.
2.  Click on a project.
3.  Right click and deploy app.
4.  Synchronize window shows up showing a list of files.
5.  Right click on any file that need updating.
6.  Click on Show Differences.

This is where it hangs.  The files I work with range in anywhere from 1K to 150K.  The 1K files takes a few seconds to compare.  The 150K files takes longer than 5 mins (I gave up after 5 minutes).
column164: 07/Sep/11 3:27 AM;ingo;Try to reproduce, see if we can add logging.
column165: 07/Sep/11 5:09 AM;ltruong;I forgot to include in the original description that the file compare occurs between a local file and a remote ftp file.  The connection speed is 768k/128k.
column166:
07/Sep/11 9:21 AM;ingo;Lien,

Does the pause happen before or after the "finding differences" process dialog shows up? i.e., is it looks like it's hanging on the downloading of the file, or on the finding of the differences?

I tried replicating this with very large files (multiple MB files) without issue.
column167:
07/Sep/11 11:11 AM;ltruong;I attached a screenshot of where the issue is occuring.

The context menu is brought up by right mouse clicking.  When I click on Show Differences on that file, I get the wait cursor while the program does its magic.

The compare window never shows up as it is stuck on the wait cursor and nothing else happens.

If I show differences on the init.php file instead shown in the screen shot, I get the wait cursor for about 10s before a small window pops up very briefly, closes automatically, then followed by the compare window highlighting the differences.  This works as expected, albeit a little slow for such a small file.

After experimenting a little more, it SEEMS like the ide is hanging on something related to the SFTP connection or transfer.  The reason why I think it is the cause is that if I Show differences, wait, then cancel and repeat the cycle a few more times, the IDE eventually pops up the file difference windows for the previous requests.  It also pops up the small error or dialog box but it is automatically closed almost instantly before I can see its contents.

I hope this helps!
column168: 08/Sep/11 8:00 AM;ltruong;I had Aptana still open today from yesterday's.  After browsing my local file directory for a few minutes, the compare window opened, showing the differences between the file that was causing the app to hang from yesterday.  I did not do any synchronize or show differences today so the window must have been from a request yesterday.

column170:
28/Sep/11 11:43 AM;ltruong;Are there any updates to this issue?

After using the Deployment and show difference features more, I have noticed that if I cancel after about 5 seconds while it's hanging, a window will pop up an SFTP error saying the connection did not complete.  

If I wait a few minutes then the software will either bring up the file difference window or just hang forever.
column171: 28/Sep/11 12:06 PM;ingo;I did manage to replicate this in just using the synchronize window and comparing differences. It was not 100% reliable to replicate, but I did get it often enough. It appeared as if it was waiting for the file to download. Max, can you see if you can replicate the issue?
column172:
30/Sep/11 8:19 AM;ltruong;I took a look at section in the log files that looks suspect:

{code}

java.io.IOException: The channel is closed [Unnamed Channel]
	at com.enterprisedt.net.j2ssh.connection.Channel.sendChannelData(Channel.java:236)
	at com.enterprisedt.net.j2ssh.subsystem.SubsystemChannel.sendMessage(SubsystemChannel.java:72)
	at com.enterprisedt.net.j2ssh.sftp.SftpSubsystemClient.closeHandle(SftpSubsystemClient.java:197)
	at com.enterprisedt.net.j2ssh.sftp.SftpSubsystemClient.closeFile(SftpSubsystemClient.java:215)
	at com.enterprisedt.net.j2ssh.sftp.SftpFile.close(SftpFile.java:230)
	at com.enterprisedt.net.j2ssh.sftp.SftpFileInputStream.close(SftpFileInputStream.java:129)
	at com.enterprisedt.net.ftp.ssh.SSHFTPInputStream.close(SSHFTPInputStream.java:383)
	at com.aptana.filesystem.secureftp.internal.SFTPFileDownloadInputStream.safeClose(SFTPFileDownloadInputStream.java:36)
	at com.aptana.filesystem.secureftp.internal.SFTPFileDownloadInputStream.read(SFTPFileDownloadInputStream.java:50)
	at org.eclipse.compare.structuremergeviewer.Differencer.contentsEqual(Differencer.java:452)
{code}

It looks like either the file is downloaded properly and the connection drops, or the connection drops while the file is being downloaded.

Looking at the enterprisedt's sftp client, there are a few flags that aren't being initialized in the ftpclient that may be causing the issue, particularly ones that deal with SSL closure or data wait on close.  See http://www.enterprisedt.com/products/edtftpjssl/doc/api/com/enterprisedt/net/ftp/ssl/SSLFTPClient.ConfigFlags.html for the list of config flags.
column173: 30/Sep/11 9:09 AM;mstepanov;Thanks for the info. We will take a look asap.

column1: Updating to latest RCP on dev installs JDT plugins
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
{html}

I noticed this by seeing no content in the App Explorer, which is something Ingo had seen. After some digging, it looks like Java filters got applied, which was especially surprising since we shouldn't have any. So I dug further and see JDT plugins in my installation, yet I don't see them belonging to any of the features, so I'm not sure how they got installed.

{html}
column164:
07/Jun/11 7:22 PM;cwilliams;{html}

Looks like Pydev has optional dependencies on some JDT plugins, which if the user just does nothing will end up getting installed on an update since Eclipse checks all available software update sites including their master one that has JDT.

{html}
column168:
07/Jun/11 7:22 PM;fzadrozny;{html}

Hi Ingo,

Right now it's not something easy to change (the main pydev plugin depends on jdt for adding the jython support, which won't work without jdt, although it's really only needed if jython is used).

Usually I recommend users to uncheck the 'contact all update sites during install to find required software', in which case those wouldn't be gotten... maybe that flag can be off by default in the rcp install? (the other good thing here would be that the install process would also be faster -- and I'm assuming that usually those dependencies from the 'master' eclipse are not needed anyways).

The other solution would be creating a separate feature for jython support in pydev, but in this case it might require more work to make that happen (also, we'd need to see how that separate download would be offered).

{html}
column169:
07/Jun/11 7:22 PM;ingo;{html}

Hi Fabio,

Thanks. Is that a new thing, or has it always been that way? I don't remember it doing that, but perhaps I didn't notice?

Alternately, we could also go the "Update Aptana" route like we did in 2.0, where it would only contact our update sites.

Thanks,
Ingo

{html}
column170:
07/Jun/11 7:22 PM;fzadrozny;{html}

Hi Ingo,

Reviewing tickets :)

It has always been like this. I think the better way would be going through the same route as 2.0.

Cheers,

Fabio

{html}
column171:
07/Jun/11 7:22 PM;ingo;{html}

I think we can use the portal to offer this separate jython feature. Let's plan on that for 3.0 final release.

{html}
column172:
07/Jun/11 7:22 PM;aptana1;{html}

I actually just turned off the Eclipse update sites in the RCP by default, which should fix this (or I did in Titanium RCP, and should do the same in Studio). Is that enough to fix it, or do we need to package the jython support as an option install?

{html}
column173:
07/Jun/11 7:22 PM;fzadrozny;{html}

I think that should be enough.

{html}
column174:
07/Jun/11 7:22 PM;aptana1;{html}

Okay, we've disabled the Eclipse updates sites by default. Marking this as resolved.

{html}

column1: Don't block IDE usage when updating user bundles
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Currently, when updating Rubles, the script (Commands > Bundle Development > Update User Bundles) may hang the IDE for some time. It has been suggested that moving this into Java would give better feedback to the end user and avoid this.

This may depend on the cache files being pulled out of source control and built on the build server instead as part of the packaging steps.
column164:
05/Jan/12 12:00 AM;cwilliams;Pushed fix to 'development' branch of bundle-dev.ruble.

Instead of converting into a Java implementation, I made use of scheduling the updates in a user Job, so that it would run async. This also allowed for us to provide progress on the operations (at a high level, not the actual git pull/svn update), as well as cancellation. After each command run to update we spit out the output to the scripting console so users can see exactly what was output. This definitely provides a much better experience for users, and allows them to continue to work with the IDE by setting the job to run in the background if they desire.
column165:
14/Mar/12 8:41 AM;ingo;Reopening this, but this may be a related issue and could be a new ticket.

So, I have one ruble "smoke-test" ruble in my Rubles folder. I select to update the user bundles, and I get a popup that shows it trying to update, but no progress ever happens. If I do a pull on the command line, it works, but it did ask me for a password, so perhaps we aren't showing a password prompt.

That could be a separate issue, but when I tried to cancel the update, nothing happened. It says "cancel requested" but doesn't do anything.
column166: 14/Mar/12 10:53 PM;ingo;Even if still an issue, not a blocker since the behavior is better and it can wait.
column167: 26/Mar/12 5:41 AM;ingo;Determined this is a separate issue and will file a new ticket for it.

column59:
# Type:
# Aptana will add the closing
for you # Press enter (thinking your will get a new line), and a name tag is inserted. Actual result: {code}
{code} Expected result: {code}
|
{code} You can work around the issue by one of two ways: # Hit "esc" before "enter" # Edit the XML bundle and remove the "short tag" definition The XML definition should not apply in HTML, as that snippet seems counter-productive. It does not apply in HTML in TextMate.
column165: 23/Mar/12 12:03 AM;ingo;As verification, if you "Edit this bundle" for XML on the built version, the problem goes away.
column166: 23/Mar/12 12:30 AM;cwilliams;The bundle cache generator we run to pre-build bundle caches on our build machine wasn't properly handling usage of "with_defaults", so a number of commands/snippets were missing properties, most often the scope. Pushed fix up to master of studio3-sdk, so any new builds should properly fix this.
