column1: Hook up rails server launching to new servers view
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: Now that the servers view is back, we should hook up the rails application launching to use it as it used to in RadRails.
column164: 17/Oct/11 10:52 PM;cwilliams;Pushed to 'development' branch: https://github.com/aptana/studio3-ruby/commit/4f3d6fd1596da82c9e1859c769e9e8eff8676511
column165:
21/Mar/12 3:27 PM;ingo;How should I test this? I tried:

# Create new rails project
# Right-click "Run Server"
# Opened up the servers view. I don't see anything there.
column166: 21/Mar/12 10:08 PM;cwilliams;This ticket basically added "Rails server" as a type of server you can manually add, start, stop, debug, remove from the Servers view. The current "RunsServer" and "Debug Server" commands aren't hooked up to that - because they were created before we brought the view back, and launch the server in the Terminal view. I think as far as implementing a "rail Server" type this ticket is verified in the latest builds, but there's definitely related work of making those old commands use it, fixing the UI up a little nicer, detecting hyperlinks, maybe adding other features we used to have (like a button on the console to launch the browser, or a specific "Rails application" launch type that would start the server and open a browser preview for you)
column167: 21/Mar/12 10:47 PM;cwilliams;Verified in 3.1.0 build that I can add/remove/start/stop Rails servers in the Servers view.

column1: Remove Firefox installation requirement on Studio startup and instead show prompt on Firefox debug launch
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: Currently, we prompt the user for an install of Firefox if we can't find it at startup. We should instead do the check and install if they've chosen to debug with Firefox.
column164: 03/Nov/11 5:53 AM;ingo;Do we have a ticket for the Chromium debugger? I think we were including it as part of APSTUD-2186, but that seems incorrect.
column165: 07/Feb/12 8:03 AM;mxia;From looking at the code, I believe we could in fact remove the prompt for Firefox installation altogether, since when user tries to debug with Firefox and it doesn't exist, an error status dialog such as "Web browser executable does not exist at location /Applications/Firefox.app" will be shown.
column166: 07/Feb/12 8:07 AM;ingo;Okay, but it should realistically prompt you _before_ you start debugging that you will run into an error, so you have time to fix it.
column167:
07/Feb/12 8:20 AM;mxia;Here is how the workflow would look like if we remove the prompt for installing Firefox at startup but keep everything else such as setting up the launch history for shortcuts:

1. If user doesn't have Firefox installed before launching Studio, "Firefox - Internal Server" would not appear directly under the Debug icon in the main toolbar;
2. If user then goes to Debug As > Debug Configurations... to set up one for Firefox, the wizard will show an error at the top about the location not found so user will know to correct it.
3. Once user installed Firefox, the "Firefox - Internal Server" will be added to the launch history for shortcut the next time Studio restarts, so user could debug against Firefox from there.

Overall I think this workflow is acceptable.
column168: 07/Feb/12 8:38 AM;ingo;The only thing I'm not comfortable with is asking a user to create a new launch configuration. That's a somewhat unfriendly process. I'd prefer if we continued to create the config automatically, but it prompts them to install before running.

column1: Index View does not show all types for JS
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
* Create a new empty Web Project
* Create a new empty JS file in that project
* Paste the following code into the JS file

{code}
var x = {};
x.y = {};
x.y.z = function () {}
{code}

* Do not save the file
* Open the Index View
* Click on your project in the Project Explorer
* Select the JS node and expand it
* Expand the Project Types node

You should see entries for "Window", "x", and "x.y"

* Now save the JS file
* Click on your project in the Project Explorer
* Select the JS node and expand it
* Expand the Project Types node

You should see entries for "Window" only. "x", and "x.y" disappeared
column164: 20/Mar/12 6:11 AM;klindsey;During JS inferencing, intermediate types are generated and written to the JS Index. As these types are written they are cached on the AST. In this case, the index was being cleared and the same AST was being used for inferencing. Since the intermediate types were cached on the AST, they were not being written to the index. We now clear this cache info for each inferencing session.

column1: Character Encoding options broken, falsely reporting UTF-8
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
A well known issue with deploying Titanium projects to android that has existed for a long, long time is problems with the Android emulator requiring files to be UTF-8.

So naturally if you ran across the issue when using TiStudio, you would right click the files, go to properties and check your 'Text file encoding' was set to UTF08. It automatically chooses the option titled 'Inherited from container (UTF-8)'.

So according to Aptana/TiStudio, the file is set to UTF-8. Yet the android emulator is still throwing a wobbly over a non UTF-8 file.

I then opened the exact file in Coda (by panic.com) to find that every single one of the Titanium Studio files was in face set to "Western (Mac OS Roman)" and not UTF-8. I edited the files to UTF-8 via Coda and hey presto, the android project works. The same action in Aptana/TiStudio does not work, it leaves the files in their old encoding.

The bug here is quite simply that the Aptana text file encoding options for files dont change the file encoding at all. This has been present since at very least when Appcelerator bought out Titanium Studio.

More info on this bug can be found here: http://developer.appcelerator.com/question/88591/unicodedecodeerror-utf8-codec-cant-decode-byte-0x80-in-position#comment-114842
column60: Mac OS X (any version) w/ Titanium Studio - Tested on Mac OS X Lion and Snow Leopard and issue is present.
column164: 20/Feb/12 10:13 PM;ingo;Thank you for the report. Are the files shown as not UTF-8 ones that have been created with Titanium Studio, or were they imported from another location or program?
column165: 20/Feb/12 10:21 PM;rickm;I believe the project that it happened to me on was an imported one. I'm away from my dev machine at the moment however can do some additional tests with a new project if you wish.
column166:
20/Feb/12 10:32 PM;ingo;I don't believe this is a bug, but rather a difference in nomenclature. That said, I think there is still a missing feature that needs to be addressed.

In Coda and other apps, there are two options...interpret a file using a particular encoding, and convert a file to a particular encoding. Coda even asks you about which you wish to do when setting the encoding (see image).

The UTF-8 setting in Eclipse serves two purposes:
# The default encoding when creating new files
# The encoding to use when interpreting an existing file

But it is not "reporting" the file as UTF-8...it's indicating that it will interpret the file as UTF-8. It may be an annoying nuance, but that's the way in which the core Eclipse platform was designed and communicated in the UI. That still leaves option #3 missing--re-saving the existing file using a new encoding. It sounds like what we need is something similar (or even better than) Coda...allow some sort of recursive command to reset the actual encodings on the files in a project if they do not match the UTF-8 setting, and perhaps put a warning in the problems view if a file comes in with this issue.

It might also be possible to reset this during import of files or projects, but that would be best done using a checkbox so users could confirm they want that change.
column167: 20/Feb/12 10:38 PM;ingo;Here's a plugin which may serve as an inspiration for what we could do: http://marketplace.eclipse.org/content/file-encoding-info
column168: 21/Feb/12 2:41 AM;ingo;Add a build participant to sniff the file encoding, add a problem view error (if it's an Android project) and provide a quick-fix if it's not UTF-8.
column169: 05/Mar/12 1:43 AM;cwilliams;Added an additional unit test for the quick fix code. Went over code reviews. Closed review, merged to 'development' and pushed.
column170:
21/Mar/12 6:29 AM;klindsey;I verified this ticket using the following steps

* Create a new Titanium Mobile project with Android as a target
* Create a new JS file in the Resources directory in the new project
* Type some JS content
* Open a Terminal and navigate to the Resources directory
* Convert the file to UTF-16: iconv -f utf-8 -t utf-16 file.js > new-file.js
* Refresh the project
* Open the Problems View. There should be an entry indicating that the file is not in UTF-8 encoding.
* Right-click the entry and select Quick Fix
* Convert the file to UTF-8
* The error in the Problems View should go away

column1: Generated mobileweb index.html shows numerous CSS syntax errors about unexpected "*"
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column164:
13/Mar/12 7:22 AM;klindsey;Apparently, this is an IE hack. Older versions of IE (<= IE7) will apply the property where as newer ones will ignore it. It is technically a syntax error, but it's possible this is a common hack. We could either extend the grammar to allow a leading asterisk before a property name or extend the lexer to allow leading asterisks for identifiers. Either way, I think we should silently ignore this parse error and later make sure this is tagged as a warning by another validator.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4563651/what-does-an-asterisk-do-in-a-css-property-name
column165: 14/Mar/12 11:50 AM;klindsey;I added a couple of rules to the CSS parser that allow an asterisk to precede a property name. The asterisk is prepended to the property name when the associated parse node is generated. That preserves the shape of the AST so the outline and formatting will not break, while allowing the asterisk to be displayed in the outline and to be preserved during formatting.

In order to make it easier to determine which validators and generating the content in the Problems View, we need to make a pass over the validator names and marker names to make sure they are consistent with one another. Here is a list of validators names, with their current default settings for building and reconciling:
{code}

JSLint JavaScript Validator	build-off	reconcile-off
Mozilla JavaScript Validator	build-off	reconcile-on
JavaScript Parser Validator	build-on	reconcile-on

Tidy HTML Validator		build-off	reconcile-on
HTML Parser Validator		build-on	reconcile-on

W3C Stylesheet Validator	build-off	reconcile-on
CSS Parser Validator		build-on	reconcile-on
{code}

And here are the associated marker names:

{code}
JS Problem, %marker.jslint.name, %marker.mozilla.name
CSS Problem, CSS W3C Problem
HTML Problem, HTML Tidy Problem
{code}

I may be looking in the wrong place, but I didn't see values in the plugin.properties file for the JSLint and Mozilla markers.

* "Parse Validator" should become "Syntax Validator"
* We need to reverse "Tidy HTML ..." to "HTML Tidy ..." for consistency
* Markers should use the validator name replacing "Validator" with "Problem"

column1: Studio hangs with new empty workspace
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
During testing of the release branch (currently 2.0/3.1), I was able to hang Studio. I was running from a dev environment where the workspace was being cleared on each run. As soon as Studio was up, I did the following:

# Closed App Explorer
# Closed Dashboard
# Created a new web project
# Added a new JS file to the web project

At this point, studio was hanging. I noticed "Building Workspace" in the status bar was at 0% and remained there. Performing a stack dump, I see that three threads are in deadlock (see attached)
column164:
15/Mar/12 11:58 PM;cwilliams;Some more investigation:
1. We should be avoiding Class.forName if we can. We likely want to use the OSGi bundle classloader mechanisms to grab classes if we need to. That means grabbing the owning bundle and then calling Bundle.loadClass(className). I don't think this is the cause of this particular issue, but I do know that we have a few places where we should change this (CSS W3C validation, filewatcher JNI loading, a hack in BuildUtil)
2. The code that seems like it may be the issue here is the metadata loading/reader. It looks like we use reflection to do method callbacks and such and in that code path it ends up using buddy classloading even though it is not explicitly set up in the editor.common manifest.
3. There are properties we can set to try and avoid the deadlock issue when multiple threads are hitting the classloader: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=212262 This would have a performance impact, since it effectively forces

So to sum up: 
- There's a known issue with deadlocking classloaders and some eclipse properties to try and avoid it.
- We should avoid using reflection when possible to avoid hitting the classloaders.
- When we do need to use reflection, try and explicitly make use of the OSGi infrastructure (Bundle.loadClass vs Class.forName)
- To fix this immediate issue, we may want to look into rewriting the metadata stuff to not use reflection and instead use generic callback methods on an interface that will likely just delegate to the individual enter/exit methods based on a large if/else/switch check.
column165: 16/Mar/12 11:56 PM;cwilliams;Addressed Kevin's review feedback, ran JS/CSS/Parsing/HTML unit tests to verify they still pass, closed code review, merged to 'release', cherry picked to 'development'.

column1: Reduce number of refreshes in Git Index and reduce work done during refresh
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Previously I thought we could entirely remove refreshes when files change inside a git connected project. Turns out that we couldn't but there are other things we can do:
- When we get resource change events, only update the changed files, don't do a full batch refresh.
- Don't call batch refreshes from some actions like deleting files/folder or moving files through our UI. The connected filewatcher on the repo should pick up a file event or two to the "index" file which will trigger a batch refresh.
- When we do refresh we call one process and then we spawn off 3 parallel jobs to each run another process to update our listings. We may be able to reduce the number of processes down to as low as one in most cases (or two in worst case).
column164:
07/Feb/12 10:43 PM;cwilliams;I was incorrect. We do not get a file event from our filewatcher, because it is watching on the .git directory tree of the repo, and just editing a file inside the repo does not trigger any changes to any .git file. Staging/unstaging/committing will cause refreshes by the filewatcher, but edits to files in the project still require this resource change listener to trigger a refresh to update our model.

There's other things we can try to improve performance and cut down unnecessary refreshes: 
- When we stage/unstage/commit through our UI, we trigger the refreshes inline int he action, but the filewatcher is also picking up changes to .git files and causing a refresh.
- When we get resource change events and turn them into refresh calls, that does a batch refresh fo the whole index. It may be simpler/more performant to simply update the status of the file we got the event for.
- Refresh currently calls 4 separate processes to fully update the model. It may be possible to merge some of them down to lower overhead.
- We could consider implementing a producer/consumer thread to perform the refreshes i.e. RefreshThread, instead of using a Job that we schedule on a 250ms delay to try and "batch" the requests. This thread can just be a long-living thread that blocks on a queue/flag and wipes the queue.
column165: 14/Feb/12 4:43 AM;cwilliams;Pushed fix and performance test to 'development'.
column166: 19/Mar/12 9:50 PM;cwilliams;technical task, closing.

column1: Consider using a special token to indicate that a given JS type or member should have all user agents associated with it
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: Given the number of user agents we attach with inferred types and members, we should use a custom tag to indicate that the item should have all user agents associated with it. Looking at a large method entry in the index, we could cut down one entry from 3359 to 2595, for example. This may not sound significant, but in the closure-library this could potentially shave off as much as 42MB from a 71MB index given the high number of property and function counts there. This, of course, would need to be verified and should be considered an upper maximum in file size reduction

column166:
26/Feb/12 10:29 PM;cwilliams;Changed the "Select Tag Content" command to not apply inside "source" blocks in html (so basically in PHP, ERB, embedded JS or CSS).

Also modified the implementation since it was broken against recent changes to parsing, and had it handle when invoked inside the text content of a tag.

Pushed to 'development' branch, since the changes are made to work against the parsing changes on 'development'.

Users can simply change the scope of the 'Select Tag Content' command in the HTML ruble to 'text.html - source' if they want to patch this locally. I may push that smaller fix over to the 'release' and 'master' branches of the ruble.

column1: Enable performance-based tests on Jenkins
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column164:
02/Feb/12 5:43 AM;cwilliams;- We need to set up a "derby" or "cloudscape" database instance reachable from all the build agents that would run the job.
- We need to enable the job on Hudson.
- We need to run the job to establish a "baseline" version. (we might need to run this a few times per major milestone we'd want to baseline/compare against, so it may be useful to have this as a separate job)
- We need to then configure the job to run nightly and compare/assert against the baseline.

Some of the details can be found at: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/viewvc.cgi/org.eclipse.test.performance/doc/Performance%20Tests%20HowTo.html?view=co and  http://wiki.eclipse.org/WTP_Performance_Tests/How_To
column165: 19/Mar/12 8:20 AM;cwilliams;Performance tests are running.

column1: Use StringPools to avoid duplicated strings - notable Bundle infrastructure and PHP builtins
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
We duplicate "path", "scope" and "customProperties" key values in bundle model elements. Using a StringPool to reuse equal strings would help bring down our memory usage quite a bit there. Long-term we may want to handle freeing the strings from the pool in a smarter way when the referring elements themselves are removed (say a bundle gets removed) - but the effort required given that unusual/unlikely use case may not warrant it.

Secondly, we should use  StringPool for a lot of the duplicated string values in PHP builtins. We're already hanging onto the entire thing in memory, so having them live in a StringPool that lives as long as the plugin won't actually make it any worse. We'd have to remove the pool if we ever refactored to persist the index to disk like we do in core.

column1: Add Dynamic Help for JS
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
* Update Examples for better formatting

Display JS metadata in Help View (see Aptana Studio 2.x for example)

{panel:title=Properties}
@name
//description

Parameters
_parameter/@name (parameter/@type_): parameter/description

Returns
return-value

Remarks
remarks

Example 1:
...

Example 2:
...

Supported Platforms
browser/@platform: browser/@version, ...

Specification
specification/@name: specification/@version

See also
* JavaScript Core Reference
* HTML DOM 0 Reference
* HTML DOM 2 Reference
* Titanium Mobile Reference (if applicable)
{panel}

Hover and Dynamic help for functions is identical to properties, except it shows the method signature. See http://www.eclipse.org/articles/article.php?file=Article-DynamicCSH/index.html for information on how to contribute dynamic help. See ScriptDocHelper and JSFileLanguageService for the majority of the implementation, including both the top content, and the list of resources at the bottom. Suggest we try running any JS code blocks through the formatter.

* Open the Dynamic Help View
* Click on "document" and click on "getElementById"

Following those steps, I saw documentation for each items using the format as described in this ticket.

column1: Using XULRunner in Aptana
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Hi friends,
i just upgraded my computers to the new ubuntu release and now i have some troubles with the XULRunner based parts of Aptana. In all new releases of all major Linux distributions the XULRunner packages are disabled because of some seriously security issues. I asked in the #ubuntu irc why the package is removed from the current version and they told me that. They forwarded me to the Mozilla Website where they wrote that sience Firefox 4 the XULRunner is disables be default because of this security issues. (1.9.2 is only for Firefox 3.*)

I know it's very much to ask, but i think it's a good idea if Aptana could run without the XULrunner. It's for advanced users not a big problem to reinstall the libs directly from the page, but if it's a mayor security rist, i think twice about that. And if i don't du that, the complete GIT integration is nut useable and i only got some error messages like that here:

{quote}
Unhandled event loop exception
No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path (MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)]
{quote}

Here are the IRC logs
{quote}
(17:57:53) Leo Unglaub: hi, can someone please explain to me why the xulrunner ins available in natty, but in the new version not?
(17:58:01) Leo Unglaub: http://packages.ubuntu.com/de/natty/xulrunner-1.9.2
(17:58:28) cajunspice: xul is a major security risk
(17:58:48) Leo Unglaub: cajunspice: have you sources where i can read more about this?
(17:59:50) cajunspice: I saw it on the mozilla site, leo-unglaub, xul was such a risk that in firefox 4.0 and above remoe xul is disabled
(18:00:12) Leo Unglaub: cajunspice: ah, okay
(18:01:13) cajunspice: leo-unglaub: it appears it will be staying disabled, because remote xul is too much of a backdoor
(18:01:36) Leo Unglaub: cajunspice: okay, thanks !
{quote}

Greetings
Leo
column60:
Aptana Studio 3, build: 3.0.6.201110121628

leo@striker:~$ uname -a
Linux striker 3.0.0-12-generic #20-Ubuntu SMP Fri Oct 7 14:56:25 UTC 2011 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
column164:
19/Oct/11 3:30 AM;mxia;Hi Leo,

Aptana Studio doesn't actually add any dependency to XULRunner, but Eclipse uses it for its internal browser on Linux, so I don't think this is something we could fix.  To verify, you could check if a vanilla version of Eclipse is able to run on your latest Ubuntu without setting MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME.
column165:
19/Oct/11 5:05 AM;leo.unglaub;Hi,
i don't mean the internal browser. The GIT functions in Aptana are affected. If i select a changes file and click Commit, i get the error message from above. Thats the reason why i thought that is was/is XULRunner related.

So, are you sure that there is no dependency in the git components?
Gretings
Leo
column166:
19/Oct/11 9:56 PM;jedie;Have the same Problems.

I have installed firefox and set MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME='/usr/lib/firefox-7.0.1' and get this if i want to do a git commit:

{code}
Unhandled event loop exception
No more handles [MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME='/usr/lib/firefox-7.0.1'] (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Could not load SWT library. Reasons: 
	/home/jens/bin/Aptana Studio 3/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/216/1/.cp/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3659.so: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libnss3.so: version `NSS_3.12.10' not found (required by /usr/lib/firefox-7.0.1/libxul.so)
	no swt-mozilla-gtk in java.library.path
	/tmp/swtlib-64/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3659.so: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libnss3.so: version `NSS_3.12.10' not found (required by /usr/lib/firefox-7.0.1/libxul.so)
	Can't load library: /tmp/swtlib-64/libswt-mozilla-gtk.so
)
{code}

A similar error and how to fix is here: http://wiki.buglabs.net/index.php/Help:Troubleshoot_Eclipse_SDK_Problems But using the 64bit version of aptana doesn't fix it for me...
column167: 08/Jan/12 9:13 PM;hlascelles;Not sure why this is resolved, it is valid. The suggested solution (making sure you are using 64 bit java and Aptana) doesn't help. Ubuntu 11.10.
column168:
08/Jan/12 11:20 PM;hlascelles;Solved for Ubuntu 11.10 64bit.

1. sudo apt-get install xulrunner-1.9.2 - or, if using Ubuntu 11.10 which doesn't have it in the repositories, install direct from https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/oneiric/amd64/xulrunner-1.9.2/1.9.2.17+build3+nobinonly-0ubuntu1
2. gedit aptana.sh   (probably check current minor version)
3. export MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/usr/lib/xulrunner-1.9.2.17 
   export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME}:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
4. Profit

So... Not sure where the responsibility lies with this one. Standard eclipse installs with egit work fine. Is there something in the Aptana build which is trying to make the install smaller, but cutting out an important component? Or the security concerns mentioned above?

Thanks for reopening, hope my suggested fix reduces the level from "High"!

H

column1: add logTrace() option to IdeLog
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
A number of items are written out to the log under the INFO level. However, if you have the slider set to ALL, that can provide an _astronomical_ amount of data, particularly from the scripting plugin, assuming you have not selected particular components to debug.

* Add logTrace() to IdeLog
* Add isTraceEnabled()
* Move isInfoEnabled() calls to use isTraceEnabled() and logTrace(), where appropriate
* Only show "trace" items if level is set to [ALL] _and_ you have chosen to debug the specific component in question. This is in contrast to the current behavior for INFO where it will show all components if no specific one is selected.
column164: 14/Feb/12 12:03 AM;ingo;I might suggest we use something instead of a slider to denote the levels. People have found that confusing (The slider works much better on windows than on Mac...it could just be a drop down, instead)
column165: 15/Feb/12 3:15 AM;mxia;Added logTrace() and isTraceEnabled().  Moved various isInfoEnabled()/logInfo() calls to use isTraceEnabled()/logTrace(), so the amount of log messages shown should be drastically lower for when the debug level is info instead of trace.  Added a screenshot on the UI change for the preferences (using a combo-box instead of slider.
column166: 14/Mar/12 8:48 AM;ingo;Verified in 2.0.0.201203132050 existence of drop down. Confirmed that the only way to see a trace-level item (i.e. common presentation reconciler messages) was to both set level to all _and_ enable specific debugging fro the relevant components.

After restarting my session, I turned off HTML Tidy before pasting in the above HTML source code and I no longer saw CPU spike
column165:
06/Feb/12 11:08 PM;cwilliams;FYI, looks like we can generalize the errors and warnings Tidy generates here: http://jtidy.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/jtidy/trunk/jtidy/src/main/java/org/w3c/tidy/Report.java?revision=1261&view=markup lines 1215-1508

Tag Balance
- Unexpected end tag
- missing end tag
- unexpected tag
- coerce to endtag
- non-matching end tag
- inserting tag
- missing start tag

Doctype
- missing doctype
- malformed doctype
- doctype after tags
- doctype not uppercase

Nesting
- nested quotation
- can't be nested
- nested emphasis
- illegal nesting

Bad Tags/Tag Content
- Unknown element (tag)
- tag not allowed in
- too many elements (in)
- using BR in place of
- proprietary element
- obsolete element
- unescaped element
- trim empty element
- content after body
- bad comment chars
- bad xml comment
- bad cdata content
- inconsistent namespace
- element not empty

Misc.
- missing title element
- noframes content
- inconsistent version
- unexpected EOF
- duplicate frameset
- suspected missing quote
column166: 07/Feb/12 2:18 AM;cwilliams;One major thing to note here is that we've hacked some metadata related to elements in code. We have a static set of tags that are set up as empty/self-closing etc, and I think they're somehow related to the doctype. This is inside HTMLParseState and a couple related classes. Ideally that info would be baked into the XML metadata itself.
column167: 07/Feb/12 3:06 AM;ingo;Do you have a ticket for moving that data into the XML metadata? We've talked about doing that for some time now.
column168: 07/Feb/12 5:06 AM;ingo;Yeah, let's create a new ticket with the proposed solution and we can vote on that as part of the next poker session.
column169: 07/Feb/12 5:06 AM;ingo;And please relate all the tickets together so it's easy to find.
column170: 07/Feb/12 5:51 AM;cwilliams;Looked at tidy source, compiled list of warnings/errors it detects, opened two related tickets for replacing it.
column171: 14/Mar/12 6:25 AM;cheadley;Closed ticket as this has become a task rather then a bug.

column1: Upgrade Unit Test Coverage
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Our current unit test coverage hovers around 30% (class, method, block, and line) We need to get this higher.

Here are the classes we need to test: Please create a sub-task for the class you want to test, and edit the document to indicate you've claimed that test. If there already is a task created for a particular class, it means someone else has claimed that one, so choose another. If there are a bunch of related classes, you can group that into one task.

Coverage goals for all classes below is a _minimum_ of 100% class, 70% method, 80% block, 80% line (default Emma values in Jenkins)

* com.aptana.core.util 
** KeepAliveObjectPool
** ObjectPool
** ReapingObjectPool
** StreamUtil
** URIUtil

column1: Analyze duplicate Strings and Fill Ratios of Studio using Memory analyzer
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
I have a feeling there's plenty of low hanging fruit in terms of our memory usage. I read this article and it seems to be pretty easy to get a quick grasp of where we're wasting RAM:

http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-codetoheap/index.html
column164:
07/Mar/12 10:50 PM;cwilliams;The related tickets cover some of the issues here. The two major weak points found were:
- a large number of ArrayLists with low fill ratios (20% or less)
- Lots of duplicated Strings, the largest of which belonged to BundleElements (path, scope, and customProperties keys, specifically "prefix_values"); and PHP's builtins.


APSTUD-4452 and APSTUD-4453 cover fixing much of the first issue.
APSTUD-4469 covers the second.
column165: 07/Mar/12 10:51 PM;cwilliams;Generated some tickets for findings.

column1: A JS parser node may incorrectly include a comment offset when reporting its end-offset
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column165: 28/Feb/12 7:16 AM;klindsey;This was an issue during error recovery. We were using the offset of the token where the error occurred as the offset for the "virtual" token being added to the token stream. So, when we had an error and EOF, the token would include the EOF offset which in turn would cause it's owning AST node to include that offset. We now use the last good token's ending offset to generate the virtual token
column166: 08/Mar/12 8:14 AM;mxia;Verified on 2.0.0.201203071826 that the correct offsets are returned for the case.

column1: Content assist for nested JS in HTML auto-inserts and suggest incorrect proposals
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
While validating another ticket, I tried typing in the following HTML:

{code}
<input onkeydown="if (event.keyCode == 13) document.getElementById('MG2-submit').click();"/>
{code}

I ran into a number of issues.

# When I typed "event." it became "eventhis."
# On another occasion, when I typed "event.", it became "event$$."
# After I managed to get around that, proposals off of "event." showed global properties. Ideally, this would show some of the Event properties.
# As I continued to type "event.ke", I started seeing global proposals starting with 'e'. Continuing more would give a strange alternation of globals starting with the last letter to showing all globals again.
# Once I got to "document.", I got a list of globals again instead of document properties.
# Continuing to type "document.getElementById" showed the same behavior when I was typing "event.keyCode": alternation of all globals and globals starting with last typed letter.
# When I typed "document.getElementById('|')" and my cursor was at '|', I starting seeing HTML attribute proposals. Note that '\'' and ')' were auto-inserted, so I did not type those.
# As I typed the contents of the string in getElementById, I saw the global-and-globals-with-last-letter behavior described above.
# Likewise when typing ".click"

I suspect this is due to the JS being in an unparsable state with JSContentAssistProcessor dropping back to lexeme-based location type calculation.
column164: 23/Jan/12 6:31 AM;klindsey;We now treat the content of special HTML attributes that contain CSS/JS as simple attribute values. This prevents use from erroneously treating JS/CSS tokens as HTML tokens when determine the location type for content assist. Also fixed a case with JS if-statements occurring at EOF.

column1: Add HTML index content to the Index View
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
HTML content is indexed in web projects. The information store there should be included in the Index View under a separate top-level HTML node.

* Show classes and ids under the top-level node
* Content provider and label provider for HTML
* Use content assist model as nodes for view
* Query index for content
* Some icons
column164: 31/Jan/12 11:42 PM;klindsey;This adds a top-level HTML node with stats about the index, index file, index file size, and the HTML index version. Child nodes show JS and CSS resources. column1: Implement LRUCache with virtual memory paging scheme in editor infrastructure
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Initially the main issue found is that the caching does not really work well with our multi-parsing strategy.

When a parse for a large document is done, say, an html with 30 css and 10 js partitions, each of those will end up requesting a new parse and as our parse cache is an LRU of size = 3, the cache is never used in this situation.

On the good side, once we get caches in place properly, when parsing a large document, we may have lots of sub-partitions already cached, which should make the parsing faster when reparsing the full html.

Ideas on approaches:

1. A simple approach is simply making the cache larger (say 256), but maybe we should have 2 different caches, one for 'outer' calls and another for 'internal' calls inside the parsing structure, but memory may be a problem here.

2. Or maybe a single cache where we have an LRU with a 'desired' max size but items are only prunned if not accessed for some time (say 10 seconds).

3. Having a SoftHashMap may be a reasonable replacement too.

4. Making proper use of the LRUCache implementation we have which implements a virtual memory paging scheme (each value may have an associated size and the LRU has a size related to that - the parsed document length may be a good tradeof in speed/size of the final generated AST).

Selected approach:

LRUCache with virtual memory paging scheme + SoftHashMap for pruned entries (which may be restored if still alive).
column164: 04/Sep/12 2:41 AM;fzadrozny;Done changes. A reasonable test for this would be having several large to big files(varying from 300k to 700k) and working with them and check to see if memory is regained properly with the heap monitor.
column165: 10/Sep/12 9:11 AM;mxia;Verified on Titanium Studio build 3.0.0.201209081200.

column1: Refresh using Native Hooks or Polling Can't be Turned off (reappears after restart)
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
I've just upgraded to the latest aptana release (3.1.1.201204131931) and immediately hitting cpu usage issues with the CPU jumping to 90%ish every few seconds corresponding to a refresh of the workspace every few seconds. So I guess on my system Aptana the option 'Refresh using Native hooks or polling' is polling rather than hooks as it happens regardless of whether or not I'm doing anything.

I've traced it down to the 'Refresh using Native Hooks or Polling' which is under the Workspace menu. If I turn it off, the system quietens down and all is fine. 

However, on a restart, this 'option' has reselected itself meaning (I guess) that the option is not reading it's setting correctly from the options saved (or perhaps isn't getting saved to the file?)

So the bug I'm reporting here is the preference can't be set beyond a restart and, of course, like all preferences it should be.

A second bug I guess is quite why the refresh of the workspace uses so much CPU - my system has 8000 files on a fairly old machine so I'm guessing it's hitting limits on my machine (results will of course vary on other machines). I've commented on that before (in the forums) and it was all fine in version 3 until now. I'll repeat my guess that there is a very inefficient method involved in the refresh of the workspace that still hasn't been resolved. 

Anyway - hopefully to replicate ...

Type Workspace in to the preferences and select Workspaces at the bottom to get the "Refresh ... " option. Unselect it. Restart the studio, go back to that preference and you'll (hopefully) see it selected again.

I've attached two images - the first when I deselected the option. The second when I restarted showing the option has been selected again.

column166:
14/May/12 11:23 PM;neill;Thank you for looking in to this. There still seems to be an issue though.

I've upgraded to Aptana Studio 3, build: 3.1.2.201205041324 and have tested the following on Mageia 1.x and Ubuntu 12.04.

If I turn off the Refresh checkbox, save and view it again it remains off. If I close down Aptana and restart it, the checkbox remains off. If I close Aptana, log out, log back in again, and restart Aptana and view it, it remains off. The same is true if I don't close Aptana before logging out.

However, if I reboot my machine, log in and then restart Aptana, it is now back on again. In other words, the setting doesn't seem to survive a reboot.

I would guess this hints that the value is somehow being kept in memory and linux is reassigning that portion of memory to Aptana during the restarts of Aptana and even over a log out and log in again. Don't know if that is possible, but I can't imagine why it's misbehaving only on a reboot otherwise.

Steps to reproduce:
a) log in to either Mageia 1.x, or Ubuntu 12.04 or possibly other variants of linux or other OSes(haven't tested on those)
b) start up Aptana and turn OFF the Refresh button
c) REBOOT your machine
d) log in again and start up Aptana, and view the value. All things going well it's back on again.

Who'd have thought one checkbox could be so mysterious!!

Thanks again for the help

Neill Jones

column1: Switch CSS scanner over to JFlex
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: Currently, we're using the Eclipse IRule system for our CSS parser's lexer. We were doing this for JS and then switched to JFlex to improve performance. I don't recall the exact improvement factor for scanning, but I believe our JS parse became roughly 6x faster with that change. We should consider moving to JFlex for CSS for the same reasons.
column164: 25/Apr/12 7:17 AM;klindsey;Implemented JFlex scanner and we are now using that in the CSSParser and CSS unit tests. I'm not sure what to suggest when verifying this item. There is no change in functionality other than an speed increase for CSS-related parsing. We have a number of unit tests around this area and all of those items are passing.
column166:
26/Apr/12 2:26 AM;klindsey;I've pushed a fix for numbers. The spec doesn't include the leading, but optional, '-' and '+' characters. I've added support for those.

The old scanner would return comments and then the Beaver adapter would collect and filter them. The new scanner already collects them. I don't see a need to return them since they are being collected, so they are now filtered. I removed the one unit test that relied on the old behavior.

A number of new unit tests have been written around ids/colors, classes/numbers, and numbers in general.

We have other tickets for the '=' and the keyframe rotate syntax.

column1: Make required adjustments in the PHP code formatter to support PHP 5.4
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: PHP 5.4 probably adds new nodes into the PHP AST, so the PHP formatter will have to support the new additions by implementing specific formatting for those.
column164:
11/Jul/12 6:32 AM;sgibly;The formatter code will have to visit those new AST nodes:
* ChainingInstanceCall
* DereferenceNode
* FullyQualifiedTraitMethodReference
* TraitAlias
* TraitAliasStatement
* TraitDeclaration
* TraitPrecedence
* TraitPrecedenceStatement
* TraitUseStatement

All mapping to the new syntax additions that were added to 5.4.
column165: 28/May/13 1:12 AM;sgibly;Done

column1: Use CollectionsUtil#newList/Map/Set where possible and/or set initialCapacity
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
To improve memory usage in our collections, we should see if we can switch over to using CollectionsUtil#new* methods directly since those methods will optimize the collection size to match its content. If the we're unable to switch over to those utility methods, we should try to set the initial capacity, when possible. We should search for default constructors on at least the following:

* ArrayList
* HashMap
* HashSet
column164: 02/May/13 7:16 AM;cwilliams;I think we've done a pretty good job of doing this over time and we have very few manually conctructed instances when we know the collections sizes 9or the elements are static).

column1: PHP $var not being highlighted inside double quotes

The PHP syntax highlighting used to work before the last update (I belive I was previously using 3.0.4) inside of double quotes:

<?php $string = "hello $name" ;?>

The $name used to get fully highlighted, now it only highlights the $.  This can make it a lot more difficult to review the code, and see when a variable is being used vs normal string chars.

EDIT:
I am using version 3.3.1.201212171919
column164:
20/Dec/12 12:51 PM;mxia;@Daniel could you attach a screenshot of what you see? I pasted the code snippet into the latest Studio 3.3.1, and the name variable appears to be highlighted correctly.

Thanks.
column165:
20/Dec/12 1:43 PM;newms87;As you can see in my screenshot.  The $name is not being hightlighted. The $ is highlighted in blue which is correct, but before the last update I did, the entire variable was highlighted.  

Also, syntax such as <?= "$var[name] ;?> and <?= "$object->var";?> These both used to be highlighted as well but now are not.

Thanks!
column166:
07/Jan/13 7:21 AM;sgibly;This one ended up being just a missing Theme setting.
# Open the Themes preference page and click the '+' button to add a new value to the list.
# Type in the name of the setting. For example, "PHP variable in string".
# On the same row, click the foreground square and the background square to set the variable colors.
# On the 'scope' box underneath the list, paste this string:
{code}meta.string-contents.quoted.double.php variable.other.php{code}
# Click apply, and you should see your variable coloring.

[Note]
We pushed a fix into our nightly release to set this up in the default Aptana dark theme (and also in the "Sababa" theme). In case you want to grab the defaults, update to the nightly and click the 'Restore Default' button in the Themes page.

Cheers
column167:
07/Jan/13 8:30 AM;newms87;Hey thanks for the updates!  I should mention that if you do not have a background color set this problem still exists. You have to have a background color set or else it only colors the $ character.

Also, is there a way to remove the background to a theme entry? It seems that there is not, so I had to resort to remove the entry and recreating it to remove a background color.

thanks again!
column168:
14/Jan/13 12:12 AM;cheadley;Tested in Titanium Studio, build: 3.1.0.201301111857. Verified what Daniel is seeing, it only highlights the $ when no background color is set. Reopening ticket.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the Themes preference page and click the '+' button to add a new value to the list.
2. Type in the name of the setting. For example, "PHP variable in string".
3. On the same row, click the foreground square to set the variable color. Do not set a color for the background.
4. On the 'scope' box underneath the list, paste this string:
{code}
meta.string-contents.quoted.double.php variable.other.php
{code}
5. Click apply

Expected results:
User should see string variable coloring.

Actual results:
Only the $ is colorized, the rest of the variable name stays colorized as the string.

column1: Option to remove trailing whitespace on file save

Eclipse PDT provides the option to have trailing whitespace automatically removed from files on save (i.e. from the end of a line where it has no impact).

Is it possible you could add this useful feature?

column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: We're currently using Eclipse IRules for colorization. From experience with the JS parsing infrastructure, we have found that we can get a good performance improvement by switching over to a JFlex-based scanner. We should consider moving all languages from IRules over to JFlex for this reason.

column1: Major lag in editing large files with word wrap enabled
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a css file with 1000 lines
# Enable word wrap
# Scroll to bottom of page
# Start typing

h3. Actual Result
Keyboard lag (or whatever is going on) is so significant that unexpected results happen.

h3. Expected Result
Normal opperation with no lag. Not sure what happened, but it seems since the last update, if I have a file that is more than a few hundred lines of code, I get significant lag happening. This doesn't happen until you start to scroll down the page.
column164: 13/Jun/12 4:59 AM;ingo;Hi David--which version were you using previously, and can you provide the file in question (just to make sure there's not some other issue at play)?
column165: 13/Jun/12 5:03 AM;atomicbop;One of the files I'm having an issue with.
column166:
13/Jun/12 5:07 AM;atomicbop;This seams to be more prevalent with css files (maybe because of the length). I have also noticed that performance is dependent of where my cursor is in the file. If I'm typing on line 100, everything is fine, but on 1000, there is so much lag it's unusable. If I go back to 100, it's fine again. Hopefully that can narrow things down.

Not sure if you have this info, but I'm on a mac running Lion 10.7.4 (16gb mem).
column167:
13/Jun/12 6:23 AM;cheadley;Unable to reproduce in Mac OS 10.7.4 or Windows 7 using either Titanium Studio build:  2.1.0.201206121914 or Aptana Studio build: 3.1.3.201205292243.

Steps used in reproduction test:
1. Open the supplied file layout.css.
2. Insert code at the beginning of the file to mesure speed.
3. Scroll to the bottom and insert the same code as from the top.
4. Compare differences.
5. Complete steps 2 through 4 using the key command method (cmd+down key or page down)

Expected result: Typing response times should not vary throughout the file.
column168: 13/Jun/12 6:26 AM;ingo;Hi David--I tried to replicate it as well to no avail, and I'm on OS X Lion (but 10.7.3, FWIW). Can you try this in a new project with just a single file? Perhaps in a new workspace too?

I seem to have quite a bit of things going on in there that a new workspace doesn't have. Attached is a screenshot of what is in the workspace/.metadata/.plugins folder.

1) Is there something in there that shouldn't be or that would be conflicting with something else?

2) How do I remove some of these things. Is it safe to just delete plugins that I know I'm not using, or is there a special way I need to go about it?

Thanks for all the help. I've only been using Aptana for a short while and am still learning. I switched because I had to work in an Eclipse environment for a Java project and liked what was going on.
column171: 13/Jun/12 11:40 PM;atomicbop;Well, I've narrowed it down to something in my preferences. No idea what it could be, though.
column172:
13/Jun/12 11:45 PM;atomicbop;Figured it out. It was a custom theme I have enabled. Not sure what's making things slow in it, but I switched to a core theme and everything's fine.

Thanks for the help. Issue solved!

Thanks!
column175: 14/Jun/12 2:28 AM;atomicbop;Sorry. I spoke too soon. It seemed to clear it up, but it's still happening. I have no idea what's going on with this.

14/Jun/12 2:41 AM;ingo;Hi David,

That ticket is for version 3.2, so it shouldn't affect you, and in particular it's also for PHP, not CSS. We did actually make CSS _faster_ in version 3.1.3, so the lag you see is very strange.

Can you try the following:

# Clear your log file
# Go to Project > Clean and clean the project

See if the problem comes back. if so, please re-attach your log file.
column178:
14/Jun/12 2:51 AM;ingo;Hi David,

One other request. We're noticing an indexing problem with JS files. Do you happen yo have any javaScript files containing UTF-8/Unicode characters that you are editing?
column179:
14/Jun/12 3:05 AM;atomicbop;Hi Ingo,

I cleared my log and the problem persists.

This is also happening on non-project files. If I'm just using Aptana as a code editor, I still have the same issue. It seems that around line 800+ I see the lag.

I did test in a project file and did the "clean project", but the problem is still there.

I'm currently testing on a 1000 line css file with no project. All projects are closed and there are no other files open in the workspace.

I do have js files with Unicode characters, but they are all in closed projects at the moment. Not sure if that would have any effect.

I tested on html, php, and js files and I get the same result. Not just css.

I also just noticed something. As I'm typing gibberish in to test, this is only occurring once some valid definition is recognized.

For example (CSS file):

Line 1000+ I type "slidfjlasijivj"
  - everything is fine

once i enter something recognizable as css, like "." or "a", the lag happens. I turned off all validators and this still takes place. 

I also tested this in an html file and got the same results. As soon as I put in "<", all keyboard entry on the same line is lagged.

This is happening on a per line basis.

If I enter this:

a { asldifjasldf }; - I get lag

As opposed to:
( these have line breaks. for some reason this textarea didn't pick it up)
a { /* line break */
  alsdifj;alsidjf - no lag /* line break */
}

This still only occurs in my default workspace. A new workspace acts normally.
column180: 14/Jun/12 4:21 AM;atomicbop;Also, was confused about the JS thing. If you need me to test something, let me know.
column181: 14/Jun/12 6:20 AM;atomicbop;Don't worry about this one. I moved everything into a new workspace and it seems fine for now. Let's just close this one out. Thank you for the help.
column182: 20/Jun/12 12:18 AM;ingo;David--I believe your issue _might_ we related to word wrap. Can you try turning word wrap on and off again? If so, please try updating to the latest "release" version on http://preview.appcelerator.com/studio/ to see if that fixes your issue. I believe it may be the same issue as APSTUD-4861.
column183:
20/Jun/12 12:35 AM;atomicbop;Hi Ingo,

I did indeed have word wrap turned on. Turning off fixed the lag. I turned back on again, and the lag was back. Updated Aptana to the latest release and it fixed the issue!

Thank you so much! You guys are the best!
column184:
20/Jun/12 3:43 AM;ingo;See APSTUD-4861 for actual checking that resolved this. Notes:

"The issue boiled down to a single line in CommonPresentationReconciler that I added as a performance improvement to limit the number of style ranges produced. Ultimately it ended up going through a codepath that would redraw very large sections of the TextViewer needlessly. TextViewer#addPresentation appears to ignore the coverage range when updating styles with a default style range. I'm guessing this is a bug in Eclipse itself, since that seems to impact performance severely if you incrementally set style ranges - it likely would only work Ok if you're setting style ranges once for the whole document. I opened a bug with Eclipse about the performance issue when using a default style range: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=382993"

Commit: https://github.com/aptana/studio3/commit/80e6245578f0462ed2735802d2f8ba33936dbd08
column185: 20/Jun/12 6:41 AM;cheadley;Verified fixed in Windows 7 and Mac OS 10.7.4 using Aptana Studio build: 3.2.0.201206200819. Closing ticket.

column166:
25/Jun/12 9:30 AM;kaio;Tested Aptana Studio 3 plugin with Eclipse 4.2.0 - bug still exists. 

FYI, as last comment mentioned, uncheck 'local filesystem' in project explorer > customize view > content did the job, though unsure if that was workaround only.
column167:
03/Jul/12 12:31 AM;fzadrozny;Just to note, it's also possible to reproduce this with PyDev if a project is created with a source folder, the source folder appears twice (the source folder must not be the project root for this to happen).

Upon taking a look at the code this appears to happen because the IPipelinedTreeContentProvider protocol is not used in com.aptana.ide.ui.io.navigator.ProjectExplorerContentProvider, so, it ends up creating an additional representation of those elements (which is what the IPipelinedTreeContentProvider protocol fixes).
column168: 03/Jul/12 7:57 AM;mxia;Pushed the fix to development and release branches. Will be available in the next nightly build.

column1: Code formatter conflicts with PEP8 E261
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When a line ending with a comma (for example, when each entry in a dict or a list is on its own line) is followed by an inline comment and the code formatter is enabled, the line is always changed to put a single (or none, depending on the configuration) whitespace between the comma and the comment. This contradicts the PEP8 rule E261 "at least two spaces before inline comment" and creates a warning if PEP8 is enabled.

When there's an inline comment, the code formatter should put two whitespaces after the comma.
column164:
02/Oct/12 11:54 AM;fzadrozny;Added option where the settings may be configured in pydev > editor > code style > code formatter.

git:

18b88b3 2012-10-02 fabioz APSTUD-5655: Code formatter can configure spaces before comment (default: 2 spaces as pep-8 says).

column1: Toggle comment shortcut messes up html formatting
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When placing the mouse cursor on the line you want to comment and pressing the shortcut to comment (ctrl + slash), the comment will remove any indents on that line.
The same thing happens when you use the shortcut to uncomment. This only happens if you place the cursor anywhere on that line without highlighting the specific text.

In the screenshot, the <body> tag loses its indent and unnecessary space is added inside the comment. The comment should begin where the <body> tag is inside the comment to be aligned and organized.


It's not a huge deal, but i thought it would be worth mentioning for a future fix.

Thanks.
column164: 16/Oct/12 9:07 AM;cheadley;Verified fixed in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.8.2, and Ubuntu 12.04 using Titanium Studio, build: 3.1.0.201210151946. Closing ticket.

column1: Ctrl+1 comment fixes do not follow PEP8
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When PEP8 is enabled, Ctrl+1 comment fixes do not follow the E261 PEP8 rule (at least two spaces before inline comment).

Steps to reproduce:
 - In any Python file, put the same import twice to create a warning (it can be done with most warnings).
 - On the line that has a warning, press Ctrl+1 and select "Reimport"
 - There's only one space before the generated comment and a PEP8 E261 warning appears.
column164:
04/Oct/12 9:53 AM;fzadrozny;Fixed.

Git:

93250a7 2012-10-04 fabioz APSTUD-5656: Ctrl+1 comment fixes do not follow PEP8 (options after '#').
609e226 2012-10-04 fabioz APSTUD-5656: Ctrl+1 comment fixes do not follow PEP8

column1: PHP Debugger
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
This is something that was shipped with 1.5 (skipped out on 2.0 so don't know if it's there). Don't know if this is planned for 3.0 (on the product page I've seen that JS debugging is coming soon),
yet it would be great if this were to be found into Aptana again (same goes for the ability to run a script through the PHP parser to get the output).

I've found the debugger to be one of the main Aptana features I use during my lectures (I'm a lecturer at a technical university), helping the students to understand what's going on on "the inside" of a PHP process.
column164:

Re-introducing the PHP debugger is planned, and we hope to accomplish that in the next few months.
Also, it's also planned to have a preview for PHP (which invokes the PHP interpreter to generate the output).

Cheers,
-Shalom G

column198:
19/Mar/12 8:41 AM;sgibly;Not for 3.1, but we are already in the process of code-reviewing the debugger code (and there is a lot of code there). You can follow the git repo I posted above.

What's probably going to happen is that we'll place a couple of jars in this ticket for you to test. Those jars will add support for PHP server debugging (remote), and for PHP Script debugging (CLI). For now, we will *not* bundle any PHP executable binaries (e.g. php, extensions, etc.). You will need to add your own through the preferences, and edit your php.ini to load a debugger extension for ZendDebugger or XDebug (we will support that).

I hope to get those jars up and ready _within a week_. They will work against the _nightly_ version *only* (the 3.2 stream).

Cheers.
column199:
20/Mar/12 3:53 PM;sgibly;OK. Here we go!
Along with this comment, I'll post here an Aptana PHP Debugger feature that you can install on the *nightly* version of the studio (either Titanium Studio, or Aptana Studio).
Nightly builds are available at preview.appcelerator.com

h3. Installation:
# Grab the zip file posted on this ticket (I'll update it from time to time and add a post every time I do that).
# Start the Studio and click _Help -> Install New Software..._
# Click the _Add_ button, and then select the zip by clicking the _Archive..._ button.
# OK the dialog will take you back to the installation screen, and at this point you should see the _Aptana PHP Debugger_ option (in case you can't see that, try to uncheck the _Group items by category_ option).
# Check the box and continue with the installation.
# Restart the studio (prompt to you at the end).

h3. How to get started?!
I'm also attaching a couple of PDF files that will provide you some understanding with the PHP debugging process.
There are two files. One instructs you on how to set up a script debugging, and the other instructs how to set up a server (remote/local) debugging.
Some of you may be familiar with the previous PHP debug support we had with Studio 1.5, or with the PDT debug support. Basically, it works the same.

h3. Supported Debuggers
Both _Zend Debugger_ and _XDebugger_ are supported. It's up to you to set up your debug environment (e.g. the php.ini), and the PDFs included here can provide some help.

h3. Found an issue?
This is a preliminary version. It's not fully tested, and I put it here that you will be able to play with it and give us your feedback.
If you find anything that you want us to take care of, open a separate ticket and assign it to me.

It took some time to get this going (as you all know :)), but I hope that with your help testing it, we can get it faster as an integrated release feature.

Stay tuned for updates...

column227:
26/Mar/12 9:38 PM;legec;The debugger globally works, and I haven't exeprienced any savage crash from the IDE.
Thanks for adding this feature, which I find very important in my day to day use.

A few (minor) points :
1- debugging with XDebug : like Mark Schut says, using XDebug, I couldn't find a way to choose the session name (e.g. : XDEBUG_SESSION_START=MyDebugTokenName), plus the session name changes each time I start one. With netbeans, I had gotten used to put the IDE in "listen for debug requests" mode, and trigger a debugging session from the browser by adding a "XDEBUG_SESSION_START=netbeans-xdebug" as a GET parameter - very convenient if you want to test the behavior from different browsers...

2- viewing variables : in the "Variables" view, the first thing you see when you unfold an array/object variable is a line stating "[0..8]" (the number of entries in the array/object), which itself needs to be unfolded to access the variable's content. I find this extra line pretty useless. Would it be possible to skip it ?

3- an esthetics bug : when I open the "Debug Configurations" dialog, and select my PHP debug session, each time I come back to the "Server" tab, an additional "/" is added to the URL field (in the "Server" tab, uncheck the "Auto Generate" checkbox, then try clicking "Advanced"/"Server" repeatedly to see what I mean).

*G*
column228:
27/Mar/12 6:11 AM;sgibly;@Marc - Have you tried using browser extensions such as XDebug Helper? https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/eadndfjplgieldjbigjakmdgkmoaaaoc (the session start has a few other items that are injected into the GET request).

@Georges - The studio also have a JIT (Just In Time) debug mode for XDebug. It should be enabled by default under the XDebug preferences (see the supported debuggers table at the 'Debug' preference node). That means that the Studio has an internal server that listens for any remote debug requests (default port is 9000 for XDebug). The browser will have to pass in the expected IDE key, which is 'Eclipse' in our case, so make sure it's set correctly. As I mentioned above, I think it's better to use a browser extension to trigger a session.
For the other two comments, I'll do my best to address them soon.

Thanks!

column230: 28/Mar/12 8:04 AM;sgibly;@Marc, are you sure you installed the latest debugger support I pushed?
column231: 28/Mar/12 3:31 PM;idschut;@Shalom - I thought I had, but I hadn't. This was the solution I found. I set the JIT setting to accept any host and it works!
column232:
28/Mar/12 3:53 PM;jvanbouchaute;Encountered an issue when inspecting a value in the debugger :

java.lang.nullpointerException.
column233:
28/Mar/12 6:42 PM;jvanbouchaute;Using debug watch expressions sometimes makes the Apache process (php) crash ...
removing all the watches usually solves the problem.
column234:
28/Mar/12 8:49 PM;legec;@Shalom : indeed, I can trigger debug sessions from the browser.

For the record : Shalom mentioned a "Debug preference mode", I found it under
"Window > Preferences", "Aptana Studio > Editors > PHP > Debug"
There, you have a setting "Break on first line when an unknown remote session (JIT) is requested"
which you can set to "Always/Never/Prompt"

I can live with this behaviour.

Here are however some remarks on the ease of use :

1- I didn't find a place where I could set the expected XDEBUG_SESSION name :
I checked the "Prompt" setting, and I get prompted by Aptana for any debug session as if it were a foreign session, be it "ECLIPSE", "XDEBUG_ECLIPSE", "ECLIPSE_DBGP" or "FOOBAR". Maybe I didn't look in the right place ?

2- I found the "Break on first line" option, not the "Don't break on first line, but start the session and break on my breakpoints". Does this setting exist ? (an equivalent of the "Break at First line" checkbox I can find in the "Debug Configurations" for the sessions started from the IDE)
column235:
29/Mar/12 5:54 AM;sgibly;@Jurgen - Are you on the latest version? Also, I'll need to see the full error for this one, and perhaps a script that triggers that. About the watches, it may be an issue with XDebug and the timing of the evaluation of those expressions. I will look into it later on, but not sure I can do anything to fix it on our side.

@Georges - Yes. The JIT settings are the place to enable the external debug triggers. I will look into the other two pointers you mentioned later on. Especially the option to skip the 'first line breakpoint' when a JIT session is triggered.
column236:
10/Apr/12 8:05 PM;milur;I could successfully launch the PHP Debugger, connect with Zend Debugger and it would break at the first line of the code.
However, the source that is shown in the debug perspective is outside of my workspace (even though I configured a correct path mapping and it actually is the same file). In other words:

1. The breakpoints I set in the workspace are ignored
2. I cannot set breakpoints in the debug perspective ("[...] Breakpoints are supported for PHP files that are located inside projects.")
column237:
11/Apr/12 7:44 AM;athanasius;I have a problem with the Web Page debuging. I have the nigthly Aptana build and your latest Debugversion installed.
The script debug works fine, and I am able to start a web page debug session from within eclipse or the browser with the mentioned browser plugin. But when it stops on the first break point I get this message

If I start another debug session after that, doesn't matter if script or web page, this error does not occure again, but the variable view is empty(I have already checked the points from above concerning empty variables). If you have any glue or I can provide further information I would be pleased.

column240:
13/Apr/12 12:49 PM;aptanabbq;There is some problem in Window platform, it cause unable to start debug.
I use PDT with xDebug few year and no problem at all, but move to aptana with same config , it not work.

Version :
Aptana studio 3 nightly
Windows 7 32bit pro
PHP 5.2.6
Apache 2.2.9
xDebug 2.1.2-5.2-vc6-nts.dll

Problem:
All problem come from the web servers setting 

-Preferences -> Aptana Studio -> Web Server -> simple web server or external web server (both of them have this issues)

On the Document Root , if i select my web root and press [OK]
Aptana automatic add a slash to the path, if i remove manully and press [OK], aptana will add it again forever.

See screen shot:
!http://i.imgur.com/lz1Xr.png!
!http://i.imgur.com/mrOeT.png!


This cause not able to start the url after i press Debug button,
Aptana will translate the url to
[LocalPath] + [HTTP Url]

see screenshot:
!http://i.imgur.com/IYvCW.png!

This's not happen on ubunut, only on windows.

I use Aptana studio since 1.5 , i believe Aptana will become king of PHP IDE if able to debug.

column247:
08/May/12 6:31 AM;rodrigoprimo;I have been using Xdebug with Aptana 3.2 and Ubuntu 11.10 for a few months now and it is working fine.

On a related note, I can't find a way to debug PHP sites using domains other than localhost. Is this possible? Due to a limitation that is beyond my control I develop a few sites that even on my local machine must run on their own domains.

With Netbeans is possible to achieve such a thing. So it is not a limitation on Xdebug as I used to think.

Thanks
column248:
08/May/12 2:37 PM;mattconnolly;I can't get breakpoints in files to work, but stopping at the first line of code works.

My apache path to project mapping is like this:

http://localhost/project/index.php  =>  /project/web/index.php

If I set up the mapping in the server settings, then the automatically generated URL is http://localhost/project/web/index.php which is incorrect.

Would this explain why breakpoints aren't working (they're being mapped to files that don't exist)??


Edit:: I created a new project in eclipse with the mapping like this:

http://localhost/project/index.php => /project/index.php

And I still see the same problem. Break on first line works, but not on breakpoints.


--- 
EDIT 2:

After *removing* the path mapping from my debug configuration, I could get breakpoints working correctly. Is this a bug?

Seems that the mapping could be quite useful but doesn't work right, and if you have it configured in a certain way it works by convention not by configuration (impossible to change / fix if it isn't working...)

column164:
30/Aug/12 6:25 AM;fzadrozny;Hi Elijah, I'm trying to reproduce this issue here and I still haven't had success on that (which would be the first step to fix it).

The use-cases I tested (which did not reproduce it here) were:

1. I created a dir with many files/dirs and executed "ls -la" lots of times.
2. Created a file with 2000 x 2000 (cols x lines) and did 'cat' file lots of times.

In both of these, the terminal got its content correct for me. So, if possible I'd like to know if you're able to reproduce this consistently (I'll try a bit more here and maybe inspect the code a bit too, but so far I haven't come up with what may be causing that -- nor even reproducing it).

column169:
06/Sep/12 11:38 PM;fzadrozny;Some discoveries here: 

To reproduce, the terminal must be initially small so that issuing the 2 ls commands, we'll consume the whole ui and start scrolling (so, the directory being ls'ed must have enough contents there for this to happen)

ls -l
ls -la
maximize: at this point, the exception below is triggered for me.

{code}
(Build 3.3.0.qualifier) [ERROR]  For input string: ""
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: ""
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:504)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:527)
	at com.aptana.terminal.connector.LocalTerminalConnector.processCommandResponse(LocalTerminalConnector.java:316)
	at com.aptana.terminal.connector.LocalTerminalConnector.filterOutput(LocalTerminalConnector.java:294)

column170:
07/Sep/12 12:09 AM;fzadrozny;More info:

During a resize (both maximize/minimize), the terminal is reporting contents in the output (i.e.: the job started at: org.eclipse.tm.internal.terminal.emulator.VT100TerminalControl.startReaderJob() which is always at a loop waiting for "fInputStream.available()==0", receives new lines/prompts during the resize, which definitely should not happen as nothing really changed in the terminal).

As a note, I've gotten the terminal from google (which is a branch of the original terminal in the same way that we are) from: http://code.google.com/p/elt/ to check it and it seems they don't have the same issue (i.e.: doing the same steps doesn't result in the behavior we have), so, either they've fixed it or it's something we introduced.
column172: 07/Sep/12 1:15 PM;kutakizukari;@Fabio Zadrozny I attached a PDF with the steps. Hope it helps.
column173: 08/Sep/12 12:18 AM;fzadrozny;Done change that should fix the issue.

column164: 28/Aug/12 6:17 AM;cwilliams;Pushed a fix/log change. If we get an offset or length less than 0, we now set it to 0 and log an error with the bad length/offset and the class name of the scanner that produced the bad token. The root cause is not fixed here. When an error is produced with this new logging it should point to the offending broken scanner.

column167: 05/Sep/12 3:52 AM;ingo;After chatting with Chris, we believe this was possibly caused by the related PHP scanner issue. Logging has been added so if this error message pops up again, it will provide additional information and we can reopen it.

column1: Issue showing documentation for two functions with similar names on different files
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When you have the same function declared in two different files (not included at the same time on the project, so it doesn't affects run time), auto-completion and mouse hover use different documentation sources. Hovering keeps using the same file as the above screenshots (plugin.php) while hover uses the other file (load-scripts.php), I'm guessing it uses alphabetical order.

!http://cl.ly/H93M/rare.png!

We need a way to exclude a file as documentation source to avoid this.
column164: 20/Jul/12 3:46 AM;ingo;We need to find all instances of that function, display those as separate proposals in the CA popup, and allow the user to choose which one they mean.
column165: 28/Aug/12 10:27 AM;sgibly;Attaching a video that shows the latest changes.
column166:
28/Aug/12 10:28 AM;sgibly;We now show multiple choices when there are functions with the same name that are coming from different files.
This only apply when doing a content assist (not hover).

We also show a selection when opening a declaration using the Ctrl+Hover.
(see attached video)
column167: 30/Aug/12 8:09 AM;cheadley;Verified fix in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.8.1 and Ubuntu 12.04 using Titanium Studio, build: 2.2.0.201208291633. Closing ticket.
column168:
30/Aug/12 8:25 AM;otrejni;Shalom you're awesome. I haven't tested this yet but I watched the video (hey, I knew developers loved videos!) and it looks great. I have a question though: if you don't know that a function is defined multiple times, you would only know that if you'd control-clicked it, right? Could you add a warning on the normal hover tooltip? Something like "This function has been declared X times. Control+click to see all the definitions"? It'd also be nice that Aptana remembered which definition you chose, so next time you hover it, it showed that one.

Grats again for the great, great job!
column169:
30/Aug/12 9:03 AM;sgibly;Thanks Sebastian :)
I'm afraid that it's a lot more trickier to deal with the hover. For now it will still show the "first find", and there is no simple way to handle this in the standard hover dialog (wish there was...).
I suggest that you open another ticket for that enhancement and we'll see what can be done.

column1: Implement improved terminal hyperlink detection
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
On terminal windows with a long history of output (a couple pages), scrolling up with the mouse wheel will jump back down once it reaches a certain point. However, if you manually drag the scroll bar up, you can see history beyond the jumping point. I've seen this reproducible on Allen's machine when you tail rails logs. You can see similar symptoms in the attached movie.

A short investigation showed that the issue relates to the implementation of hyperlink detection in Terminal. Disabling hyperlink detection eliminates the issue.

Suggested fix: Re-implement hyperlink detection code to make it free of scrolling/drawing issues.
column164:
07/Aug/12 7:17 AM;cheadley;Recreated the issue seen in the video in Titanium Studio 2.2.0.201208061353.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Download the attached testfile.php
2. Put the testfile.php into a project.
3. In the project's terminal run php testfile.php
4. Wait a few minutes to build up a scroll bar.
5. Try to scroll using a mouse wheel.

Expected result:
The terminal window should scroll up until the view is reset by a new line appearing.

Actual results:
The scroll stops scrolling up and begins scrolling down again about 30 lines up from the bottom. Manually scrolling via the side bar will go back.
