column1: Aptana tries to open a new instance of itself when opening files via Windows Explorer
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
{html}

Assigned to Tender issue #49. As reported in Tender:

OS: Win XP

When Aptana is running and I try to open files from my Windows Explorer (with double click or enter) Aptana displays "Workspace in use or cannot be created, choose a different one" after showing the splash screen for 2-3 seconds.

Dragging files into my running instance won't cause this behavior. Opening files from my Project view causes no problems, except .htaccess files. As a temp solution I chose to open .htaccess files with Notepad.

This is what I already did (with no luck);

  • My installation folder and workspace folder are both writable.
  • I did several complete re-installs.
  • I removed the .lock file in my workspace folder.
  • I created a new workspace folders and switched to it.
  • I have administrator rights.

Creating a new workspace will fix my problem temporary but the problem is back within a week.

In Aptana 1.2 I never saw a splash screen when Aptana was running and I opened another file. The files were just loaded in the running instance. Is this caused by Eclipse 3.5?

This is quite annoying cause every time the splash screen shows it either takes up 3 seconds of the file won't open due to the locked workspace.

{html}
column164:
07/Jun/11 6:56 PM;sandipchitale;{html}

When we switched to Eclipse 3.5 code base there was a regression in this functionality. It has now been fixed in the master code base but when I tried it today the automatic registration of Aptana Studio as a program to open .html file did not work. I will investigate that. It is true though that in the new scheme the users will see the spash screen momentorily. I think it may be possible to not show the splash screen also. I will investigate.

{html}
column167:
07/Jun/11 6:56 PM;aptana1;{html}

[Workaround removed since it was unnecessarily complicated]

{html}
column168:
07/Jun/11 6:56 PM;ingo;{html}

Actually, there may be an even simpler workaround.

1) Open your aptanaStudio3.ini file. This would be under the Aptana Studio 3 program folder. Likely something like C:\Users\Iusername\AppData\Local\Aptana Studio 3
2) Find the vmargs section. Before that, add:

-name
Aptana Studio 3

Your end result will looks something like:

...
openFile
-name
Aptana Studio 3
-vmargs
...

3) Close and save the file.

{html}
column169:
07/Jun/11 6:56 PM;anitagraham;{html}

Thanks Ingo. I couldn't get your simple method to work (Win7), but the registry edits have fixed the problem for me.

{html}
column171:
07/Jun/11 6:56 PM;ingo;{html}

Confirmed latest windows installer has fixed this issue. Affected users can either:

a) Install a new version when 3.0.2 comes out.
b) Perform the workaround as suggested above.

{html}
column175:
07/Jun/11 6:56 PM;aptana1;{html}

If you are doing this on OS X, you will need to edit the file inside the .app:

  1. Open /Applications/Aptana Studio 3/
  2. Right-click on AptanaStudio3.app and choose "Show package contents"
  3. Open Contents/MacOS
  4. You will find the same AptanaStudio3.ini file mentioned above.
{html}
column176:
07/Jun/11 6:56 PM;brucesauls;{html}

Ingo: thanks, worked great for me, Vista 64-bit. Every annoying behavior corrected makes a better world.

{html}

column179:
24/Jul/12 1:13 AM;cheadley;Issue recreated in Aptana Studio 3, build: 3.3.0.201207231958 in Windows 7 64 bit. Reopening ticket.

Steps used to reproduce:
1. Install Aptana Studio into windows.
2. Open Aptana Studio
3. In windows explorer find a file type associated with Aptana (ex. .js, .html, .xml, .php)
4. Double click that file to open it.

Expected results:
File should be opened in the existing Aptana Studio instance.

Actual results:
Windows calls Aptana Studio causing windows to open a second instance of the program to open the file with. If auto login and auto select workspace are in use this will result in the initial error of the workspace being locked as it is in use by the previous instance.

-name
Aptana Studio 3

However, it doesn't seem to play nicely with my desktop launcher:

[Desktop Entry]
Type=Application

Comment=Aptana Studio 3
Icon=/opt/Aptana_Studio_3/icon.xpm

column1: Investigate Lexing/Parsing warnings from JSLint
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
The following are Lexing/Parsing Warnings generated by JSLint.

||Id||Description||Details||JSLint Option||JSHint Option||
|{color:green}expected_a_b{color}	| Expected '\{a\}' and instead saw '\{b\}'. | ? see this as relating to braces around for/while loops (line 3003, approx), and eqeq (line 2744) and semicolons (2391) | eqeq/es5 | curly/eqeqeq/asi |
|expected_a_b_from_c_d	| Expected '\{a\}' to match '\{b\}' from line \{c\} and instead saw '\{d\}'. | ? |
|identifier_function	| Expected an identifier in an assignment and instead saw a function invocation. | ? |
|missing_property	| Missing property name. | Looks for missing property when defining ES5 getters. |
|{color:green}missing_a{color}	| Missing '\{a\}'. | ? | newcap | newcap |
|missing_a_after_b	| Missing '\{a\}' after '\{b\}'. | ? |
|statement_block	| Expected to see a statement and instead saw a block. | Looks for braces in statement context (i.e. to start a line). | | |
|unclosed	| Unclosed string. | Checks for unclosed strings |
|unclosed_comment	| Unclosed comment. | Checks for unclosed comments. |
|unclosed_regexp | Unclosed regular expression. | checks for unclosed regexps. |
|unexpected_comment	| Unexpected comment. | Looks for comments in JSLint directive sections, html. |

* Check to see if each of these items are covered by our current parser
* If not, write a unit test to cover the case(s) encapsulated by this rule.
column164:
23/Aug/12 3:20 AM;cwilliams;- expected_a_b: This is overloaded and just reports lexing syntax errors, which our parser/lexer should cover.
- expected_a_b_from_c_d: same as above, but more specific in length
- identifier_function: I cannot for the life of me figure out how to trigger this. It is not in JSHint.
- missing_a: Missing tokens (like missing parens after a "new Array" construct, missing case statements under a switch).
- missing_a_after_b: Deals with missing spaces after tokens. I'd consider this to not be useful. We turn it off in JSLint by default and it deals with Crockford's ideal formatting.
- missing_property: See the related ticket I opened. Deals with ES5 getter/setter syntax which we don't yet support.
- statement_block: Added unit test and implemented.
- unclosed: Added unit test in our JSParserValidator tests, we pick this up in parse error.
- unclosed_comment: same as above.
- unclosed_regexp: same as above.
- unexpected_comment: ????
column165: 27/Aug/12 3:57 AM;ingo;Confirmed tests as passing on http://hudson-master.hdqt.appcelerator.com/hudson/job/studio3-core-development-tests/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/com.aptana.editor.js.validator/.

column1: Support Ruby Watch Expressions
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: Support watch expressions in ruby. Looks like we can just port the RDT impl over easily. It's a single class with a couple nested classes in it, and it gets registered via a debug.core extension point.
column164: 07/Jul/11 6:53 AM;k3mist;Any ETA on this feature? I have to resort to using RubyMine for this functionality when needed.
column165:
24/Aug/12 4:10 AM;cwilliams;Merged to 'development', pushed to github. Should be available on the nightly stream starting tomorrow.

To verify:
# Set up your machine for ruby and ruby debugging. (see https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/tis/Ruby+Debugger )
# Create a simple ruby file with the following contents:
{code:ruby}
var = 1
var += 2
pust var
{code}
# Set a breakpoint on the first line
# Debug the file
# In the Debug Perspective, open the "Expressions" view and a the expression {{var}} and another: {{var == 3}}
# Step through the lines and verify the expressions get updated with the values of evaluating them in the Expressions view (1 and false on first line, 3 and true on the third line).

column1: Git tag Aptana Studio builds on push to stable
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Related to APSTUD-7238. As part of that build, (before the push):

* Find the version # in the version.txt file
* See if that git tag has not already been created. If not, create a new tag of the form "vX.X.X.XXXXX" (note the additional "v" at the front)
* Push the tag to the following repos:
** studio3
** studio3-rcp
** studio3-php
** studio3-ruby
** Pydev
** libraries_com
** swt-webkit
** aptana/*.ruble

column164: 19/Jun/12 1:50 PM;ingo;This _might_ be out of our control. See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=382972, but if we are able to fix it, we will.
column165:
20/Jun/12 11:22 PM;ingo;Mike, can you try the following workaround?

# Do "Show package contents" on the Aptana Studio.app.
# Edit Contents/Info.plist.
# Just above \\ 
{code}
</dict>
</plist>
{code} \\
Place this:
{code}
<key>NSHighResolutionCapable</key>
<true/>
{code}
# Log out or make a copy of the app so that OSX will notice the change. 
# Choose "Get Info" on Aptana Studio.app
# Now, the info window will not show "Open in Low Resolution" as checked.
column166: 22/Jun/12 6:43 AM;mwhawkins;It looks a little better I think, but its still a little blurry.  The text in the editor especially.  Thanks.
column167:
16/Jul/12 2:48 AM;abritinthebay;To full fix this you need to make the above change THEN do the following:

# Quit Aptana
# Open up the Aptana folder in ~/Applications
# Copy the Aptana app and paste it so there is a Aptana Copy app.
# Delete the original Aptana app
# Rename the copy back to the original name.
# Done! Restart Aptana!

This is to get around the agressive info.plist caching that OSX does. Once you restart it will then use (and cache) the changed version. 

Text looks SO MUCH better afterwards. It's a huge difference. This fix also means that this is under Aptana's control to fix. Not sure if there's an easier way to kill the cache for the developers though.

Obviously the graphics still need to be updated, but they are a lot less noticeable than the text.
column168: 16/Jul/12 2:50 AM;abritinthebay;Honestly - if the cache is easily flushed - I'd roll out this fix before the graphics are done. It's a major improvement that cannot be understated.
column169: 16/Jul/12 2:54 AM;ingo;I know we can fix the install for new users...I don't know if there is a way to flush the cache automatically, but we can try.
column170: 25/Jul/12 8:31 AM;mxia;Added the field in Info.plist and pushed to development branch. Tested to verify that user could just install the new version on top of the old one to see the effect without having to do the copy/rename step.
column171: 30/Jul/12 7:41 AM;sgibly;Verified build 2.2.0.201207282228 on MacBook Pro with retina display.

Expected Results :

Colorization should remain.

column1: Context menu in HTML editor - submenu 'Publish'
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create Web Project.
2. Create HTML file and open in editor.
3. Open context menu (right click in editor).

h3. Actual Result
Submenu "Publish" is initially enabled. It is disabled when hovering mouse over it.

h3. Expected Result
Submenu "Publish" should be in proper state.
column164: 25/Jul/12 10:27 AM;mxia;Made "Run Web Deployment Wizard" appear for file editors from a non-Titanium project (consistent with when Run Web Deployment Wizard menu appear under Publish in the context menu). Pushed to development branch.
column165:
26/Jul/12 11:44 PM;cwilliams;Verified against Aptana Studio 3, build: 3.3.0.201207261201
Build: jenkins-studio3-rcp-development-967 (origin/development)
Date: 26 July 2012, 12:05:02

column1: Output Studio version to log file on startup
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When scanning log files, it's very difficult to tell the current version of Aptana or Titanium being used, unless it's an error we catch and log ourselves.

The startup of a Studio instance looks like:

{code}
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.net 1 0 2012-07-03 09:13:19.437
!MESSAGE System property http.nonProxyHosts has been set to local|*.local|169.254/16|*.169.254/16 by an external source. This value will be overwritten using the values from the preferences
!SESSION 2012-07-03 09:16:18.256 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.version=1.6.0_33
java.vendor=Apple Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=macosx, ARCH=x86, WS=cocoa, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -keyring /Users/tp1/.eclipse_keyring -showlocation
Command-line arguments:  -os macosx -ws cocoa -arch x86 -keyring /Users/tp1/.eclipse_keyring -consoleLog -showlocation
{code}

Somewhere in there (or right afterwards), we should log an entry (not through IDELog, since we don't want it o be flagged as an error) that shows the current version.

If there is a way we can instead fill in the eclipse.buildId, that's fine too.
column164: 22/Jul/12 8:28 AM;mxia;Fixed by filling in the Studio version number for the eclipse.buildId field (so it will now show "eclipse.buildId=<version>" in the log when starting up). Checked into both development and release branches and for both Aptana and Titanium Studio.
column165:
23/Jul/12 6:28 AM;cwilliams;Verified against Titanium Studio, build: 2.2.0.201207201905
Build: jenkins-titanium-rcp-development-876 (origin/development)

column164:
17/Jul/12 9:32 AM;sgibly;Fixed.

The call for getVariables passed in a Set that we loop on, while the method could add to the set. We now work on a copy of that set.

column164:
17/Jul/12 10:58 AM;sgibly;I could not recreate it, but could see how that can happen.

Fixed by adding a method in the the PHP API index builder that returns 'true' when it's being initialized. We now use this method to check if the index is ready before we try to invoke any ContentAssistUtils methods on it.
column165:
18/Jul/12 2:42 AM;cheadley;Shalom or Ingo,
What is a replication test for this error? Is it just a hover while the indexer is running?
column166:
18/Jul/12 3:46 AM;sgibly;I could not replicate the issue myself, but a possible scenario for this would be:
# Start the Studio with a PHP file open, and immediately hove over a function call that has docs.
# Do a project->clean->clean all and see that the progress view is indexing the API functions. While this happens, hover over a function call (like printf("abc")). 

Both will trigger the 'getHoverInfo' while the index for the PHP API is still building.
column167: 20/Jul/12 2:28 AM;cheadley;Verified by implementing Shalom's test in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.7.4, and Ubuntu 12.04 using Titanium Studio, build: 2.2.0.201207192335. Closing ticket.

column1: Preferences dialog too large
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
At a resolution of 1024x768 some of the preferences are
inaccessible. Notably, the main Pydev and the Pylint
sub item contain preferences that go off the bottom off
the dialog and are not accessible.

These dialogs should probably be reorganized. Having
too many settings on a dialog may be unwise in any case.
column164:
05/Jun/06 11:31 AM;fzadrozny;Logged In: YES 
user_id=617340

The main has already been fixed (changed in: main + typing)
and the pylint panel was changed so that the final message
is shown only on request (a button was added for it).

Fixed for 1.0.9
column165:
15/Jul/12 11:06 PM;tangent_;`Twas brillig, and the slithy toves
  Did gyre and gimble in the wabe:
All mimsy were the borogoves,
  And the mome raths outgrabe.


 

"Beware the Jabberwock, my son!
  The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!
Beware the Jubjub bird, and shun
  The frumious Bandersnatch!"
He took his vorpal sword in hand:
  Long time the manxome foe he sought --
So rested he by the Tumtum tree,
  And stood awhile in thought.
And, as in uffish thought he stood,
  The Jabberwock, with eyes of flame,
Came whiffling through the tulgey wood,
  And burbled as it came!
One, two! One, two! And through and through
  The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!
He left it dead, and with its head
  He went galumphing back.
"And, has thou slain the Jabberwock?
  Come to my arms, my beamish boy!
O frabjous day! Callooh! Callay!'
  He chortled in his joy.



`Twas brillig, and the slithy toves
  Did gyre and gimble in the wabe;
All mimsy were the borogoves,
  And the mome raths outgrabe.

column1: String constructor should not appear off of string instances
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
JS.4.004 of the wiki Web Acceptance Suite says global methods should not appear in Content Assist list for quoted string objects, however if you enter this in a JavaScript file : "message". (quotes and dot operator included), the methods eval and String, which are classified as Global Functions at : http://www.w3schools.com/jsref/jsref_obj_global.asp, will appear in Content Assist.


Steps to Replicate :

1) Open Aptana Studio
2) Open a JavaScript file
3) Enter (including quotes and the dot operator) "characters".


Actual Results :

Content Assist will include the methods eval and String, which is classified as a Global Function at : http://www.w3schools.com/jsref/jsref_obj_global.asp.


Expected Results :

Wiki item JS.4.004 states Content Assist from quoted string objects should not contain Global methods.
column60:
Aptana Studio 3, build: 3.0.7.201112281312
Virtual Machine with Windows XP
column164: 23/Jan/12 7:12 AM;klindsey;To clarify, I believe the issue here is that constructors for a type are appearing as instance properties off of instances of that type.
column165: 05/Feb/12 10:39 PM;nderzhak;This issue latest notification was not sent due to JIRA mail setting. Fixed now. Please check the issue for latests changes.
column166: 05/Jul/12 3:10 AM;ingo;To verifiers: please verify this using jQuery content assist as well.
column167: 05/Jul/12 3:59 AM;cwilliams;Merged to 'release', cherry-picked to 'development, closed code review, pushed to github.
column168: 06/Jul/12 9:20 AM;mxia;A lot of unit tests in JSLintValidatorTests are failing after the commit, so re-opening it for now.
column169: 09/Jul/12 4:12 AM;cwilliams;Pushed a fix for the broken unit tests. I inverted a conditional guard clause to avoid IndexOutOfBoundsExceptions I was seeing in the JSLint validator under dev mode while editing.
column170: 11/Jul/12 11:42 PM;cheadley;Issue still exists in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.7.4, and Ubuntu 12.04 using Titanium Studio build: 2.2.0.201207111953. The global function eval is still listed when following the above steps. Reopening ticket.
column171:
12/Jul/12 3:50 AM;cwilliams;This issue should be fixed.

Clayton: The test here is whether we get Object and String constructors as suggestion on instances of strings, i.e.

{code}
"string_instance".
{code}

We used to show "Object" and "String" constructors as CA proposals, and the fix is not to.

I'm not sure where "eval" came from.
column172: 13/Jul/12 3:46 AM;cheadley;Based retesting on Chris' comment this is verified as fixed in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.7.4 and Ubuntu 12.04 using Titanium Studio build: 2.2.0.201207121931. Closing Ticket.

column1: GIT wants to commit unchanged files on OSX
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
After closing a project and opening it up again later, GIT marks seemingly random files as being changed and then wants to commit them. 
I am 100% positive I did not change these files. It happens on multiple projects. In the example I show a screenshot of files in a Typo3 project, though this happens on other (non-typo3) projects as well.

I never had this issue with other eclipse GIT plugins on comparable code.

Included is a screenshot of the commit window, which seems to detect no difference in file content.
column164: 14/May/12 2:59 AM;ingo;This is a result of some optimizations done on to cut down the amount of time we spend indexing. We need to improve the algorithm to properly compare files.
column165:
22/Jun/12 12:02 AM;cwilliams;Tracked down root cause to git index being out of date, remembered I removed a command to help perf that related to this. So I partially reverted some git perf changes I made - we now run update-index before a refresh (but still do diff refreshes).

Merged to 'development' and 'release', pushed to github.

column1: Find bar tab key should move the focus to the next tab stop, as opposed to insert TABs into the text.
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
The Find bar should interpret tabs as "move to next tab stop", instead of inserting /t tabs. We can change inserting of tabs to be similar to how we add newlines:

-TAB will move to the next control. SHIFT+TAB will move to a previous control
-TAB + (Non-shift modifiers) will enter /t tabs in the text boxes

The tab order has changed. We skip the history toolbars during tab traversal because of this swt bug: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=381149

The history is accessible using the mouse or the implemented shortcut:

-MOD1 (OSX CMD, Windows CTRL) + Up/Down arrow: Replaces the search box with the previous (up) or next (down) history item
column164: 22/Jun/12 9:01 AM;nle;Updated the description with the implemented behavior
column165: 26/Jun/12 1:38 AM;cwilliams;So I can confirm the history, tab and shift+tab behavior, but I am confused by some of the behavior. I can tab from "find" box -> "replace" box -> Find button -> Replace/Find -> Replace -> Replace All -> Case sensitive. But after that, it begins tabbing into the global toolbar for me. It doesn't highlight the other button options (whole word, selection, etc). I'd also assume it'd wrap around back to the Find text box, rather than go into the global toolbar.
column166: 27/Jun/12 2:57 AM;nle;Due to bugs with the tab order and Toolbars, I've removed the toolbars from the tab order. The tab order now is Find Text->Replace Text->Find/Replace/etc buttons (if enabled)

column164:
12/Aug/11 3:31 AM;ingo;Two changes:

* Check for existence of file before actually doing work
* Throw error as a warning instead.

This needs to be updated in all build participants (not just indexers)
column165: 24/Feb/12 12:03 AM;cwilliams;As part of TISTUD-1200 we skipped files that didn't exist, were derived, or were team private. This should definitely alleviate some of these messages/conditions from occurring, though certainly a file could get deleted after that check and before a given participant attempts to read/parse it.
column166: 29/Feb/12 12:39 AM;klindsey;This was mostly fixed with TISTUD-1200, as Chris mentions in the comments. It was still possible for a file to be deleted between the time we test for existence and when we grab the contents of the file. This adds another check when we're grabbing the contents and we return an empty stream if it no longer exists. This avoids a CoreException that would otherwise be thrown by Eclipse.

column168: 05/Apr/12 6:15 AM;mxia;Pushed the fix to release branch.
column169: 06/Apr/12 3:52 AM;klindsey;The failures in this ticket showed issues with HTML, but that was a timing issue. JS and CSS files would fail as well. I believe this needs to be fixed in BuildContext to cover all languages instead of trapping the exception in each language's processor itself.
column170: 06/Apr/12 7:40 AM;mxia;We are now calling IResource.refreshLocal() before getting its content, and we are catching the exception to return an empty string instead of throwing it for callers to handle.
column171: 23/Apr/12 8:39 AM;cheadley;Verified by following provided steps in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.7.3 and Ubuntu 11.10 using Titanium Studio build: 2.0.2.201204201120. Closing ticket.

column1: Convert UserAgentManager to use chained preference stores
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: Currently, we are not using the EclipseUtil.getDefault.getNode() mechanism for setting up defaults. Likewise, we need to use a chained preference store to handle user-level preferences. Once UserAgentManager has been converted to use preferences in this way, the ContentAssist preference page will need to be updated as well. We should move the preference key over to com.aptana.edtior.common where UserAgentManager lives. It currently lives in com.aptana.ui.epl for historical reasons. Note that we will need to migrate any existing values from the old key to the new key.
column164:
06/Apr/12 8:16 AM;sgibly;Implemented (and pushed to 'release').
We migrate the preferences by reading from a chained preference stores, and write back using the com.aptana.editor.common plugin.

Also added support for project-scope settings to provide some base support for APSTUD-4489.
column165: 19/Jun/12 8:26 AM;mxia;This is more of a technical task, and the related ticket (APSTUD-4489) is verified, so will close this one.

column1: Highlighted text opaque, color schemes broken in PyDev
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
My notebook computer, also running Aptana 3, now has the same issue as my desktop.  I have now verified this issue on two different computers, both Windows 7 x64.  

-----

I followed all of instructions in email, attached my theme, reset defaults on annotations and set defaults on theme and as you can see from the attached stillbuggy.png the issue remains.  In order to fix this I need to go to preferences > aptana studio > themes and press "reset defaults" *without changing anything*

Every time I start I need to go do that reset defaults.  I don't think it's the theme: something buggy happens when Aptana initializes that changes something in my settings.  Having to go through settings to undo it is lame, and it has to be a change that happened with the latest upgrade.  Please get someone to fix it... :)

-----

After latest upgrade, highlighted text color (PyDev editor) is opaque and changing theme colors does not work reliably.  All themes show behavior like the attached screenshot: the highlighted text foreground and background are the same color.  Changing selected foreground colors does not work as expected: selecting a dark-colored selection background results in a light-colored background.

Selecting the theme override for pydevOccurrenceIndication seems to fix the issue for the current session, but when I shut down Aptana and restart the highlight is broken again, even though the little 'B' icon next to pydevOccurrenceIndication is still selected.  I need to click it off and back on again to fix the highlight, which again only works until I restart.

I've been using Aptana without issues for at least 6 months prior to this issue, and have not touched color settings in months.  The latest update seems to have broken theme handling.

MOTE UPDATES: See screen2.png attached.  If you look closely, I selected a very dark gray(almost back) color for the line highlight and Aptana is using a bright gray.  Any color I choose for the line highlight is ignored, and Aptana chooses a much brighter color.  Aptana is just ignoring my setting for selected text altogether.  

MORE UPDATES: I have had two instances today where I started Aptana, went in and changed pydevOccurrenceIndication so that I could see highlighted text (the broken same-background-and-foreground bug is 100% repeatable).  After switching to another window and switching back the highlight was broken again, requiring me to change the pydevOccurrenceIndication setting again.  

This is profoundly irritating.  I hope whatever change broke color handling was awesome enough to cause this much pain.

column1: Behavior of JSLint validator options does not match those from JSLint.com
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
JSLint supports the addition of comments to the top of a JavaScript as a means of setting JSLint options.  

The comment:
  /\*jslint white:true\*/
instructs the validator to 'Tolerate messy white space', which more specifically should be set to 'true if strict whitespace rules should be ignored'.
(Full documentation of JSLint options here: http://www.jslint.com/lint.html#options)

However, in Aptana Studio the opposite is occurring.  So setting 'white' to true causes whitespace to become important, rather than be ignored as expected.

I've found that others have mentioned this behavior on Stack Overflow:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6893045/jslint-options-doesnt-seem-to-work-on-aptana-3
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8597253/problems-with-jslint-options-in-aptana-studio-3

I've also found the same reversed logic with: 'plusplus', 'undef', 'regexp', 'nomen', and 'newcap' (and there are likely others).
Other observations:
  - the logic for 'sub' is correct
  - 'continue' signals a 'Bad option' warning.
  - 'eqeq' errors do not seem to be caught.
column164: 19/Jan/12 5:41 AM;jensenbox;I can confirm that the options are effectively being ignored.
column166:
18/Jun/12 12:33 AM;cwilliams;Verified against Titanium Studio, build: 2.1.0.201206172146
Build: jenkins-titanium-rcp-development-787 (origin/development)
Date: 17 June 2012, 21:49:25

Added comments to turn on/off "white" and "pluplus" option on chunks of JS code and verified we got or didn't get the warnings properly.

column1: Placing plugin under dropins folder do not make him load under standalone Aptana Studio 3.1.1
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
After installing standalone Aptana Studio 3.1.1, plugin is not initialized after putting it into {{dropins}} folder.

To make clear, for Aptana Studio 3.0.9 standalone it was possible to place {{features}} and {{plugins}} folder of some plugin into the {{dropins}} folder and after that plugin loads automatically at studio startup. That is documented at [http://wiki.eclipse.org/Equinox_p2_Getting_Started#Supported_dropins_formats] and [http://www.venukb.com/2006/08/20/install-eclipse-plugins-the-easy-way/].

h3. To reproduce
# Download  [Regex Util|http://myregexp.com/eclipsePlugin.html] plugin. It is small and handy plugin and always worked with all Aptana versions.
# Under Aptana Studio 3.1.1 placing its files under {{dropins}} do not make it load. Error log is empty, and Aptana starts as usual, but... without Regex Util plugin.

column1: Allow setting the permissions for both the upload and download of FTP files
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
File permissions are not preserved on file-download from ftp-remote-site.

* File permissions always switch to 600 and folder permissions to 755.
* No default permissions can be defined during ftp-download.

(The FTP settings under "preferences" > "Aptana Studio" > "publishing" > "ftp" only work for the upload process and publishing. See attached file. Same as "advanced settings" while syncing. There should also be download-permission-settings.)

In order to improve the process, suggest adopting a similar UI to Cyberduck (see attached image).

* Upload section
** Preserve permissions
** Choose specific settings for files and folders
* Download section
** Preserve permissions
** Choose specific settings for files and folders
column165: 12/Jun/12 2:08 AM;cheadley;Verified implemented. Downloaded files do not overwrite permissions and permissions are preserved on both upload and download of files in Mac OS 10.7.3 using Titanium Studio build: 2.1.0.201206111802. Closing ticket.

column1: Enable multi-line search in find bar
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
There's _still_ no multi line search/replace! Now I know there's the DRY principle that any good coder should utilize. But there's just tons of situations where it's needed.

Like wireframing/prototyping where the DRY principle is practically not applicable. Also searching other's code for a specific line is much easier if you can just paste a chunk of code into the search bar. You know - tutorials - that some of us have to do to stay on top.

In the meantime, you'll have to use regular expressions (use \R for carriage returns). Longer-term, suggest modifying the find bar to allow for a "multi-line" option.

Proposed spec: https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides2/Multiline+Search+and+Replace
column164:
05/Jul/11 1:19 PM;ingo;Suggest the following UI:

In the find/replace bar, there is a ^ arrow. On clicking that, the bar doubles (or triples) in height, and the boxes turn into multi-line search and replace in the file

If the bar is expanded, the ^ arrow turns into a down arrow. Clicking that collapses the text again (ideally switching the search/replace text into the proper regexes to support any carriage returns entered)

Fabio, is this something we could get done for 3.0.4?
column165:
14/Jul/11 12:07 AM;fzadrozny;I think it could be tackled for 3.0.4...

As for the UI, if it transforms to a multi-line, pressing enter would no longer do the search when it's focused (but I think that could be OK, right?)
column166:
16/Jul/11 11:39 PM;fzadrozny;I was tinkering a bit about this issue... while the proposed solution does work, code-wise it'll make the code considerably more intricate.

So, instead, I'd like to propose that the combo supported adding multi-lines to it (i.e.: Ctrl+V should work with multi-line, but instead of actually creating a multi-line, it'll create a regular expression and set the search for a regular expression with the passed contents).

Maybe even better would be creating an overlay in the combo which when clicked would pop-up a multi-line text which the user could edit, and when the edit finished, it goes back and transforms the code into a regexp -- this could even lead to more fruitful results as we could create a better regexp editor when this option is chosen.

Ideas?

column1: Improve error messages in Outline view when external content is invalid

column59:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new HTML file
# Add the following content:\\
{code}
<script src="http://www.google.com"></script>
<script src="/test.js"></script>
{code}
# Expand each of the nodes in the outline
## "Cannot recover from syntax error"
## "Unable to resolve file"

For both error messages, it writes them out to the log file as errors. They should instead be trace messages, and in both cases, they should contain the file trying to be read to make diagnosis easier.
column164:

column170: 20/Apr/12 12:23 AM;cwilliams;After a little research reproducing this: This doesn't happen on Mac, and on Windows the IDE is picking up the file events from outside the IDE - but the git support is not properly "reacting" to them. My guess is that the listener that forces refreshes of the git status on changes is breaking due to some path issue (we take the path of the changed file, then try to find the corresponding file from a relative path in the git repo, and then update our git status for it if it's under the repo - it's probably not generating that relative path properly).
column171: 20/Apr/12 2:54 AM;cwilliams;Found I was using improper implementations of generating repo relative paths in a couple locations, rather than using the correct one available in GitRepository.repoRelativePath(). Replacing them with calls to that should fix this issue for Windows users.

column1: Add "Submit a Bug" feature to Aptana Studio Help menu
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
This would crib from the previous implementation we had for Aptana Studio some years ago:

# User needs to set up their JIRA account. There should be a preference area for that
# When filing a bug, ask them the following:

# A summary of the issue (mandatory)
# Steps to reproduce the problem (mandatory)
# Include log file, current platform configuration and any other log items
# If possible, properly assign component and scope to the item in question (should be part of the method call instantiating this dialog)
# Allow them to attach a screenshot

The same item would be available from the file menu, though some of these things would not be filled out (i.e. component, scope).

This would use the JIRA API to submit the bug (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+RPC+Services)

column1: Create sub-folder under temp for our temporary files

column59: If i work with a lot of FTP connections, after some hours my /tmp directory is getting very nasty. If you have some other tools that work directly in /tmp, you don't find your own files anymore. (see the screenshot) I think it would be a very nice feature if i could determain a custom path for this files. Normaly on Linux you have /tmp/aptanavfs/... . You can see other tools like pulse, orbit, ssh, ... always using their own subdirectory.

column1: Add new "push new branch to remote" command to Git menu
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When sharing a local project with a new Github repo, a user is instructed to do the following:

# git remote add origin git@github.com:username/project.git
# git push -u origin master

The first one can be done inside studio with "Add remote" but not the second one, where the user is forced into the terminal. Chris suggested a "Push new Branch to Remote" menu option to help with this step.
column164:
20/Jun/11 3:19 AM;cwilliams;The "-u" switch is shorthand for "--set-upstream" which hooks up the branch tracking. But, it's a new git 1.7 switch, and we set 1.6 as our minimum git requirement, so I'll probably have to leave it off, or sniff version or something if we really want it - but it's unnecessary if the remote is origin, typically.

Not sure what sort of UI we want for this... we need to let user pick the local branch, and the remote (and also optionally the remote branch and options/switches).
column165: 20/Jun/11 4:24 AM;ingo;Could we offer a very simple UI to start that encapsulates the case found above and perhaps some other very common cases? Two comboboxes, auto-filled to mirror the above values? That would allow you to type in your own values if the combo boxes did not have the correct items.
column166: 22/Jun/11 3:37 AM;cwilliams;If we assume current branch like other commands, we can just pop the same menu UI as we do for say switching branches - where the user just then picks the remote to push to.

column1: Add support for union, intersection, and grouping operators to scope selectors
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
TextMate scope syntax supports '&', '|', and parenthesis to create more explicit scope selectors. Our current implementation supports "descendant selector", ',', and '-' (negative lookahead). In order to support these new operators, we will need to create a true parser. We should be able to use existing ISelectorNode (the AST nodes); however, there is a subtle difference between a descendant selector and the & operator. A descendant selector can match any segment from the current position within the scope to the end of the scope. The & operator is used for intersection, so it will need its own node type. Additionally, we will need a node for parenthesis to make it easier to reverse an AST back to source. We use the source for some types of equality testing.

One reference:

* http://lists.macromates.com/textmate/2008-June/025964.html
column164: 30/Mar/12 3:17 AM;klindsey;Created a lexer and parser for scope selectors. The new infrastructure adds support for '|', '&', and grouping (parentheses). Also fixed negative lookahead to compare all segments in a scope to the end of the scope instead of the next segment only.
column165: 04/Apr/12 10:17 PM;ingo;Apparently, one of the unit tests (ExpandVerifyKeyListener) uses a scope with an underscore in the name. Chris suggests we should support that as well.
column166: 04/Apr/12 11:41 PM;klindsey;Added underscore and numbers as a valid characters within scope names
column167: 06/Apr/12 3:10 AM;cwilliams;Closing technical ticket. Verifying APSTUD-4570 seems good enough alongside the unit tests.

column1: Implement ParseNode#trimToSize similar to ArrayList#trimToSize
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: In our continuing effort to improve performance, we're currently making a pass to reduce the footprint of collections, as possible. Our ParseNode implementation mirrors ArrayList in how it grows its underlying children array. We should add a trimToSize method so those arrays can be paired down to the minimum size. Probably a ParseRootNode should implement a method to visit all descendants (using a queue) and invoke their trimToSize methods. It seems like our parsers should do that once parsing is complete.
column164: 11/Apr/12 7:15 AM;klindsey;We now have the ability to trim ParseNode child node backing arrays much like ArrayList#trimToSize does with its backing array. This includes generalized tree walking code which allows a function to be applied to each node as it is visited. There are associated unit tests that were used to verify that trimming had an effect. Given the results of that test, this is being applied to HTML ASTs only.
column165: 12/Apr/12 1:57 AM;cwilliams;Closing since this is really a technical task

column1: Lazily load "additional info" for Javascript content assist
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: We pre-populate the additional info popup strings for every Javascript CA proposal. If we implement ICompletionProposalExtension5 we can return the additional proposal info for PropertyElementProposal on-demand, which saves us generating all of the strings in advance and instead populating it when the particular proposal is selected.

column1: PHP: Unable to format string with interleaved comments
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column164:
13/Mar/12 11:40 AM;sgibly;Fixed.

(The issue was that the formatter failed computer the dot operator range when a comment appeared after it.)
column165: 20/Mar/12 3:03 PM;ingo;I get the same error about unable to format in Titanium Studio, build: 2.0.0.201203202130
column166:
20/Mar/12 4:51 PM;sgibly;It's actually a different error now. looks like it's coming from the HTML formatter, and is a result of a faulty node merge (PHP and HTML).
Will try to fix this asap.
column167:
12/Apr/12 6:14 AM;sgibly;Fixed.
This was an off-by-one issue with the HTML formatter (we run both HTML and PHP formatters for PHP files).
The problem was reproducible _only_ when the PHP closing tag was the last character in the document. Adding a space at the end of the file caused it to format with no problems, so I figured it's an off-by-one issue and fixed it.
column168: 13/Apr/12 1:19 AM;cheadley;Verified fixed in Windows 7, Mac OS 10.7.3, and Ubuntu 11.10 using Titanium Studio build: 2.1.0.201204121528. Closing ticket.

column1: Replace HTML Tidy Validator with a build participant using our AST/parser
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: We currently use Tidy as a separate vendor plugin that provides the JAR and pipe the HTMl source to it, then read the output and generate warnings/errors. This approach has been notably slow and memory-intensive. Given that we are already parsing the file and generating an AST, it should be much faster and leaner to provide a build participant that traverses the AST to provide all or most of the same functionality. Also, we'd have control over the impl so we can update as necessary for changes to HTML (like HTML 5 elements, which tidy complains about).

column1: Unable to acquire parser pool for content type: "com.aptana.editor.text.content-type.generic" when opening Studio log file
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Steps to reproduce:

# Open up Studio, Troubleshooting, and turn on INFO-level logging for com.aptana.parsing
# Open the Studio log file
# Switch to another file
# Switch back to the log file. See this in the log.

It appears that we don't need to be doing any parsing in a test file, so we don't need to ask for a parser. It was been suggested we could override a few methods in TextEditor to do nothing in the this case, but that needs to be investigated for side effects.
column164: 26/Oct/11 2:29 AM;ingo;Decision is that TextEditor should get a no-op parser.

column1: Exclude files from the deploy tools using paths rather than by file types
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Currently there is only an option to cloak file types from the deployment assistent. But very often it's not only file types with sould be excludet. For an example. I have a PHP project remote and local, i have for example local other usernames and passwords for the database connection. So i have to skip on every deployment the system/config/dbconfig.php or i would kill the live system. Currently there is no way, because cloaking *.php is not realy an option.

I think a textfield where i can store the complete path would be very useful. The syntax could be like in an .gitignore file.

column164:
26/Mar/12 8:51 AM;klindsey;Now checking for possible null values during shutdown in build and indexing related code. Also made indexing and builds cancelable in the progress monitor.

# Create a new empty workspace
# Create a new empty Ruby Project
# Open the Progress View
# Create a new empty Ruby file. You should see Ruby indexing (something like core stubber) running at this point.
# Quit the IDE

The IDE should quit immediately and no NPE should appear in the log file associated with the workspace

# Create a new Web Project
# Open the Progress View
# Copy a large web project in that project. You should see indexing running at this point.
# Cancel indexing in the Progress View by clicking the red box next to the indexing task

Indexing should stop as soon as the current file in the view is done indexing.

# Create a new Web Project
# Open the Progress View
# Copy a large web project in that project. You should see indexing running at this point.
# Quit the IDE

A dialog should appear continuing to show the progress of indexing. Click the red box next to the indexing item. The IDE should finishing shutting down as soon as the current file in the view is done indexing.

column1: Change default URL for "Add Remote" Git dialog box
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Currently, when adding a remote, we default to:

git://github.com/username/project.git, which is read-only

Suggest instead we default to:

git@github.com:username/project.git, which is read-write

Alternately, we might ask the user if they are a contributor to the project, or just an observer, and perhaps offer a switch betwen the two optons

column1: Add .location property to file templates
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
{html}

From the current system:

template "Custom Template" do |t|
  t.filetype = "*.html"
  t.invoke do |context|
    ENV['TM_DATE'] = Time.now.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
    raw_contents = IO.read("#{File.dirname(ENV['TM_BUNDLE_SUPPORT'])}/templates/html5.html")
    raw_contents.gsub(/\$\{([^}]*)\}/) {|match| ENV[match[2..-2]] }
  end
end

bringing it inline with something like project templates:

project_template "Basic Web Template2" do |t|
  t.type = :web
  t.location = "templates/basic_web_template.zip"
  t.description = "A basic template which includes only a default index.html file"
end

i.e.:

template "Custom Template" do |t|
  t.filetype = "*.html"
  t.location = "templates/html5.html"
end

By default this WOULD DO environment substitution.

{html} Also add a "replace_parameters" setting to allow turning on/off parameter substitution (identical to project templates)

column1: Use Aptana theme for Aptana editors only
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
[Originally posted here|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7438868/eclipse-use-aptana-theme-for-javascript-editor-only]

When I use Aptana in Eclipse, I like the Cobalt theme for my Javascript. However, this theme ends up making my SVN diff-ing nearly impossible for my Java files, because the background is dark blue, and the text is black in the compare editor.

I've look all over the preferences in Eclipse, and can't figure out a way to only use the Aptana Cobalt theme for editing my Javascript files.

Here are the things I've tried: - I've made the Aptana JavaScript editor the default for ".js" files - I've made the default for ".txt" and ".java" the normal editors (non-Aptana, whatever they are) - I've tried setting the theme, and making sure that General > Appearance > Colors and Fonts still has all the defaults - I've verified that if I changed the theme to something with a white background, my diff-ing editor gets changed and becomes readable

What else can I do?! I just want to use Aptana for Javascript, not my default diff theme.
column164: 04/Oct/11 2:39 AM;webnesto;I would consider this a high priority bug - it makes the dark themes completely unusable if you are making regular SVN commit/diffs.  All of my diffing appears as black text on dark background when I use any theme with a dark backround - thus making my merging impossible.  Ergo - unusable.
column165: 21/Dec/11 12:20 AM;cwilliams;I'm unable to reproduce this on my machine. I have a dark theme, installed Subversive, and then checked out a project containing JS files using Subversive. I then made a minor change to a file and did Compare with > Base from Working Copy. The compare editor opened and used the theme bg/fg colors (white text on a dark grey bg). It didn't properly syntax color the two compare panes, but I also didn't get what the user reported of black text on the dark grey bg.
column166: 21/Dec/11 12:21 AM;cwilliams;Screenshot showing what I get using compare
column167: 21/Dec/11 12:24 AM;sadkinson;Your screenshot shows compare for Javascript files.  The broken behavior I was seeing happens when comparing Java files (my project has both types of files).
column168:
21/Dec/11 2:47 AM;webnesto;I have a screenshot of a JavaScript diff showing black text on the black background, but I don't seem to be able to add screen shots to the ticket.  I'll be happy to send to someone.

NOTE: I'm assuming that my issue may be related to the fact that I also have the Eclipse WTP installation and therefore have other JS editors that could be competing for the diff view - but I really don't know enough about the Eclipse architecture to comment intelligently on that.

column1: Create utility class to auto-composite wizard images
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
When creating a wizard, we manually composite a foreground image onto a background image, but this is an intensive process.

Instead, create a utility class that auto-composites a supplied top image against a standard background image on demand. Thus, if a person wants to create a new wizard image, they need not manually have to do so.

It will center the top image (horizontally and vertically) on the bottom image

column1: Set performance test job to assert against baseline
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Once we have a baseline set of data, make sure the performance job is then configured to assert against that data for performance regressions. This involves setting a property on the job of:
extraPerfArgs=-Declipse.perf.assertAgainst=build=<baseline>

where <baseline> is the studio version string we used to generate the baseline.

However, the failures didn't raise any errors in the test, so I had to uncomment out some code in the eclipse performance testing plugin so it should fail the unit test if the performance fails.

column1: Add GIT Tagging Feature
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
It would be really nice to add the ability to Tag releases in GIT using the Aptana menu items. Currently you can add Branches, Push, Pull, Commit, etc. but there is no support for tagging.

The workaround right now is to open the terminal console and manually type in something like this:

git tag -a 1.23 -m "1.23"
git push --tags

It would really save me time if we could just do this from the dialog menus.

Thanks for considering this feature!

Sincerely,
Leighton Whiting
column164: 14/Nov/11 11:04 PM;cwilliams;Pushed "Create tag" command/menu to 'development'
column165: 20/Mar/12 5:54 AM;cwilliams;Verified create tag functionality. Linked tickets cover other use cases

column1: The "Choose Connection" dialog won't "Remember my decision"
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
The goal:
- A single directory in my project ("src"), containing files for the root of the site I am developing.
- A local project copy which automatically syncs with the development server via an SFTP connection ("dev").
- An additional FTP connection ("prod") to the production server, to which I can deploy (or "Synchronize") "src" at will.

The Setup:
- Created two connections, linking "src" to "dev" ("Local <\-> Dev") and "src" to "prod" ("Local <\-> Prod").
- Configured "Deployment Settings" (from right-click on "src") with settings for "dev".
- Configured "Properties->File Transfer->Connection" (from right-click on "src") to refer to "dev", with "Use the connection as default" checked.

The problem:

1. Change a file and save it.

1r. The "Choose Connection" dialog appears, with "Local <-> Prod: prod" automatically selected and "Remember my decision" unchecked.

2. Select "Local <-> Dev: dev".

3. Check "Remember my decision".

4. Click "OK"

4r. The Synchronization takes place

6. Repeat Step 1, on the same file.

6r. Steps 1r, 2, 3, and 4 should now be skipped but they are not.

Additional details:

- Primary Project Nature: Web

- Additional Project Nature: PHP

- Project contains a single directory called "src", containing files for the root of the website I am developing.

- Connection Manager lists two connections (in addition to the "Default"):
-- "Local <-> Dev": Associates the local "src" directory with an SFTP connection to a sub-directory on the development server
-- "Local <-> Prod": Associates the local "src" directory with an FTP connection to the root directory on the production 
server, which is on a completely different domain than the development server.

- The "dev" server is hosted with Hostmonster on a shared server.
- I do not know how or with whom the "prod" server is hosted. SFTP does not seem to be available on this server, hence my use of FTP instead.

column1: Improve build time of unit test build
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: The unit test build on development takes way too long. Typically over 40 minutes. We need to investigate to see if we can help speed it up at all, since the actual text execution appears to take less than 9 minutes.
column164: 30/Sep/11 1:15 AM;cwilliams;I'm in the process of installing the 'timestamper' jenkins plugin which adds timestamps to the console log entries, so we can at least try and gauge what parts are taking the most time.
column165:
04/Oct/11 12:19 AM;cwilliams;Well, we were running build twice, which also installed dependencies twice. so I fixed that, which should shave off a few minutes.

It looks like installing the dependencies take a few minutes to install in total. I'm not really sure what we can do to speed that up. They're getting installed from the NFS mostly, so I'm assuming that isn't the slowdown there. Maybe we can batch install multiple features at once to speed it up?
column166: 12/Dec/11 12:53 AM;cwilliams;Looks like the p2 director application can take a comma delimited list of repositories/features to install, so I'm going to try batching the installs of dependencies all together to see if that speeds things up.
column167: 20/Dec/11 3:50 AM;cwilliams;This is better now with the build overhaul, though still quite slow compared to what I'd like...
column168: 19/Mar/12 8:22 AM;cwilliams;Closing technical task

column1: Consider caching UserAgentElements used in JS indexing
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: During profiling of indexing for a large JS project, I noticed that we had a large number of allocations of UserAgentElements. There is a finite list of these, so we should be able to cache these instances, thus avoiding a large number of allocations and garbage collection steps.
column164: 31/Jan/12 7:48 AM;klindsey;Created a static cache within UserAgentElement. Hashing can now occur on fields values without having to create an instance of UserAgentElement. These combined implement a "create" method that either returns a cached value or creates a new and caches that value for next time.
column165: 19/Mar/12 6:16 AM;klindsey;This is a technical task and the results of this change are not reflected in the UI to be able to test and confirm this ticket. There are unit tests in the com.aptaha.editor.js.tests plugin in com.aptana.editor.js.contentassist.JSUserAgentCachingTests that verifies that we are using caching for these elements and that it is working as expected.

column1: Samples View Does Not Reflect All Edits Or Project Deletions
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Sample edits now show up immediately in the Sample view, but if the end user deletes the Sample project the Samples view still displays the entry until the end user cycles Studio (please see capture at http://www.screencast.com/t/sVXo2DW2jdU). Also, editing a Sample then undoing edits and saving causes some odd effects (please see capture at http://www.screencast.com/t/7Knbg4TqE).


Steps to Replicate :

1) Open Aptana Studio
2) Select File > New > Ruby Project, select a project name, click the Next button, select the Ruble Template, then click Finish

column1: CSS Formatter does not place an 'At-Rule' in a new line (like @media)
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
The CSS formatter is handling the @media rule correctly for trailing spaces after rule, however if there is a rule before an @media rule the formatter acts as if there is an end of file after the antecedent rule : try formatting : "h1{}p{}@media print{}h2{}@media screen{}@media print, screen{}h3{}h4{}". By doing so you will also notice the formatter does not apply the configured number of lines after a rule if that rule is at the end of the file.


Steps to Replicate :

1) Open Aptana Studio
2) Open an empty CSS file
3) Open Preferences > Aptana Studio > Formatter > CSS > Blank Lines and set Lines After CSS Rule to a non-zero value
4) Type "h1{}p{}@media print{}h2{}@media screen{}@media print, screen{}h3{}h4{}"
5) Select Source > Format


Actual Results :

The formatter does not add the selected number of lines after a rule prior to an @media rule.


Expected Results :

The formatter should add the selected number of lines after all rules.

column1: Eclipse gives 'out of memory' when saving root module (__init__.py) of a package in PyDev
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
create a python package:
/ - package_name
---- __init__.py
---- other_file.py

add code to __init__.py  and save it - an out of memory error pops up and it asks if I want to exit the workbench.

Running on Windows 7 x64, Eclipse 3.7 using PyDev perspective. Happens on multiple computers - all running Windows 7 x64 and Eclipse 3.7.

h3. Actual Result
no message - just save the file

h3. Expected Result
error message - file still saves.
column164:
20/Jun/12 8:54 AM;ultraayla;Just another note: I couldn't seem to get it to do this for a brand new package, but it happens across multiple packages I have in separate eclipse projects (all versioned by Hg, but not from within Eclipse). I'll see if I can find a more accurate set of steps to reproduce.

The specific message I get in the Details section of the errors is: 'An internal error occurred during: "Building workspace".
Java heap space'
column165:
20/Jun/12 9:35 PM;fzadrozny;Hi Nick, 

It's giving an out of memory error on a very standard place: just reading a file and putting its contents into the memory. So, the choices are:

1. Either you have a really large file which will consume all memory just by reading it (in which situation raising the max available memory is the only solution).
2. Maybe PyDev (or some other plugin you're using) is having leaks -- in which case, even raising the memory won't help you :).

To properly diagnose that, I need a memory dump of your current contents (please do that before raising your memory). To do that, edit your eclipse.ini and add the following:

-vmargs
-XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError

(reference: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/MemoryAnalyzer)

Note that this has to be in its own line (after the -vmargs) in that file -- see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Eclipse.ini for a reference -- don't duplicate -vmargs if it's already there :)

Then, reproduce the situation, get that dump (should be in the same place where your executable is), zip it (as otherwise it'll be too big) and attach it to this issue.

After that, please try raising your maximum amount of memory and let me know if it still happens... try something as:

-vmargs
-Xms40m
-Xmx512m

or you can try to raise that even a bit further (if you have an out of memory with that configuration, please also zip it and attach it to this bug -- it's possible that too big to attach it here, in that case, please upload it somewhere else and point me to that zipped file so that I can get it.
column166:
20/Jun/12 11:02 PM;fzadrozny;Ok, actually, I found an issue on closer inspection: it's loading files into the memory when that should not be needed (in your case, it's probably loading some mercurial files).

I'll make a fix for that ASAP.
column167:
21/Jun/12 1:07 AM;fzadrozny;Ok, just issued a fix. 

The problem was that on a change in an __init__.py file, it'd load the contents of the files in that same folder and below. While it'd only load the file to throw the contents away again, the problem observed is that there was probably a big file in that structure which was too big to simply load.

It should be reproduceable by creating a pydev project, configuring the pythonpath, creating the structure:

/package
/package/__init__.py
/package/600MB_file <- when __init__.py is changed, it'd try to load the contents of this file and would eventually get out of memory (in the original use-case it seems it was loading contents from the mercurial repo).
column168: 21/Jun/12 1:32 AM;ultraayla;HI Fabio, sorry for the delayed response and not getting to the first couple message. Thanks for the quick response. Each of the packages I have does have large files in the underlying folder structure - When this first started happening, that's what I'd attributed it to, but I forgot that the second package it happened in had that too. This should fix my issue. Thanks!

column1: Create wrapper for InstanceScope() and DefaultScope() in code
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
InstanceScope() and DefaultScope() constructors have been deprecated in Eclipse 3.7. However, the replacement methods (InstanceScope.INSTANCE) is only available in Eclipse 3.7, so we cannot universally switch to it yet. Adding @SuppressWarnings("deprecation") to all usages is problematic, since it will display "Unused annotation" in Eclipse 3.6

Suggest making wrapper methods for the above items and adding a single @SuppressWarnings to those instances. Thus, we only have two warnings in the problems view rather than the hundred or so we have now.
column164: 15/Jul/11 4:53 AM;ingo;Added wrappers as suggested.
column165: 14/Aug/12 6:55 AM;cheadley;Closing ticket based on time in production.

column1: Warn user if they are creating project in an area with pre-existing files
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
{html}

This change should apply to all new project wizards we support.

If a user unchecks the "use default location" checkbox, provide a warning message right below the location field indicating if the location in question already has pre-existing files. Since the path can be long, make sure it's easy to see the full path to which the user is saving the project.

{html}

column1: Save all does not trigger "Automatically sync my changes with the remote site"
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
I use "Automatically sync my changes with the remote site" -> "Automatically sync from my machine to the remote site": if I use "Save", Aptana actually upload file on save, that's what I need.

I often modify more files, before saving. So I always use "Save all" (I use a shortcut for it, and it is the only way I'm used to save) to save them all in once, but in this case Aptana does not upload any file.

I ask for "Save all" triggering "Automatically sync..." on each files that is saved; else I suggest a "dedicated" command, if most people don't like the behavior I ask for.

Thank you for attention,
Fabio.

My project indicated that I didn't have a python interpreter configured. I managed to eventually find the dialog, clicked "auto-configure" and everything appears to be fine.

Suggest two steps. Clicking on the error icon in the project brings up a dialog asking if you'd like to configure the interpreter. column1: Consider improving the performance of StringUtil.join
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: During profiling I noticed a large number of calls to StringUtil.join. At times, this method appeared as a hot spot as well. I believe the current implementation can be improved by pre-allocating a char[] of the destination size followed by copying of the strings and delimiters into this array. This is similar to what StringBuilder is doing; however, we avoid a number of method calls and we have the advantage of knowing the resulting size a priori. Note that StringBuilder does allow the initial capacity to be defined. FWIW, I had made similar changes in ParseNode for the child arrays (replaced ArrayList with our own inline implementation) and this affected performance dramatically.
column164: 14/Feb/12 3:31 AM;klindsey;Re-implemented StringUtil.join resulting in a 2-4 times increase in performance depending on its input.
column165: 19/Mar/12 6:01 AM;klindsey;This was a technical task that doesn't expose a way to test this in the UI. There are unit tests in com.aptana.core.util.StringUtilTest in the comp.aptana.core.tests plugin. testBothJoins compares the previous implementation to the new implementation where we're seeing roughly a 2x increase in speed.

column1: "Choose Connection" dialog refers users to a non-existent property page "Properties:Synchronization"
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
1. Right-click a directory in the project and expand the "Deploy" menu item.

2. Select "Deploy -> Run Web Deployment Wizard...".

3. Configure an FTP connection, selecting "Automatically sync my changes with the remote site".

4. Click OK and allow the sync to take place.

5. Change a file in the project and save it.

The "Choose Connection" dialog displays.
The caption underneath "Remember my decision" reads as follows:

"Access this setting in the Properties:Synchronization property page."

As far as I can tell, this property now resides in the "Properties:File Transfer" property page.

column1: Use initialCapacity when generating collections in CollectionsUtil
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59: Current CollectionsUtil#newMap/newSet/newList create their collections using the default constructors. However, this could cause more memory to be used than is needed to contain the items that will be added to them. Additionally, if the collection has to be resized, that introduces a slightly performance decrease. To avoid both of these issues, we should use the constructors that allow us to define an initial capacity, especially since we already know how many items are going to be added to the collections.
column164: 06/Mar/12 1:53 AM;klindsey;Likewise, we should be able to use ArrayList#ensureCapacity and/or ArrayList#trimToSize in addToList, assuming the incoming List is of that type.
column165: 08/Mar/12 3:22 AM;cwilliams;Addressed review feedback, merged to development, pushed, closed code review.
column166: 08/Mar/12 8:50 AM;mxia;Verified the code change and the unit tests passed.

column1: "select tag area" feature
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
{html}

Assigned to Tender discussion #896. See Tender request below. Suggestion is to allow one-click or shortcut access to select the content of a tag pair. Suggest modifying HTML ruble command to select tag pair and content to just select tag content

On october 2008 I made this feature request.

http://support.aptana.com/asap/browse/STU-2511

"Select tag area"

This is a feature that every text editor should have, if it is designed to edit html, xhtml or any syntax that envelopes content in matched tags.
When it is available, it significantly cuts down on the time spent editing complex markup.

Unfortunately, only one tool I know of has this. Quanta plus. An old, buggy and tired editor that I can't live without.

This feature becomes indispensible once you are familair with it.

So, I logged a request back in october 2008, when a much earlier version on aptana is in circulation.
I occaisonally fire up aptana to remind myself of it's potential, and to make sure I haven't overlooked any kiler features that make me stick with it.

But, I'm afraid that I'm dissapointed that this basic feature is still unavailable. And I can't justify using aptana for future projects.

At the moment I am using quanta and a heavily customized emacs environment that allows me to code freely in html, css, js, php, python and my frameworks of choice. I dislike having to use more then one text editor. I'd love to just use aptana. But, without a feature analogous to "select tag area", I'm afraid it's game over.

{html}
column164:
07/Jun/11 7:36 PM;ingo;{html}

The current command:

Current command:

require 'ruble'

command 'Select Tag Content' do |cmd|
  cmd.key_binding = 'CONTROL+M2+,'
  cmd.scope = 'text.html'
  cmd.output = :discard
  cmd.input = :none
  cmd.invoke do |context|
    offset = context.editor.caret_offset
    root_node = context.editor.editor_part.file_service.parse_result
    node = root_node.getNodeAtOffset(offset)
    # This selects the open tag, the content and the end tag
    context.editor.selection = (node.getStartingOffset...node.getEndingOffset + 1)
  end
end
{html}
column166:
07/Jun/11 7:36 PM;ingo;{html}

Added "Select Tag Content" command, bound to Shift + Ctrl + /. Selects the content of the tag surrounding the current element.

{html}

column1: The editor find toolbar interrupts certain keyboard shortcuts
column11: Web application development IDE focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python and Ruby
column59:
Scenario:
You have several tabs open, and the cursor/focus is somewhere within the "Find" toolbar that appears at the bottom of the screen (shortcut = Cmd+F).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open a file in the studio editor.
2. Open the find toolbar (CMD+F).
3. With focus in the toolbar press CMD+tab.

Expected behavior:
User should be able to use OS keyboard shortcuts while in Studio.

Actual behavior:
Keyboard shortcuts do no work while focus is on the find toolbar.

Note:
This also happens for the Open Resource shortcut (CMD+T) and the Close Window shortcut (CMD+W).
